Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Nebekaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown for a recent business trip. Location was excellent, service was good, but the room was small and very noisy. Upon check-in, we failed to notice that this room bordered the elevator shaft, which rattled away all night ever time someone used the elevator. Also, we could hear every word spoken in the room adjacent to ours (particularly those spoken at 3am!). In hindsight, I'm sure we could have asked to change rooms, so I certainly don't fault the hotel. Just beware of it if you are not a heavy sleeper. The building is aged and some areas could have used some work, but the views were unbelievable from the higher floors, so it's worth asking for something with a view if you will spend any time at all in the room. If you're looking for breakfast, the West Egg was a great little diner just four or five blocks away. Ask the concierge for a list of breakfast places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in need of room remodeling”
Reviews.Author: section
Reviews.Content: First off, it's a fantastic location. The lobby, bar, concierge lounge and entrances all look nice and up to date. It's a good value when priced against some nearby hotels, but then you enter the rooms. They are quite simply too old. Peeling paint, closet doors that don't shut, too many layers of paint and chipped desks and tables. If you don't mind and plan to spend as much time as possible enjoying Chicago, then the price can be very good for that stellar location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Views”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseheads
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and it did not disappoint. There were many great restaurantss and shops nearby. The service was excellent. Despite the fact that it seemed busy, we never had to wait for an elevator. Our room was indeed quite small but doable for a weekend. The view from our room, however, was very nice. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: macten
Reviews.Content: when in Chicago , a great place to stay ,good restaurant , a block form the Michigan drive , ,good reatrauants around and helpful staff . comfort and clean

Reviews.Title: “A change for the better”
Reviews.Author: joyosity
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in the past but was never really impressed. Other than the great location, this Marriott seemed like any other ordinary domestic Marriott. But as soon as my taxi pulled up this time, I could tell that something was different. The doorman, Steve, called in to the front desk and started my check in before I even got out of the taxi. When I walked in there was a greeter to show me where the Elite desk was, which was an entirely separate counter than the regular registration desk (I'm used to seeing the Elite registration set up as a separate line at the end of the regular registration desk, but there's usually no one manning it so it's not very helpful). When I came back into the lobby the staff remembered my name. Little things like that really made a difference to me. I'm definitely going to try to stay here again more often!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant & professional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CentralLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of weeks ago for our Bulls/Blackhawks "fun" weekend. We stayed here because of the fantastic location to Michigan Avenue, and local pubs and restaurants. So much is within walking distance. We had the "shopping package" which included breakfast the next morning (either buffet downstairs or room service up to $45), and a $50 gift card for the mall next to the hotel! The rate was about $214 or so + tax, and was a fabulous deal! Rooms are a tad small, but clean and nice. We weren't in our room much to care about the size anyway. Room service was prompt, delicious and arrived at the time we asked for. The beds were super comfortable,and I slept like a baby! Everyone at this hotel was very professional and accommodating! They did charge us incorrectly on our credit card for the room service, but I think that was my fault for not telling the server at the time that it was part of our package, but when I called the hotel, they immediately credited my card since it was part of the package...no problems and I would stay there again in an instant! Thanks for a terrific stay!

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were small”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little small compared to many upper end hotels I've stayed in, but that's probably typical of this area. There's also no cheap place to park! The best rate I found was $33 in an offsite garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TechDbug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week for business. I've stayed at a lot of Marriott hotels (I am a Marriott platinum member), and this is one of the best Marriott hotel that I've stayed in. The staff are great and the location is excellent. This hotel is surrounded by restaurants and there's a Walgreen a block away that's open 24/7 in case you need something in a middle of the night. The bed is super comfortable and the hotel offers a great view. There are two gyms (one for cardio and one for weight), and a pool. When I was there, the pool was a bit dirty and need some cleaning. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel and I would certainly stay here next time I come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I am totally satisfied with my decision to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Sthompson77
Reviews.Content: I could not wait to write a review about my stay here. It was awesome! EVERY staff member was curteous, helpful and nice. They ended every statement "Have a Magnificent Day!". They seem geniunely happy to work there but not that in a creepy way. I was very surpised at the service at this hotel, I have never had such good service. My family and I usually stay at resorts and don't interact with staff as much as we did here. My only complaint is the food was nasty that we ordered from room service, it was pizza - go out to eat. My kids hardly ate one slice, so that was a waste of money. Coffee maker wasn't working the 2nd day and I called front desk. I would say in about 5 minutes a housekeeper brought another coffee maker and tried the old coffee maker in the bathroom to find out that it was the plug not the coffee maker. Less than 5 more minutes a maintenance guy came and asked if I mind if he'd fix it now and I told him yes. He said okay and then offered me some complimentary coupons for various activities just for my inconvenience. That was very thoughtful and considered. I will stay at this hotel next time I am in Chicago but won't order room service again :-)

Reviews.Title: “magnificent smiles!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaHall
Reviews.Content: There were so many warm, friendly people at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile made this stay great! From the bellman, Miguel, who was such a great embassador, to the concierge staff, to the housekeeping staff that helped make my visit memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby and staff, need to update rooms”
Reviews.Author: darko31
Reviews.Content: Great experience in Chicago. Hotel was gorgeous in the lobby. Rooms were fairly small though. Had the air turned down to 61 and the window opened in February and room felt like an oven. Bed are very firm with too many overstuffed pillows. Had a great view from the 31st floor over Rush St. It was a good stay but we have had nicer rooms for the same price in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying very good as was the first”
Reviews.Author: momthree
Reviews.Content: Stayed jan 28 and 29th 2012 for the dance, convention. We arrived around 10:30 AM and were immediately checked into our room. I booked our room through priceline when I found it on priceline's website for $81.88 plus tax a night, this even included a generous cancellation policy. Saved me close to $134.00 over the convention rate. I was asked if we wanted a king or 2 double beds, I requested a refrigerator and was provided with one at no extra charge. The only thing we kind of wanted a high floor but were put on the 12th. It was at the end of a hall very quit location. We did find if we cut thru the room where the ice machine and pop machine, and then thru the stairway landing, it was a bit shorter than going around the maze of hallways. Requested late check out on sunday, were given an extra half hour, they did store the dance conventions participants luggage in a ballroom until we left, although where our groups was wasn't really monitored very well, and we weren't given any luggage tags. Used the pool early Saturday morning while my daughter attended class, very nice, would have liked to used the hot tup but unfortunately 4 very hairy guys were occupying it, each on a corner, and there was no way as a female I was join that group. Even when they got out they sat right on the 4 corners of the hot tub. I feel this was rude, and it wasn't Marriott's fault, come on guys you weren't the only ones at that hotel. Saturday evening my daughter and I ventured by the pool area, and the hot tub had been drained and was closed, I don't know maybe too much hair from those guys. This hotel is so close to everything, I love it here. We used to have the convention over at a hotel on Wacker Dr-which meant it was further from everything, and didn't have a pool. We walked everywhere, even out to Navy Pier on friday night, felt safe the entire time. We just happened to stumble upon the snow sculpturing contest taking place at NP, felt kind of bad for the participants as it had been in the mid 40's and sunny on friday. Would stay here again, yes the bathrooms are small, but really our room on both occasions hasn't been that small. The hotel on Wacker much smaller, and fridge not included.

Reviews.Title: “only okay”
Reviews.Author: btarch
Reviews.Content: Our $130/nt room was - way too small, a bit run down, and not much to look at decor wise. But it did seem to be clean and the bed was nice and soft. Still, it wouldn't be on my list to visit again. Sorry Marriott, I usually really like your properties, but this one just falls short. Perhaps an update to the lobby/ bar area and cleaner looking hallways could help. It just seemed dark and not inviting. Plus the $51/nt parking fee is just crazy. The best part is the location, which is not too far from the Hancock and river. Would recommend the JW Marriott in the loop over this in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small out dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frankbrett
Reviews.Content: Bathroom was VERY small along with a small room. Not that clean either. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location but . . . everything was "small"”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy. However, the room was small and the bed was uncomfortable so I didn't sleep well either night. The bathroom was very tiny. However, the location was great, we could walk to all of the things that we wanted to do for the weekend or take an inexpensive cab ride to get there. The Staff was courteous and helpful. Valet parking is expensive at $51 per night but you can self-park for $36 per night. The kids enjoyed the pool but it, too, was small, more designed for lap workouts than family fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NJhotelguy
Reviews.Content: The most difficult thing for me about this hotel was getting to the front door. I had been to the hotel before (on foot) so I knew the driveway entrance was on the backside of the hotel. For some unexplainable reason I had to drive around the block a couple of times before I was able to located it. The desk staff was very efficient and friendly and the lobby was very busy with a lot of folks enjoying cocktails in the spacious lounge. Our room was at the end of the hallway but was great because it had corner windows and we had the ability to see the city from two vantage points. Definitely worth a request! The location is great because it is central to so many good restaurants, the original deep dish pizza parlor is only a couple blocks, but get there early if it's a weekend night because there were 1 1/2 hour waits. We also ate at Rosebuds (local Italian chain) which I had eaten at a few years prior and it was still just as good. Unfortunately it was November so we couldn't eat outside. Back to the hotel, the bellstaff was great because the airline broke the zipper on my luggage and they gave me some great suggestions on what to do. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff very attentive. Overall a just great experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. I took advantage of the free Self Parking promotion that this hotel offered for the weekend. It made a huge difference on our overall experience. We didn't have to wait out on the street for the valet to park us. We didn't have to wait for the valet to bring the car around and we saved $51 a night for parking! If we purchased something we could just take it to the car and not worry about it. The security is excellent where the car was parked. The hotel staff was very good and knowledgable about the city. Any staff member that we asked a question about was able to give us definite directions about what we were looking for. The hotel rooms were clean and very comfortable. The only issue we had was the heat couldn't be controlled that well. It had a tendency to be very warm in the rooms. The location on Michigan Ave is excellent. It is easy walking distance to any store or restaurant you may want to visit. We usually walked up Rush Street and always saw a choice of many restaurants. The lobby was a very nice place to relax. It was usually very lively but not overly crowded. The lounge area was a great place to people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, small room, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: arn623
Reviews.Content: Check in was one of the easiest at a marriott, room was small compared to other marriotts that I've stayed in. Service personnel were very accommodating. Excellent location to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms below Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: KenB10
Reviews.Content: A busy hotel with a very convenient location, and good front office services. The rooms are quite dated and in need of refurbishment, although the beds are consistent with Marriott's high standards.

Reviews.Title: “While on business”
Reviews.Author: Jerry P
Reviews.Content: Great location. My wife travelled with me while I was there on business. Perfect location. The concierge was great. I thought the bathroom was too small and the bed was not comfortable. But as for location and service, wonderful. Valet parking pricey at $51 per night. The gym was great with good availability of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “the best place in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NettoSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: great chain. great hotel and great staff.... I had a really nice room, with the best view and facilities I could have... The restaurant is fantastic, they have a really nice wine list and good options for food. Mr. Kevin Pickard, the Director of Restaurants, was incredible helping us during our stay. Everyone should try their homemade honey beers, cause it weas an incredible different experience I had.... You donÂ´t need to leave from there to have an excellent gastronomy experience. Go visit them, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lronn H
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about the hotel was that the room was quite small. No issues with the room facilities - bed etc. The gym is great - weights separate from cardio. Very nice club loungs and prices that are extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Mile Marriott”
Reviews.Author: dandkm88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Michigan Ave. Marriott many times for business and pleasure. Great access to shopping, restaurants, and Chicago attractions located in the heart of the Magnificent Mile. Good cab service and quick trip to any business location in downtown Chicago. Service was top notch and friendly, room was very clean, although a bit small. Fantastic Concierge service on the second floor open from 7am to 10pm during the week serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner for all but the heartiest of eaters.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 1st Choice”
Reviews.Author: Lillian L
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and bed comfortable, but small. Bathroom even smaller. With 2 people plus luggage, not a lot of room. Internet should be included. Marriott Fairfield in Madison WI did include internet. Street noise could be heard on 36th floor room. Heat could not be turned down low enough for us to be comfortable. Hotel did provide a fan. Something else to move around while trying to get to luggage. Bar staff and hotel staff were great. Upon arrival was told parking "was included", but when it appeared on the bill, we were told "included" means if you self park. What? They were good enough to accept the confusion and reverse the charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: nanners2000
Reviews.Content: Great location as it's right on Michigan Ave and right in the middle of shopping. The service was also great. Parking was about $32 per 24 hours with in-and-out services. There's a Starbucks downstairs, but there are several in close vicinity of the hotel. We were there the weekend of the football league championships and the bar and lounge downstairs had a fun atmosphere while people watched the games. The rooms were fine. They were relatively clean and spacious enough, but nothing special. However, being downtown and right on Michigan Ave made for a loud experience at night...which you can't blame the hotel. However one night, the hotel pipes were a little loud and it was hard to sleep for about an hour. We were there 3 nights and this only happened once. We got a pretty good deal and if we got a better deal in the future, we might stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: hisgrandma
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in a great location. It is close to every thing - great restaurants, shopping, bars, entertainment. But, it was not a great experience. We are Marriott elite members and booked this hotel 2 months in advance at a great price, When we arrived by cab, cars were backed up for a block to park, then a line of 20 people to check in! Fortunately, because we are elite members, we were able to use the special Elite desk. When we checked in with friends, were given rooms next to each other. Our room was the smallest room we have ever stayed in, including a cruise ship stateroom! Our friend's room was twice the size of ours and included a refrigerator and a sitting area. We were very upset, but the hotel was booked to capacity so we did not make a fuss. The Dance Company competition was at the hotel and it was mass chaos. Every time we took an elevator we had to wait 20 minutes. My husband could not get into the workout room and people were even lined up to use the treadmills. We wanted to have a drink at the bar, but it was packed as well and the tables in the bar area were filled with children, not adults. Although we had a great time in Chicago, it wasn't because we stayed at this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great view - not great room”
Reviews.Author: Jon w
Reviews.Content: Had a great view from my room, but when you are a Marriott hotel I would not expect there to have the wall paper pealing from the walls. Lobby is wonderful and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average otherwise”
Reviews.Author: jolloway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a trade show, and it was almost perfect for that: nice large lobby area to accommodate meetings, good central location for dinners, and we easily arranged a shuttle to McCormick Convention Center. But the rooms were just average (unless you pay up for a high-floor view), and my biggest complaint is that they're not set up for high-traffic breakfasts. I had to wait 15-30 minutes each morning, and service was poor once we got seated- ignored us at first then rushed us to go. Parking is expensive, but a metro stop is not too far. So, fine to stay here for business, but avoid it if there's a big convention in town.

Reviews.Title: “Merry at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBeautifully
Reviews.Content: I wasnâ€™t sure exactly what to expect from this hotel, given the professional pictures online. It could either look like a carnival, or look really stunning. Much to my pleasure, it was REALLY stunning on the inside, and the professional pictures did this property no justice. Everything in here is immaculate and well designed; the entire place looks brand new or completely renovated. Our car was whisked away by good valet service and we made our way up for a very fast check in. Our reservation was in perfect order and everything was great! The reception worker was prompt, professional, and efficient. The location of this hotel is superb, as you are right in the middle of great shopping and a short walk from the water taxi, which takes you to Navy Pier. The rooms are very â€œexecutiveâ€� looking and are probably best for companies or businesses hosting events. The bathrooms are clean, but small, and not super luxurious by any means. The beds and bedding is just average, as well as the dÃ©cor. I have to say, the rooms are adequate and comfortable, although no â€œWow factorâ€� necessarily. We had a beautiful floor to ceiling window view of the city and that was probably the most memorable aspect of the room. The rest of the hotel is very spacious and nice. There is a bar in the center of the lobby, perfect for congregating and meeting up with friends. A lot of people would sit around there, drink, and watch the game. It was very trendy, cool, and sophisticated. This hotel would be perfect to hold conferences or business meetings. If you had a big reunion to plan, or a large party, it would be great for that. I had the privilege of having lunch in the Marriott restaurant upstairs with friends. Everything that came out was well priced (i.e., not a huge hotel price rip off) and looked up to par as far as presentation. Everyone liked their food and what they ordered, more or less. Although we didnâ€™t eat at the hotel restaurant again, I would have. Everything was great. The only downside is, I found the elevator system a bit confusing. It is easy to get turned around or trying to figure out which elevator goes to which wing, etc. Other than that, it was a really good experience at this hotel and everything was very well done. I would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgrl911
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during this past winter. I had stayed here about three years earlier, and since then, they have renovated the lobby. I loved the new look of the lobby. Besides the lobby bar, that had several flat screen TV's to watch, the perimeter of the lobby had been turned into mini "private" sitting areas. A small fabric curtain seperated many of the small seating areas, creatin a very initmate feel. They also contained small flatscreens in them, and this was great for our two children that were also travelling with us. Location: The location is great! You can walk to everything. We walked up to American Girl and that shopping area. Next door was the Lego Store. Giordanos was right around the corner, so everything was perfectly placed. Rooms: They are a bit small, but they were very clean. We had two double beds in our room, and they gave us a higher floor with a view over the back of the hotel. Amenities: They had a Starbucks in the lobby, and the pool and workout room was very nice. They were very kid friendly here, and offer American Girl packages if you are interested. (We did not partake in that.) Parking: Typical and costly, as is any hotel in Chicago, but they were quick to get our car for us. Cabs were easy to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay right in the heart downtown Chicago - incredibly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GD77
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Marriott Magnificent Mile. Staff is incredibly friendly. Location is awesome. So many great dining spots within walking distance. Absolutely no complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and poor service”
Reviews.Author: NunuLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I attended a professional business conference in Chicago and stayed in the Marriott. The room was adequate, but after the first night, I had various linear bites on my stomach and it was determined later that they were bedbugs. I am still suffering from them a week later. There are past reports of this problem in reviews, about which I did not know or think of checking out in a reputable chain, and I would suggest that the hotel fumigate the whole place. Outrageous, and given the poor housekeeping, the prices that are charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, rooms not as great”
Reviews.Author: maggie e
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a recent conference. The location of the hotel and the facility itself is amazing, made more memorable by a king and professional staff. Shopping, tourist attractions, all within walking distance. Despite the fact there were no noise problems, and that I had a magnificent view from the 42nd floor, I found the comfort of the room very difficult to maintain. I can usually sleep almost anywhere and spent 3 sleepless nights at the Marriott. The bathrooms are smallish, not a much of a problem in a major city, but in major need or renovation. Cracked ceilings and peeling paint are a good indication that it's time to revamp. Also, as a previous reviewer mentioned, the dryness of the room was very uncomfortable. That said, the hotel dining facilities are marvelous, if a bit pricey, workout facilities and pool are outstanding, and staff extraordinarily accommodating. Without conference pricing, the room would have run pretty high, so I'm not sure I'd stay here again without a pretty good discount/deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dry, dry, dry”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_of_Amherst
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here during a professional conference. The location of the hotel is wonderful. The view from our room was amazing. I found the staff helpful. The woman who cleaned our room every day was an exceptionally nice and accommodating person. The problem? Our room was so dry that I woke up practically every half hour in desperate need of water. We set the room temperature to 55 degrees, but it was still stuffy and pretty warm. I know hotels tend to have stale air, but this was the worst I had every experienced. Cacti would thrive in this room. In short, I got very little sleep over the course of our three-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “NYE in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ALWAYSTRAVELWELL
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending my 2011-2012 NYE in downtown Chicago and stayed at the Marriott hotel. I was very impressed with my room view and the quietness. I was on the 44th floor and pretty much next to the elevator, but had a partial lake view - really pretty. I love that there's floor to ceiling windows! The decorations seem a bit outdated compared to other Marriotts. I was definelty expecting to hear neighbors, especially being NYE, but it was so quiet when we got back to the room...didn't hear any noises from other rooms or the elevator! The staff was friendly and proficient as it they were very busy that weekend. The only sticker shock was parking $48/night...but that's just Chicago. Very convenient to shopping and not too far from Lake Shore drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rykri
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, can walk to most shopping. Excellent, friendly service. Comfy beds and pillows. Very clean. Rooms somewhat small but We weren't in there except to sleep. Great value, parking just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Extremely Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: BrumbyGully
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Marriott Miracle Mile. The location is great especially if the weather allows you to walk to Water Tower Place, The Art Institute, Millennium Park and the loop. The rooms are clean but not quite as nice as I thought for a 4 star resort. The staff was so nice and accommodating. We found a great deal on Priceline and we were upgraded to the 36 floor with a Lakeview! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Chaudtheclod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before New Year's. Hotel is in a great location around the corner from Michigan Ave. Our room was clean and nicely appointed but a bit small. The only small downside was that the windows are thin so even though we were in the 30th floor, we could hear street noise at night. The bathroom also needs to be updated. Along the baseboards, the paint and wallpaper were peeling back. Hotel rate was low though so this was a solid value.

Reviews.Title: “Does not always live up to its potential”
Reviews.Author: McLean4
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are very clean but average. As a Marriott Rewards Gold member, my upgrade options are nothing special. The Lounge is first rate, however, and I usually start and end my day there with a nice breakfast and a decent bite for dinner. Large fitness facility, and Marriott is generally good about not charging guests to use the fitness center. Lots of cardio, lap pool and free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: world_travlr007
Reviews.Content: The location on Michigan Ave is perfect. The hotel has its own lively bar and is located near shopping and some fantastic restaurants. The decor in the corridors and bedrooms is beginning to show its age, but other than that no complaints whatsoever

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dkny67
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great hotel! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STEVE131111
Reviews.Content: We ( me and my wife) stayed at this hotel in the past and have found it to be a great central downtown location without a lot of amenities to clutter up the stay.The bar in the main lobby was very noisy and full of people all the time.Eats( food) is scarce as the restaurant is small and uneventful.There are lots of good places to eat within walking distance.The rooms are good and kept clean .Our latest stay was the first weekend of December.Chicago a great place to Play.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a weekend in December. Convenient location to Michigan Avenue shopping and less than a 3 block walk to the El train. Rooms are aveage size, but bathrooms very small. All rooms smell like the have been fumigated - likley due to past bed bug issues. Friendly helpfull staff. Hoiday gingerbread display is very nice. Work out facility is nice and not too crowded. Steam room in fitness center was closed due to plumbing issues, but looked like it had been clsoed for a long while.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Eire99
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, have stayed in it 3 times now and it never disappoints! Ideally located on Mag Mile. Front desk staff are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this business hotel is its location downtown Chicago, on the middle of the famous "magnificent mile". Located within walking distance to all major places and attractions of downtown, it is a very good choice for visitors in Chicago. As others mentioned before, the rooms are small, but yet comfortable enough (as long as you are not planning to stay in the room all of your day). Although it is a big business hotel, the atmosphere is very good and staying there is very pleasant. You won't feel estranged as it might happen in some other mega hotels. One major disadvantage - they charge $14 per day for in room connection to the net (there is a free wireless service in the lobby though).

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: Wrightway4010
Reviews.Content: Great location, concierge lounge is nice, linens are good. Rooms are WAY too small, it's a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Same as last 5 years, good fun, and very convenient...”
Reviews.Author: MHKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Have been coming here on first weekend in December for 6 times now. Not much has changed. But, I still love being smack in the middle of the best Chicago has to offer! Everyting is nearby and the Christmas shopping spirit is full omn. Recession? What recession? You'd never know there was one if all you did was walk up and down Michigan Avenue for 10 blocks in either direction. The rooms are modest in size and not well cllimate controlled due to the windows (good for cooling drinks!). The decor is a bit tired as are finishes. The lobby is hopping and fun! I have never stayed in a hotel with such a social lobby bar area and kudos to Marriott for making it so. I'll be here again next year for another four nights!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, small bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4hdhj
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at this hotel in the heart of Chicago's Magnificent Mile for business. I have stayed here a few times and just have to write to say I hate that small bathroom! The door is in the way and the tissue (this time around) was not a hook, just placed on the bathroom lid! Mind you, that is probably not the best place for it. Otherwise, the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: cmcgirl
Reviews.Content: I was there for business and had a meeting at the hotel. In general, the food was great.This hotel is in the middle of everything in Chicago so you can walk to great shopping and restaurants or even get away for a quick walking tour. The rooms are nice standard Marriott rooms. The staff was helpful. Everyone enjoyed their stay at the Marriott. One downside was there is no wireless internet in the guest rooms. Also, since I was there with a meeting, no one seemed to know how to change a reservation within 1 week of the event. I was transferred to at least 4 people over a 1 hour period before I was told to just make the changes when I arrived

Reviews.Title: “Service is impeccable, but rooms are tired”
Reviews.Author: 19mrpb58
Reviews.Content: My third stay here in the past few years - all business travel. Service on all fronts is top notch. But the rooms are in need of some sprucing up. My tub had been refurbished with one of those "bathfitter" type overlays. Everytime I took a shower I felt like I was at sea as the bottom was not adhered to the original tub and I was standing on a giant bubble. I told the front desk about it and they said I should write a letter to the GM.... Lobby bar far too bright and open to hotel traffic from Rush Street. NOT good for business meetings. Hit the lobby Starbucks for a quick bite - fresh and reasonable. Location is central and very very good. On my last trip I had a corner room facing the lake on one side on a very high floor - view was wonderful that way and into town. Business center is a rip off - I had two small UPS envelopes sent ahead of my arrival - they charged me $10.00 EACH for "processing".

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappoint...”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tired, in fact, the whole hotel is tired. Most surprising is that they have no wireless Internet in the rooms. Quite frustrating if you are a business traveler. As noted elsewhere, location is central.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Business or Leisure Travel”
Reviews.Author: SNJ_73
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Chicago I typically stay at this hotel or the downtown Renaissance. This Marriott had a total lobby re-do a few years ago which is a tremendous improvement. The staff are always friendly and helpful. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, which is great in the morning and they have a regular restaurant as well--which is pretty decent. The concierge lounge on the 2nd floor is really nice and serves a decent hot breakfast in the mornings--it is crowded, but there is alot of seating. The rooms could use some updating--this hotel gets ALOT of traffic thru it, so some aspects of the room start to feel alittle old. The bathrooms are small and could use some updating. The hallways are dated. I have never had a cleanliness issue here--the rooms seem to be clean and there is always a housekeeper in the hallway if I have ever needed anything. They are also friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is conveniently located to Michigan Ave and all the area shopping. They have wi-fi for a cost (if you are Marriott Rewards Platinum you don't pay--not sure if that applies to Gold as well), but I have yet to see a hotel that gives it away for free. My most recent trip was on Wednesday and I arrived very early at 8am--way earlier than the usual check-in time. There was a major conference in town and they had alot of people trying to check in. They took my cellphone # at the front desk, I gave my luggage to the bellman and went to have breakfast. within an hour I had gotten a call that my room was ready. I don't anticipate changing where I stay when traveling to Chicago--which I do a couple times a quarter.

Reviews.Title: “ASK FOR VIP AREA”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: Dont know how, but I was granted a VIP PASS, for free access to cookines, drinks, wonderful place, the hotel is not BRAND NEW, it is not elegant, BUT HAVE A GREAT LOCATION, in the middle of the Michigan avenue

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, no wifi”
Reviews.Author: hsheffield1
Reviews.Content: Way too expensive for what's offered. Small rooms and bathrooms. No wifi-really? Will not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location - cramped rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Cubsdiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls night out... the location is great. 1/2 a block away from Mich Ave. Lobby is huge - big bar & will always be packed on the wknds. Starbucks there... line can get very LONG. I found the rooms to be very small. The beds were extremely comfortable (pro) but the bathrooms were very tight, not a lot of move around room. The room was fine, served it's purpose but I have stayed at other hotels on Mag Mile and will def look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM TO SMALL”
Reviews.Author: JAFR
Reviews.Content: Our staying was "good" in general.....I must say for the rate paid you expect at least a room large enough so two persons can move inside the room without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but failed to impress w/ family!”
Reviews.Author: ntwkstudent
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 62 nights at a Marriott on business this year, however this one failed to impress on a family vacation weekend. What you really pay for here is the location as its right on Michigan Ave and is in walking distance to Navy Pier. While the hotel is situated nicely next to the shopping district, the rooms are extremely small (the smallest I've been in), and the bathrooms are even smaller (fitting more than 1 person in at one time is nearly impossible). There also is no club level access on the weekends. As previous reviewers have mentioned, this location does need some updating but the service and cleanliness makes up for it. The concierge was very friendly and provided alot of good information and there is a Starbucks inside (there is also a Cozi bakery next door for delicious breakfast). Taxi rides to the museum campus and Shedd is only $12-15 w/ tip each way. Parking is $33 or $48 for valet overnight. Even on the weekend here, there was mostly business travelers (many Asian), and very few families. Overall, I am a little less than satisfied as there are a little room for improvement but what do expect from Chicago other than overpriced, cramped and crowded?

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer Marriots in Chicago than this one”
Reviews.Author: TravelMatt05
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a race in Chicago because of its proximity to the race start. I used hotel points and I am glad I did, rather than actually pay for it. For such a pricey hotel, I expected a bit nicer of a hotel room. Bathroom was very old looking and not very nice. The bed linen was very outdated and had folded blanket across bottom of bed. For those of you that do not travel, that is never a good thing to have on bed, it Never gets washed...Room needs serious updating. All fuinds went to lobby and it is a nice lobby however, I do not sleep in the lobby. If you can, JW is best Marriot in Chicago and comparable in price. I highly recommend the JW.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite place to stay on Michigan Avenue!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Marriott every year over Thanksgiving weekend, and keep coming back. It is perfectly located between Watertower and the Loop -- which makes it great for walking to the parade and Daley Plaza for the Christmas Village, as well shopping up and down Michigan Avenue. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The elevators are fast. The breakfast buffet is good with many cook-to-order specials. The lobby has LOTS of seating, and is a great place to hang out with the family when staying in a hotel for a long weekend. The only downside for us is the double rooms have 2 double beds -- not queens.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MarekTheAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I've spent only one night at this hotel so cannot share too many experiences. The best thing is location. Just in the middle of downtown. Room was OK. What I was disappointed about was that corridors looked like they were still in '80s. Lobby's fine, but the rest of the hotel looked quite old (at least 28th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, servicable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Chicago. The staff was well organized and ready to handle a large flow of customers checking in and out of the hotel. Also, the hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, which is really nice on chilly mornings. However, the rooms are very small and dated. The room almost felt dirty, but at a minimum was dingy and dark. I expect noisy rooms in a downtown location, but had to figure out that the window in my room had been left open, which is why it was really cold and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lislander
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a two day conference and the hotel services and food were good. The room itself was on the small side. Bed was very soft but comfortable. Bathroom was really small. Only one person at a time could fit. TV could be updated as the picture quality was very grainy. The location is great for shopping as it is adjacent to a large mall anchored by Nordstroms and all the shops on Michigan Ave. There are several good restaurants in easy walking distance. Overall, what you would expect in a bust downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: summitsvs
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a excellent location on Michigan Ave., however it is very noisy. We were on the 38th floor and it was still enough to wake you at night. To make things worse our room was very stuffy and we had to sleep with the window open and have a fan brought up. The AC did not work well and the heat seemed to be on all the time. On the plus side the staff was great. Always acknowledged you and were very accommodating. I do wish the entire fitness center would open earlier for those of us that always have early days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: lucymcrae
Reviews.Content: By the look of the hotel, you know it needs some sprucing up. It is outdated, but clean. The main part that helped me turn a blind eye to it was the service. The concierge Darlene was the most thoughtful, creative and efficient one I have had in a long time. (And my husband and I travel all over the world) Even though the hotel was a chain, she made us feel like we were staying in an intimate, quaint place. I thought I might try and see if we could get an upgrade for our last few days of the trip and we were upgraded without hesitation. Service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “If you need Internet, go elsewhere. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: floradivine
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and just spent the last few nights here while attending a conference. The room is fine, bed is comfortable, bathroom is clean, etc. For some reason, I never heard doors of other rooms slamming, as I do in many other hotels. I never heard people talking as they walked down the hall. Maybe there were many extremely courteous guests this week? There are 6 elevators, which is good. I had a relatively long wait only a couple of times. I was on the 39th room and could hear endless sirens at night, so if that kind of thing bothers you, I don't think you'll sleep well anywhere in Chicago, unless you have a room that faces an inner courtyard or something. I needed Internet service because I was here on business. It didn't work in the room, and when I called about it, they connected me with a technology representative (a very friendly guy in Guatemala - seriously) but he was not able to fix the problem after an hour. Someone then brought me a new cable (there was a long wait for the cable, but I'm told they were very busy). Apparently a lot of people were having the same problem. Two hotel employees mentioned that they were having problems with Internet in the rooms. I was able to get wireless in the lobby and the 2nd floor, at no charge, but at night in my jammies, that wasn't much help. Other than that I have no complaints about the hotel, except the bar area at night is pretty cheesy - loud music, brightish lights (for a bar area) and huge TV screens that are partially blocked for some bar patrons by the huge "art" piece in the center of the bar area. The concierge, check-in clerks and luggage/taxi staff were all very friendly and attentive. Not sure if I'd stay here again, especially if I needed Internet.

Reviews.Title: “great location, average everything else. Look other hotel options.”
Reviews.Author: redlabtx
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of other reviewers have said, the location is the highpoint of this hotel. I didn't have issues connecting to the internet in my hotel room or the wireless in the conference area, but had MAJOR issues getting any connection on my cell phone. This presented issues with emails being delivered on time as well as texts. The room itself was fine. Nothing special. The bathrooms are terribly small and average, but that might be a Chicago thing. The room I was in was on the 39th floor and they did do a good job of keeping the feathers and down out of my room. They have an all allergy free floor. The room temp was an issue and never cooled down (I like to sleep at about 69-70 degrees). I called maintenance and they said it was fine. The onsite restaurant was ok. Dinner wasn't too exciting, but the french toast for breakfast was pretty good. if I come back to Chicago anytime soon, I will look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, kitschy lobby”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyer2011
Reviews.Content: The lobby is kitschy looking -- something Austin "Danger" Powers would appreciate. As one enters the hotel, one's nose is assaulted by cheap rosy air fresheners in the air. Not the best Marriott in town -- go for the location and don't expect much else. Pros: - Close to the action (shopping, restaurants, movie theater, bars) - Starbucks right on the premise Cons: - The cheesy lobby and bar

Reviews.Title: “No Internet service and room decor is bad”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: - Gold marriott member, checked into #1937. - No Internet available. Phoned there so called tech support who claimed it was my computer - Engineer arrived who said that whole hotel is having problem connecting to internet. - Im on business and need connection so called another hotel. - Checked out of hotel 2 hours roughly after i arrived. - Front desk were friendly enough given circumstance Never stayed here before and wont consider it again. This room is in need of updating, bathroom is tired and tiles need at least regrouting. I will be writing a complain to Marriott and also advising my company corporate travel team

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but beware if you need consistent internet access”
Reviews.Author: Shorty519
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel for a business conference. The rooms were fair and the beds were comfortable, so I can't complain about that. The staff was great; very helpful with everything. My only complaint would be about the poor internet access (both wifi and plug-in room access). The internet access in this hotel stinks. The wifi is great in the lobby and the immediate surrounding area of the lobby, but access in the meeting rooms is minimal or nonexistent (not the "free wifi in all public areas" that I read on their website). Our wifi connection and consistency was so poor that my colleage actually paid the $14.95/day to have a plug-in connection in her room, and she said that was horrible too. This was incredibly frustrating for a business conference / work trip, as I had to keep hunting for good wifi connections (usually outside of the hotel). Other than that, the hotel was pretty good. It's in a great location for anyone who wants to explore downtown Chicago. Great restaurants, bars, and shopping are everywhere, and it's all walkable. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, which is nice. They also have a lobby bar and a hotel restaurant on the 2nd floor. Be aware that the hotel restaurant is spendy!! The food is ok, but you can get cheaper food at the Cosi cafe on the corner, or better food a few blocks away at your choice of fantastic restaurants. Overall, an ok stay, but I would have preferred better internet access during my business conference. Other tha

Reviews.Title: “ehhhhh”
Reviews.Author: lalaleeloo
Reviews.Content: Rooms we ok but smallish. Bathroom and wooden furniture has seen better days. Restaurant- could not find much to order that was not too heavy so had a tomatoe salad and half the tomatoes were completely mush. during the 3 nights and days was there for a conference,I was only able to consistently connect to internet in lobby after 10:30 pm, and then it was only after trying to log in for over an hour. Every one had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, decent value, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: ChgoJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and was generally happy with the hotel all around. Great food, clean rooms, excellent location. The rooms are not 4 star but for the price, not too bad. There are some great new hotels in Chicago but in a pinch, the Marriot isn't a bad alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza725
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Marriott Magnificent Mile. The hotel has great location close to great shopping and fabulous restaurants. The staff is friendly and helpful. Beware if you plan to drive parking is expensive both self park and valet. Great hotel for both leisure and business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and "A Effort"”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuglove83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Magnificent Mile for 2 nights on the weekend before Halloween. Let me say that the location is perfect for someone wanting to be in the heart of the Shopping area. It had an incredible bar scene; both Friday and Saturday were both packed with people sitting down for a cocktail or a beer. The lounge area is very large and quite inviting and it looks like a lot of weddings and conferences that take place at this hotel. Check in was quick and smooth though they didnâ€™t mention anything about me being a Marriott member and I had to ask them where the breakfast was in the morning (I had it included in my package). The hotel was recently renovated and it showed. New carpets, drapes, furniture... really, they did try. Though I liked the common areas, I did not like the rooms. Though recently renovated, the rooms still had popcorn ceilings in the bedroom and in the bathroom. The bathroom was reeeaallllyyy small. The toilet almost touched the door and it was impossible to shower with the door open because the tub ran right into the door. They went "cheapo" on me and gave me soaps instead of the usual Bath and Body works body wash. Can you say dry irritated skin? It didnâ€™t really bother me but I had mold on the ceiling of the shower. The bedroom was small but nice. Again, the carpets, drapes, chairs and bedding was up to date but again, very teeny. I thought the beds were very comfortable. I had room service and they were very prompt and the food was pretty good. I had the standard Marriott burger and I must say the fries were better than all of the other Marriottâ€™s I've stayed at (I get the Marriott burger a lot). I was able to get a really good rate on the room so if I were to describe the trip in one word it would be "Good". All in all I would stay there again but I would opt for a larger room and plan out some time to check out the bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Location, Location, and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ourroadlesstraveled
Reviews.Content: Service was very polished and professional for this type of hotel. The location was perfect for walking to Navy Pier(1 mile), shopping on Michigan Ave is right outside the door, and short taxi rides to The Shed Aquarium, The Field Museum, or great Greek restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Womderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bonniestravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile in early September. The room was very nicely appointed, with a great view of downtown Chicago. The service there was impeccable. We were right in the heart of the city, within walking distance of all the attractions. The staff was very informative whenever we asked questions about where to eat or how to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent stay”
Reviews.Author: LlamaMom
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Chicago for work and stayed at the Marriott Downtown Magnificent Mile hotel. I often stay at Marriott's and this was another good stay. Lobby was nice and we had an impromptu meeting there which, while busy, had great sound so we could hear everyone and still feel like we were having a private conversation. Room was fine, front desk staff were excellent. I had two quick interactions with the cleaning staff who were all very nice. Only problems: we had no time to enjoy that Magnificent Mile and the hotel did not have wireless, but is working to change that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nochmar
Reviews.Content: Decided to try something new and stayed at the Marriott Magnificent Mile. The hotel was very busy during our stay, but the service was still excellent; they really go out of the way to make sure you have what you need. The rooms were much smaller than I am used to but the view was spectacular. The walls were on the thin side, so you may want to bring some ear plugs. Bed was comfortable and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: PRO2J
Reviews.Content: Having been a frequent traveler to Chicago, I used to stay at this hotel every few months. I haven't had the need to go to Chicago so often, and haven't been since May 2010 until this weekend. I have to say, this hotel has gone downhill in less than 18 months. It used to be a well priced, above average Marriott in the middle of the Michigan Ave. action, but is now a total dump. We reserved two executive king "suites" but were shocked to find out they are actually the same size as the standard rooms, but arranged slightly differently. The wallpaper was peeling in many places, and not just a little bit. The carpet was stained and the tile was cracked. There was dust everywhere, including on the extra blanket in the closet. There is a small couch in the room that folds out in to a double bed, but why pay an unnecessary premium for an executive king "suite" and just book a standard double room instead? The bathrooms in this hotel are TINY, to the point where it's difficult to stand in front of the sink because the toilet juts out of the wall so far. The shower handle was literally falling off the pipe and many of the tiles were cracked or chipped. The toilet had no water pressure, while the shower was blasting your skin off. The toilet paper holders are pointlessly placed underneath the counter, and if you have never stayed at this hotel, you might have one of those "uh oh" moments looking for them. I also want to mention how thin the walls at this hotel are. The people next to us decided to have a party at 1:30AM and I had to call security three separate times to get them to shut up. We could literally hear them screaming about giving more shots of cognac and yelling "chug, chug, chug" as someone did a beer bong... Not acceptable. There is a Starbucks located in this hotel, but please, PLEASE walk across the street to the Intercontinental (or just stay at the Intercontinental) and go to their Starbucks. The staff is actually halfway intelligent there. Twice I went to the Marriott Starbucks and got unbelievably rude service from a group of women who were obviously more interested in talking about their personal lives than helping customers. And twice, my drinks were completely wrong. I didn't even bother asking for them to change it as it would have involved a lot of eye rolling and questions that I wasn't in the mood to answer. We are Marriott Elite members and tried to check in at 11:45 at the Elite counter which doesn't open until 12 noon, but seeing as there were three or four employees just standing around chatting, we decided to give it a go. One of the women chatting turned to us and gave a great deal of attitude about the desk not opening until noon and how we were early and wouldn't get our rooms anyway (which we did) and that she wasn't punched in, etc., etc. Totally unnecessary; I would have been fine if she simply pointed out the time, but she went on... and on... and on. With this last experience, I will NEVER stay at this Marriott again. It is a poorly managed, dirty, disgusting, low quality mess, and isn't worth it at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of the Action”
Reviews.Author: Cathy L
Reviews.Content: Reasonable cost by the Magnificent Mile standards, the Marriott Downtown stands above other near by hotels by having a restaurant / bar area that allows one to actually eat and sip a beverage without being consistently bothered by others looking for companionship. The numerous large screen TVs are a pleasant diversion if one wants to sit near one but unobtrusive if one just wants to sit and eat. The room is large and noisy but some of the seating areas allow for a smaller, quieter gathering. The rooms are typical and the upper flows have great views. One down side is if you want to exit the hotel to Michigan (and not Wells) there is no escalator and you either carry your luggage up, ask a bellman to do it or ask someone to activate the handicap lift.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good for meetings”
Reviews.Author: sunniekate
Reviews.Content: It was a nice, clean hotel and great for meetings. The signage and floor markings for meeting rooms could be marked better. Overrall good experience. Would stay there if visiting the towm for personal. One odd thing was the toilet was kind of far away from the wall in the bathroom. I think this was a fluky thing as my colleagues didn't experience this.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Great View, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: V4VALOR
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott Rewards points for this stay, we were put in room 4208. Family of four, this room had two double beds. It was very small we bumped elbows a lot. Though this room was small the view of the Magnificent Mile as Great! I would not pay full price for this room. They would need to get under the $200 rate for me to pay cash. The pool and workout facility was awesome. The staff was extremely courteous. The Club Lounge is a great value for Marriott Rewards members

Reviews.Title: “Hope for good neighbors”
Reviews.Author: Tabithay23
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fine and clean, the hotel extremely well situated near shopping and urban beaches. This is a huge hotel though, with a lot going on (conferences, weddings, etc.) My friend and I were unfortunately rooming on a floor with drunk wedding partiers. This would not have been so bad had the party not turned out to be aggressive and somewhat violent as we had a connecting room and could hear the insults they were throwing at each other and how they hit what I can only assume were furniture and the walls. We called the front desk twice (1h30 AM and 3 AM). The security people came up, talked to the people creating the disturbance and left. Then at 5 AM one of our "friendly" neighbors kicked the door repeatedly while knocking heavily and yelling at someone to open the door to the room next to us. The lady I kept speaking to at the front desk was very nice but could not tell me if the party was checking out the following day so she offered a room change. As we weren't in the mood to get dressed and change rooms at 3 AM, we waited until the morning. When I went to the front desk, they told me our neighbors were leaving at noon and that they couldn't give me another room as they only had the name of my friend. I told them that they took my credit card when I checked-in so I didn't understand why they didn't have my name. After a longer than expected discussion, they finally gave us another room but it was clear that they thought I was being a pest by asking if we could be compensated (upgraded) in some way to compensate for our sleepless night of stress. I travel alone often and I can't imagine how stressed out I would've been had I been alone in that room and can't help but think that security was more interested in returning to their desks to continue whatever they were doing than resolving the disturbance efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: menarefrommars
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a conference in this hotel recently. I read a lot of reviews before I left and this hotel had mostly mixed and mediocre responses, but we stayed because it was convenient to attend the lectures we were going to. The reviews I read were very accurate so I will be specific with mine. I called multiple times to have a king bed, they said fine but there was none available when we arrived. There was no shuttle van from O'Hare which is ridiculous ($45 for a taxi) The rooms are okay but definitely getting shabby, peeling wall paper, old tub, yucky shower curtain. Internet was free in the lobby but nowhere else, ridiculous at this stage, I can get it for free on the corner. Maid service never cleaned room when we were out ALL day but knocks on our door at 5 when we are getting ready to go out and knocks again the morning we were leaving at 9 am, great thanks. The lobby was funky cool but LOUD. It is a good location but there re like 20 hotels or more right on that block so I would venture to say there are better ones or better deals, this was neither. For $300 (group rate) a night, that was definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “stay at the BLACKSTONE instead”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkRayman46
Reviews.Content: Marriott had an indifferent staff, ice machines didn't work tried 4 floors, lost our reservation[however, we had a printout. Do yourself a favor, stay at the Blackstone [a Marriott property ] get a 3 day bus pass and walk to Lou Malnatti's.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, but the rooms need a facelift”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: This place is very conveniently located, surrounded by excellent restaurants and stores. As an avid Marriott rewards guest, I had expectations for this place with a price point of over $300 a night. The furniture in the room was pretty ratty- the dresser looked like someone drove a truck into it. The bottom of the bathroom door looked like it was rotting. The bathroom was so small that you could barely get inside, turn sideways to shut the door. The door was so close to the toilet it almost hit it when opening. I had a good view from the 40th floor but was disappointed in the room itself. The concierge lounge here was a bright spot. Great machines to self brew a cup of Starbucks, hot breakfast with eggs and bacon. This was the high spot.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Maconmerlyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October '11 for a conference...rooms were ok, but could have been bigger...the views were terrific though. Check in was easy as they had a dedicated line for rewards members...lobby was open and well suited for hanging out, if you're so inclined. The location of the hotel is perfect and makes it an excellent choice for travelers who will be staying for more than a couple of days...out of one entrance, you have joes seafood which is phenomenal...out of the other, you're on the mag mile...

Reviews.Title: “not what was promised”
Reviews.Author: gailpaulus
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location, but were not happy with accommodations at all. we booked a king room and ended up in a room with two doubles. not very romantic when you are sleeping in separate beds. small bathroom. good view. have to pay for in room internet. asked to check-out at two tomorrow instead of twelve and were told no way. guess i'll be sitting in the lobby while my husband finishes his meeting. better deals with better service in town. won't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Marriott quality...price... Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: red_x_oktober
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on October 5th for a business conference. The GROUP rate for a regular room exceeded $250/night and I was associated with a pretty sizable conference. I'm glad I was on an expense account. I'm not sure what is par for the course in the heart of Chicago during the business week. I stayed at a comparable Westin one weekend in Chicago at a much more affordable price for a major urban area... The lobby was very impressive and had a open floor design with a very modern, urban feel. At the center of the lobby is a great wrap-around bar, plenty of tables, arm chairs, and more isolated booths for meetings or catching up with work. A wall of TVs by the bar can keep you up to date on sports and other news. A full-service Starbucks is also in the lobby for your coffee cravings in between meetings. Its a busy place, but it was a good place to relax. Free wi-fi in the lobby was also nice. But at this price, it seems absurd they would charge you $15 for 24 hours of internet. By the way, you do get charged for internet in your room. The elevators in the hotel are totally confusing. There are multiple sets of elevators each with a different function... Some take you to higher rooms, some to lower, and some to the conference spaces. Pay attention before you get on one set as they may not take you where you need to go. The room was a little small but the bed was comfortable with very nice bedding as is usually the case at Marriott. (I had a room with two doubles.) The desk area was awkwardly positioned in front of one of the beds and the office chair was constantly in my way as I navigated around the room. Technology-savvy business travelers with laptops, phones, and/or e-readers needing charged will be annoyed with the one set of outlets by the desk area, which are somewhat awkwardly positioned under the desk opening. I had to do a search around the room for another outlet as you won't find one on your nightstand, either! An armchair, end table, and lamp could be found in the corner at the far end of the room, but they were so awkwardly placed that it seemed like an afterthought. You couldn't really sit and watch tv from this position, and the short ethernet cable at the desk meant you couldn't work from this space either. The bathroom was nice and very clean, but very small compared to other urban hotels I've stayed in and there wasn't a toilet paper holder in the bathroom. The toilet tank apparently performs this duty instead of the traditional holder under the vanity... Seemed strange to me. I had a room that adjoined to another room and I was not associated with that guest despite the fact that I had to deal with her loud phone conversation for about an hour during the evening. I don't know if it was because we had adjoining rooms or if the walls are simply thin, but she might as well have been making the call from my room... Annoying. I have no complaints about staff. Everyone from the bellhops to the desk attendants to housekeeping was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Great quality of service across the board from the staff I experienced during my stay. The location in the heart of the Magnificent Mile is great. You are in easy walking distance to so many great restaurants/shopping and cabs are always available out front in Cab or car service from O'Hare will set you back about $50 so factor that into your overall cost. You can count on a 40 minute ride from O'Hare depending on the time of day you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Average, for the price”
Reviews.Author: maa-maa
Reviews.Content: I found nothing in particular to dislike about this hotel, but for the price we paid (Fri-Sat night stay) I can't say that I was particularly impressed. The place was clean, and only a few dings here and there. The decor functional but forgettable. We were on the 37th floor looking west (toward the city) but with all the other tall buildings, the views weren't expansive. The only two negatives about the room were that the beds were somewhat "deep valley" and the temperature control wasn't the best (too warm). The lobby bar was eye-catching, but noisy. We ate Sunday brunch at the hotel restaurant (part of a package deal) and the food was excellent. There's a Starbucks in the lobby for morning coffee. As others have said, no wi-fi in the rooms, but you can get it in the lobby. The pool was on the small side but had an airy feel with the windows all around. Parking is expensive, but that's true of nearly every downtown hotel. Service was good. The location is great, but with all the other hotels around we'll likely try someplace else next time we visit. Bottom line, this place was "OK."

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mchenryed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Chicago. Plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping are close by. The staff was very friendly and check in was painless. The view are very nice too. We were on the 41st floor so we were awed by the views. Some negatives though were that there is no in room wi-fi. Good luck getting anything close to 3G on your cell phone with all the buildings around. Cell phone calls would also get dropped (Verizon). Also, the room temperate was very uncomfortable. We even had the room repair people out to look at it and there was nothing they could do. It was uncomfortably warm -- I guess being that it is October they have turned off the ability to turn the air on in your room. We had the thermostat set to 40F and it was blowing hot air out of it. Overall though, the food and amenities were good. I'd gladly stay here again as the Marriott chain usually runs a tight ship and this was no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Convention Hotel but with a Friendly Twist”
Reviews.Author: pfbird
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Chicago for one night after it popped up on Priceline for $85. We were delighted to snag a four-star hotel with a perfect location -- access to excellent shopping by going north on Michigan, or to the business district by going south and over the river. When I checked on the rack rate on the Marriott site, the best I could find was $254 a night. So in that context, it was absolutely worth the price we paid. The staff -- from the front desk to the bellmen -- were warm and friendly, making us feel very much at home. For example, when we asked about a place to eat breakfast, a bellman said we could pay $28 for the brunch within the hotel, or we could walk across Rush Street and get a great breakfast at Cosi for a fraction of that. There was a disconnect between that kind of warmth and the hustle-bustle of the giant lobby and the multiple banks of elevators that took us to our room on the fourth floor. The room itself was tiny, but the king-size bed was wonderful. The bathroom was rather ordinary for a four-star hotel, too small for my wife and I to occupy at the same time, and equipped with nondescript white linens. The decor was forgettable, but it did have a nice view facing the Chicago skyscrapers to the south. All in all, we got more than we paid for. But if we had paid the $254 rack rate, I think we would have been disappointed, especially at the cramped quarters. Finally, we found the electronic climate controls annoying. But that seems to be increasingly common among big hotels. It got hot in the night (even though temps were in the 40s outside), and all we could do was keep punching the electronic thermostat toward 60. It seemed oblivious to our attempts to coax cool air from the ducts. Oh, and the noise level was normal for a big city, the occasional siren but not objectionable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Lo W
Reviews.Content: ... however, I wouldn't spend my own money on it. For the price, you can get better. My advice is either go cheaper or up the ante and stay somewhere nicer. Starbucks in the lobby was convenient - yet again proving my point above.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel2much4work
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for business trip. Have stayed at this hotel twice. Very very busy. Accommodations were tight, but fine for one. Needed late check out...and was told none were left. Asked for a quite space to do a present a webinar and they allowed a one hour post noon check out...begrudgingly. Concierge made great suggestions for dinner and gave us a reservation with a coupon for a local pizza restaurant...that put us to the front of the line! Lounge was well kept and the food was fresh. No soda.

Reviews.Title: “NO Elite Benefits on Weekends!!!..NONE, ZIP, NADA! **NO In-Room WiFi**”
Reviews.Author: WldTvlr
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum Elite with Marriott and much to my surprise and disappointment upon checking in this past Friday for a 2 night weekend stay was closure of the Club Lounge for the weekend.... actually EVERY weekend. Thinking there had to be alternative benefits (breakfast in the restaurant, drinks at the bar...anything!) I inquired and was told rudely by the "Elite Check-In Desk" staff that they would not offer me anything else, other than the Spartan "Welcome Amenity." Not taking this without more inquiring, I called guest services and was given the same answer. Clearly they encounter upset Elite members on weekends and are ready with their abrupt and non-accommodating responses. My beef isn't as much with the lack of club access, but with the lack of notice by the hotel with my confirmation and the lack of an alternative benefit to make up for it. Had I known this in advance, I would have stayed elsewhere (and I assume they know this...thus why they don't tell you). I am Diamond with Hyatt and Gold with Hilton and have never run into this before...without at least some other benefit to make up for the lack of club access. Clearly the Marriott Downtown Chicago does not value Elite guests...at least not on weekends. As for the rest of the hotel, it's fine, but nothing special. They've spruced up the lobby, but the rooms are small, especially the bathrooms, and dÃ©cor is dated. PLUS this was the first hotel I have stayed at in a long time that does NOT have in-room WiFi, only a single Ethernet cable. There is WiFi in the lobby though. I found this frustrating when using devices like my iPad and laptops. As for the positive, the location on Michigan Ave. is convenient and the restaurant named â€œHarvestâ€� had a tasty for breakfast buffet. However, be prepared to shell out a hefty $26 per person if it's not part of your room rate. My assessment...I won't stay here again. There are too many other hotels in the immediate area that offer better rooms and services that make the Chicago Marriott Downtown a hotel that needs to reevaluate their competition and how they treat Elite members.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lynne033
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Magnificent Mile and you can walk to all the major attractions including Navy Pier, Architectural river cruise, Insitute of Art to name a few. All the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and the check-in staff are very efficient and pleasant. There is free wifi in the Lobby and you can have a drink or meal while checking emails. This hotel also has Starbucks in the Lobby and that is also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: rumbeam
Reviews.Content: Don't let the remodeled somewhat chic lobby fool you -- it's just lipstick on a pig. Rooms are tired, run down and on the verge of unacceptable...especially for the price. You really can do better and Marriott should step it up. The fitness center is typical middle market hotel...you're just happy if they have enough cardio machines that aren't from the 1990s. Though, many of the TVs on the machines did not work...so you know what this meant during rush hour workout time. There is a second workout room with weights that you could miss if you aren't looking. If you're going to stay Marriott, I'd go to the Courtyard one a few blocks over. I stayed there last year and liked it much more than this tired spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but prices are high - great value if you get it from priceline”
Reviews.Author: offwego4
Reviews.Content: The good: location, and room is just great. The bad: over priced. Overcoming the bad - get it on priceline.... got it for 144$ (incl. tax!). But all amnetes (internet, breakfast etc. need extra). However - your in the middle of everything - so no need to worry.

Reviews.Title: “Good,but losing ground”
Reviews.Author: p9jxh6
Reviews.Content: There are better values in Chicago and the rooms are slipping out of date quickly. The awesome location doesn't quite cover for a hotel thats no longer near the top of the pile. Used points to stay, otherwise I'd begrudge the price. You could do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a tourist friendly location”
Reviews.Author: ivypivy
Reviews.Content: As a large city hotel that accommodates many diverse populations and one that handles high turnover, you would expect the experience to reflect a wide variety of needs and issues. My husband and I were in town specifically for the 1/2 marathon on a Sunday morning - as was at least a dozen other guests. Check in was easy, the lobby was recently updated and the view from the 32 floor was terrific. The good news stops there. There is no room service between 12 midnight and 6 am. This means t DO NOT try to get breakfast before 6 am. They were not willing to help to develop a solution when you have to leave at 5:45 am. Unexpected for a hotel with hundreds of rooms.
