We were put into a room by the elevators and told there were no other options - I wound up staying up all night from the noise. When we asked for a late check out - 12:30 PM was the farthest out. Worst yet, only one of the two electronic keys worked. My husband and I have two different last names. At the front desk at 5:45 am, with my husband (who name was on the room) next to me, they would not give me another key without ID. Security meet me upstairs, looked at my ID with my name on it and then would not give me another key despite my picture ID being in the room because our names were not the same. There are many other great hotels in Chicago. Expect I will be using another one the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Too many better choices to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: WhoCares31
Reviews.Content: Lobby and bar area are nice. Location is great. Rooms are tired and not very clean. Restaurant is small and just average food. With all the great choices in downtown Chicago, it's hard to see why I would pay $300/night to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Views, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Megan0012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We had a room on the 45th floor which had a great view. The staff was very friendly. There were a lot of events going on over the weekend and it was super busy but none of it affected our experience. The location was great, it is right on Michigan Ave sort of central to Sears tower, Wrigleyville, and Navy Pier. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: hanu1
Reviews.Content: Large clean room, helpful staff , reasonable rates. Close to restaurants and no more than 10 blocks from just about every major downtown financial institution. Could not ask for more . I will gladly return on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great-service lacking”
Reviews.Author: jaimie_u
Reviews.Content: The location is great-you can walk everywhere. Additionally, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. My biggest concern was the customer service. At check in, they weren't overly friendly but the service was satisfactory. However, when I called down to request a late check out, the lady I spoke with was downright rude. As a Marriott Platinum member, a late check out should be easily accomodated. I've never had a problem elsewhere. However, this woman had a real attitude. I asked for the late check out and she said they'd give me a 1pm checkout. This was a little ridiculous-normal check out is 12. I asked politely if there was anyway she could make it 2pm and also mentioned that i'm Platinum with the hotel chain. She rudely snarled "I UNDERSTAND that....". Finally, she transferred me to the front desk. I spoke with a very pleasant gentleman named Luke who gladly accomodated my request. However, I find it unbelievable that the hotel would hire people like this operator-this person clearly was not suited for the service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: KckbxrSSM
Reviews.Content: What a lovely time we had in Chicago last weekend with friends. We went in for an Austrailian Winemakers Dinner. It was not at this hotel, but we could see our destination from our friend's room 2 blocks away. When we arrived up to our room (4207), it was immediately off the elevator. As we had seen 3 different bridal parties in the lobby, we figured that this room could be potentially noisy. We phoned the front desk & asked if we could be moved. She said that they didn't have anything on that floor, with our friends. She also checked for other "quiet" rooms with a city view as our friends had requested when they booked the rooms. We said we didn't care whether it was city view or not, just clean & quiet. Well, she brought the keys up to us & walked us down to 3630. It was quite a walk too. Talk about a secluded room?! Wow! And the view? It was great! A lake view and it had a sofabed which our other room did not. The staff was very helpful & courteous. The bed felt pretty good, but made my back hurt. The rooms are small, but the location is fantastic! You walk right out onto either Rush Street (where you have to either self-park for $42/24 hours or Valet for $45ish plus tip) or Michigan Ave. right on the Magnificent Mile. It was a wonderful location. Two parking garages are located within a block of the entrance on Rush (also a good tip in case you just wish to go into Chicaogo for the day & have a great location to park). It is located at Ohio & between Rush & Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Just So-So”
Reviews.Author: Nanook4530
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nicely decorated and located close to numerous Chicago attractions. Room was clean and bed was comfortable; however, even with the AC set to 67 the room would not cool, and when the unit was switched to high the wall vibrated. Water pressure in the bathroom sink is very low which made it difficult to wash soap off of hands/face and it took forever to add water to sink for shaving. We stayed on the 23rd floor, but still heard lots of street noise which made it difficult to sleep. Hotel staff were professional and efficient, but not overly friendly. Restaurant seems overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; room small though”
Reviews.Author: Lovestraveling1379
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over labor day weekend for two nights for a friends wedding. The room rate was a block rate at $135 a night so very reasonable for being right on the mile. We were on the 15 th floor in a double. The room was tiny tiny tiny. My fiancÃ© is 6' and even though I'm a small lady only one person could be in the bathroom at a time and you had to literally almost crawl over the second bed to get past the desk and chair. Hotel was clean in common areas and did a wonderful job for her wedding however I'm a germ freak and the room itself was just a bit grimy. Clean overall though. Only big complaint is that we went out all day Saturday exploring the city in 90 degree weather. On the way back it started to rain. When we got to the room at 4pm it hadn't been touched. Bed undone and no fresh towels for our showers to get ready for the ceremony. The front desk advised it just depends when they clean the room. Not a very good answer but they sent towels up right away and said they'd get it cleaned after we left. Loud bar but great beers on tap. Free wi-fi in bar area so a bit crowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasNorthTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb. and really enjoyed the hotel, so thought we'd give it a 2nd try. Only 2 blocks from the subway, so easy to get there from the airport and around Chicago. The hotel was just as great this time, although a lot busier. The lobby was filled with excitment almost any time you walked through. They had 6 big screen TVs at the Lobby Bar showing constant football and baseball. The staff told us that they had 12 different weddings scheduled on Sat., so to keep all those people happy along with the tourists, out-of-town Cubs fans, and other weekend guests was an accomplishment. This hotel is in a great spot, right on Michigan Avenue, near some great restaurants, attractions, and stores. Except for the stressed out hostess in the hotel restaurant, all of the staff was great and very helpful. Love this hotel and would definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Always busy, always efficient. Would be good for a family trip as well.”
Reviews.Author: mabollinger
Reviews.Content: I am a dedicated Marriott lifetime Platnium and stay at hotel all around the country, This Marriott is big, noisy lobby and usually very busy. THAT is not a bad thing. The rooms are very quiet, the view is quite good and the food is always very good. A drawback is that concierge lounge is often very crowded and in a bit of an odd location but it does seem to work. The Mag Mile location is excellent and I would bring family to this hotel if Chicago shopping and sightseeing were on the agenda. Cabs are easy to get, and the river is close. I stay here regularly (once a month) and celebrity sightings are not unheard of ;-). All in all, in this case, busy feels active and I always feel valued here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, crap hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Pat71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. The location really is superb but the Hotel is tacky to say the least. The rooms were ok, the beds comfy but the public areas were either dark and dingy or like a bingo hall with lots of noise and old people sat around. Would not have wanted to stay more than one night. Also the recommendation for brunch from the concierge was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Average Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ATL23
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a typical Marriott hotel, with great location and views, this hotel is for you. The hotel is not a stand out among the Marriott brand, the staff seemed rushed and impersonal at all encounters. High-rise floors have excellent views of downtown and Lake Michigan. Convenient to the Red Line, which will have you connected to the city's attractions and airports easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Myke2
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding here. It was very well done and the food and sevice were excellent. The rooms are very small but the great location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Stay !”
Reviews.Author: DFWvol
Reviews.Content: From check in until check out, the service at this hotel was impeccable. The hotel is very centrally located. We were able to check in early and were given a lake view room on the 39th floor. Other hotels in Chicago charge an additional fee for this, but it was complementary at the hotel. The floor to ceiling windows provide an amazing view of the lake/downtown. Being a fitness fanatic, I was pleasantly surprised at the fitness center. It has all the basics needed for a good work out. We will definitely stay at this hotel on our next trip to Chicago !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: m6_traveler
Reviews.Content: Very polite staff, clean rooms. For a business trip it was easy in, easy out.

Reviews.Title: “No Romance”
Reviews.Author: annabel d
Reviews.Content: Bought the room thru priceline -- specified desire for a four-star hotel in vicinity of Watertower. As others have mentioned, the location is desirable (although noisy. Right on Michigan Ave.) I don't need a lot of amenities and maybe bca this hotel has the restaurant, bar and workout room, it's classified as four-star. But in no way was this a luxurious place. The lobby is somewhat depressing--dark, feels like entering a basement. The rooms are REALLY small. Worst of all, we stayed in a room that was next to the elevator. It was so loud, it felt like we were booked in the elevator itself. There were no other rooms available, probably bca others had booked through priceline as well. Felt like a cattle call that weekend. Did not inspire romance.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather stay at the Bates Hotel (site of Psycho)”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: If you have the misfortune of having booked a room at this mold and mildew infested hotel, change it immediately! My husband and I are both attorneys and a family wedding was sited at this cesspool. Despite having called to confirm that our room would be hypoallergenic and despite being assured by hotel staff, we walked in to a blast of stale air carrying a strong, unpleasant odor. When we protested, we were told that "hypoallergenic" meant solely that no feather duvet was used, not that the air would be clear of mildew and the like. Although we moved to the Intercontinental across the street, many others attending the wedding were unable to book a room in the vicinity and were relegated to staying at this hotel. One of our party was hospitalized and her trip home was delayed and a number of others, young and old, were sickened. All of this made for a terrible experience. I am still on medication for the asthma attack suffered during my brief time in the lobby and in the room (which was quite dusty). Thankfully, the bride and groom did not stay at the hotel and a lovely young man and woman were married this past weekend.

Reviews.Title: “location and class”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location on Michigan Avenue (great shopping, restaurants, people watching) and not far from Navy Pier and Millennium Park. The hotel is elegant. The lobby is visually stunning and has plentiful, comfortable seats; a starbucks (!); a great bar; and free wifi. It was helpful to have machines in the lobby to enable guests to check in on their flights. The rooms are a good size and have large flat screen TVs and great views. The shower is superb with great water pressure. The gym and pool were terrific, with a number of cardio machines (although they need to be checked because they seemed to rock back and forth when running fast). The weight room offered mroe equipment than comparable hotels. The hotel also offers great value and special deals. Now the cons: The beds can be a little soft. The AC was a bit difficult to figure out - it didn't seem to get cold very fast. The bathrooms were small, and the water pressure in the sink was low. There is no wifi in the rooms. The clock/radio is outdated and has no ipod hook-up. Overall, these are minor problems, and the great amenities in the hotel definitely made up for any shortcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent”
Reviews.Author: mvamor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business travel. Good rooms for work, some have nice views. Showers have curved shower rods for added comfort. Wish they would have lamps with built in plugs near the bed. Artwork in the rooms not so good. Beds very comfy with lots of pillows. Great location on Michigan Avenue. Many sites are walkable from here including Millennium Park and Rush Street. Lots of shopping on Michigan as well. Rush- the lobby bar- is always a great place to hang out. Staff friendly. Easy to grab cabs from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Robyn80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location for a Chicago event. There are plenty of restaurants, shopping, outdoor walking, and places to go within walking distance. The hotel staff is very nice as well. The views from the top floor of the lake is great too! If you have access to the club level I would take advantage of it. It is on the second floor and a very peaceful seclusion from the bustling lobby. There is free wifi in the lobby and a Starbucks that has a long line every morning as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value. Good Hotel in Heart of it All”
Reviews.Author: flyfishingattorney
Reviews.Content: Spent a late August 2011 Friday night and Saturday night here to celebrate a birthday. The hotel accepted a $109 a night Priceline bid. It is located at the corner of Ohio and Michigan, on the Magnificent mile 3 short blocks from the river and in the heart of it all. It's just across the street from the Intercontinental Hotel where we have stayed before. The room at the Marriott was larger and nicer with better quality showerhead than the Intercontinental and we'd likely stay at either hotel again but really preferred the Marriott for the room size and nicer, newer bathroom. It is a HUGE hotel. The lobby renovation has made the hotel feel much more vibrant and enjoyable to enter. The bar in the middle of the hotel is an OK circular bar. The front desk clerk was friendly and gladly accomodated our request to be as high as possible with a room on the 25th floor. As Priceline bidders, we had to take a double room which was OK because of the increased amount of space. The room, 2534, was very nice. Spacious, great view of Michigan Ave. Nice sitting chairs, comfortable desk and a bargain at $109 a night. The bathroom was very clean, nice bowed out shower, good water pressure, separate mirror and sink which was nice convenience. Beds and linens were top notch and very comfortable. Valet parking is $48 a night. Self park at the lot 1 short black away was $33 a night if your ticket was validated by the hotel. I commend the hotel because when we checked in we were asked if we'd self parked and were informed of the $7 a day discount off the $40 a night self park. Brand new equipment in the fitness room. The pool is nice, narrow but long. At 10 pm on a Friday there were too many kids in the pool to take a swim. It would seem like it might be a good idea to offer and adults only swim time from maybe 9 p.m. until the 11 pm pool closing time. However, to spend two nights on the Magnificent Mile in such a nice property for less than $325 with parking was a great deal. Great hotel There seems to be some de

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jml35
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during the air and water show weekend. Good location, just off the miracle mile, but service was very poor. They didn't clean our room the first night, until after 5 pm. Complained but the front desk didn't seem to care. Check out was more of the same, bad attitude. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlEJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Very modern - renovations are wonderful. Only downsides were small size of bathrooms in the rooms & the pillows were too squishy for me. Common areas were great - love the lobby bar. Location is awesome with access to both Michigan Ave & Rush St.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriotts and this one didn't disappoint either.”
Reviews.Author: MISSYMIDWEST
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious for a downtown hotel. Location is great. Close to the el. Taxis come by every minute. Easy to catch the bus on Michigan Ave. Nice, comfortable beds. Staff was attentive. Asked for a rollaway and received it within 10 minutes. Same for extra towels. Great lobby for resting or people-watching.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: aguyand3girls
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here while in town for the Rock & Roll Marathon. The hotel was perfectly located close to all of the magnicient mile shopping, great restaurants & all of the major attractions. We were able to walk or take the subway everywhere which saved on the cost and stress of finding parking. All of the associates we encountered at the hotel were very friendly and courteous. The room was a little smaller than what we expected, but it was very well appointed and very clean! The view of the mile we had more than made up for the size.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MireilleSB
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located on the magnificent mile, downtown Chicago. we stayed there for 2 days and our stay was pretty good. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and well kept. Location is just perfect! I recommend this hotel to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: watergirl3663
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an upscale hotel, close to shopping, fine dining, and all the sites of Chicago, the Marriott Chicago Downtown is for you. For business the Marriott has the space and facilities to accommodate almost any size conference or business get together. Exhibitor functions went off without a hitch and food selections for breakfast, lunch and evening receptions were good to very good. The staff is accommodating, warm and welcoming. The lobby bar is stylish with good service even when slammed with 600 conference attendees. Located on Michigan Ave (backing on Rush Street) restaurants, night life and the theater district are all within walking distance. The Marriott's signature pillow top beds offer a good nights rest for everyone. The only downside to the hotel that I experienced was the street noise at night. Bring a pair of ear plugs and you'll sleep like a baby. I haven't found a downtown Chicago hotel that doesn't struggle with this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice, rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: jballtraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time deciding weather or not to rate this hotel a 3 or a 4. I think overall, it's a 4, despite the size of the rooms. Location is great, walk out the front of the hotel and you are right in the heart of the Magnificent Mile shopping area. It couldn't be more perfect for shoppers. Lobby is great, RUSH, the bar area creates a nice atmosphere in the evening, lobby is large, lots of room for just lounging, mingling, etc. Furnishings are nice. Overall the only thing that really bothered me about this hotel was the rooms. I was just so surprised at how small they were for what we paid for a room. We stayed at another hotel last year for half the cost, and the room was at least twice as large. The bed was very comfortable. The shower water pressure was great. The bathroom however, there is no room for two people to stand in front of the mirror. There is also no fan when taking a shower. The bed takes up most of the room. They could really use some more space in these basic rooms. Breakfast at the Cafe was great, although a bit expensive if it wasn't included with our room rate. Waffles, pancakes, french toast, omlets were all available and food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bholdren
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a nice area within walking distance to good restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: copper2839
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel for a shopping weekend. It's the perfect location if you're looking to shop at all the shops along the Magnificent Mile. It's centrally located, within easy walking distance to Navy Pier (or take the free shuttle), and close to the river. We checked in during a very busy time, with a large convention on site, but still got great, friendly service, and a quick check in. Nice clean rooms, and despite the location, the rooms are quiet. Good concierge service recommended a river tour for us which was outstanding, and booked it for us as well. Overall, we would stay here again. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but business only”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Marriott Magnificent Mile this weekend for a romantic trip and was a bit disappointed with the hotel itself, but happy with the location. I booked through Priceline which was a total mistake because this hotel was classed completely wrong. A watchout for anyone who uses Priceline, they are not at all easy to work with if you are dissatisfied with your hotel upon arrival. The hotel itself is a bit older and the rooms are VERY small. It is a standard Marriott room, bed, shower/tub combo and limited amenities. The lobby area is very nice and the RUSH bar provides a fun place to grab a drink. The best thing about this hotel is the location as you are in the heart of the Magnificent Mile and can walk to most Downtown attractions (Navy Pier, Water Tower Place, etc.) and other attractions are a short cab ride away (United Center, North Ave shopping/restaurant district) All in all, I would ONLY recommend this hotel for business travel, if you are looking for a romantic weekend getaway, this is not the place despite what some reviews (and Priceline) may say.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dina S
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and they let us get our room early. Our room, situated on the 40th floor, had an AMAZING view. Our room overlooked Michigan Ave. AND had a great view of Lake Michigan. The room was average and clean. The bathroom was tiny, but clean. The beds however were extremely uncomfortable. Many reviews said the beds were comfortable, but ours was not at all comfortable. My husband actually slept on the chair one night because that was better than the bed. The room was also very warm and if we wanted it cooler we would have to call down to the front desk so we never bothered. The lobby was extremely loud which was kind of annoying. It would have been nice to go in the lounge and have a drink but it was way too loud. Overall - very nice stay though. A clean large room is most important to me - and that is what we got. We will definitely stay here again but hopefully find a much cheaper price. With valet parking ($48 a day) we paid $340 a night to stay in a regular king size room. I will be trying out Priceline when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: going_gone_again
Reviews.Content: Got this place on priceline for initial bid of $100, wish I had tried less just in case it would have worked. The location was ideal, we went north, south, east, and west on foot, bus, and subway. Bus stop two doors down, subway on the street going out the back door. One con was I'm not used to paying to use a computer in a business center at a hotel so I sat in the lobby and used my IPad instead. Also, the noise level in the lobby/bar in the evenings was the loudest I've ever heard. The pool was small and not worth getting chlorine in our hair so we didn't use it or the exercise room. But the room was typical Marriott, had a king bed and love seat, very comfortable bed, no complaints at all about the room. We got to check in before lunch so we could start playing tourist immediately and they stored our luggage after check out so we could play tourist until leaving for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but could benefit from room upgrades”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying in this hotel - it's got LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! The staff is alwys nice and accommodating, and the concierge floor has been through a recent renovation that created a lovely spot for elite members. However, it is time for the hotel to spend some money on room updates. Hallways are dark and not inviting. Room furniture is not updated. Additionally, because of the great location of this hotel, there is alot of noise from the street that can be heard in the rooms. Ask for a room on the side or front of the hotel - the curbside traffic and cab horns blowing on the back side of the hotel make those rooms very undesirable...even if you are on a higher floor. Hotel is extremely busy - especially as the weekend approaches - lots of convention traffic, lots of kids, lots of commotion in the lobby area!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good staff, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: eldub1999
Reviews.Content: Was here in business. The hotel does a lot of convention business, so check in was a bit of a mess as the previous convention was leaving when I arrived. Neverless, the desk clerk was friendly and did their best to get people moving as quickly as possible. Rooms are showing their age. The outlets in my room were pretty scary. Very loose and worn. Beds were decent, but nothing special. I did appreciate that they had several types of pillows, which is always a nice touch. Bathroom is small, but fiunctional. Oh, and they charge for Internet access. Bar was nice, but expensive. Staff did a great job of dealing with a constant crowd. Location is prime, with the front door right on Michigan Ave. Very nice shopping in the area, and wonderful restaurants and other night life. Walking distance to Navy Pier. Overall, pretty much an average hotel. There was nothing that stood out at particularly positive, and nothing that stoof out as particularly negative. Well, maybe the shoddy electical outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and experience in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: proudbrunette
Reviews.Content: Had a great winter experience in Chicago while staying at this Marriott. The rooms are quiet and clean, the location is a perfect starting point for sight-seeing and shopping, and the Starbucks in the lobby helped prepare me to face the cold each morning. They happened to have a really cool gingerbread display when I stayed there (in December), too. Normally hotel bars don't seem very popular, but this one was always lively as I was coming and going. Helpful staff when we needed public transportation information.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location for shopping on the Magnificant Mile!”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireSusieQ4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby and VERY comfortable beds, pillows and a great shower (really what else is essential when traveling??). The room was not large but three adult females and their shopping purchases fit in it with no difficulties for a weekend visit. The elevators were very slow though we were luckier than some folks and only waited a maximum of about five minutes. I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay there again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: fit4lyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and two young daughters for two nights in late July. We booked the hotel at a really great price via Priceline. Overall, the hotel was very nice. Below are the pros and cons: Pros: - Great location on Michigan Ave. Really close to the River and all shopping. Even Navy Pier is not too far - Room was very clean (we had a King Executive with pull-out couch) - Bathroom was very clean, albeit small - Staff were very helpful at all times (see below) - The bed was very comfortable and the furnishings were new and nice looking Cons: - They must have broken elevators. We needed to use the low-rise ones based on being on the 16th floor. However, at times, we would have to wait 5-10 minutes for the elevator. It made running down to the lobby to go to Starbucks out of the question. There was no quick way to leave the floor. We often had to wait in lines in the lobby to catch one back up. They really need to get this corrected. - Small bathrooms - Costly parking ($48 for valet per day) - Pulling up to valet is difficult as the drieway can only hold 4-5 cars. The street (Brush I think) gets backed up waiting for cars to turn into the hotel. - Pool was closed for one part of the weekend while they tried to determine the cause of some mysterious bubbles on the water surface. Pool was a little small but otherwise okay. Some rowdy children in the pool so some oversight by the staff would have helped (as the parents were not doing their job). My one daughter had a little accident in the pool (no, not that kind) and needed to go to the hospital. The security staff assisted us in getting transportation to the hospital (offered to call an ambulance but it was not necessary). They locked out our room (as it was near check-out time) and were there to assist us once we got back from the emergency room. That was greatly appreciated. All-in-all a good experience. Would stay there anytime I am in Chicago if they get the elevator issue sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying in this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IsabelitaBCasibang
Reviews.Content: We held our convention in Marriott Hotel Downtown Magnificent Mile. I may not have gone out for a tour of the city since i am part of the officers in this busy convention but I have met the many departmental managers who made us feel so very welcome and important. The staff of the hotel are very attentive to our needs during the many events of our group. The chef had done his best to accommodate our food requests and our gala food was perfect in serving size and great taste. The catering event order manager was so patient working with us all the way through the last day of our event and there was not a snag in every step of the way in our activities. Great staffing and great hotel to stay and deal business with.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding reception.”
Reviews.Author: vjfriesema
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and accommodating, the food at the wedding reception was delicious and the room at the end of the night was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melace112
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location of this hotel. You are walking distance to everything. Beautiful lobby and bar area when you first walk in. Shopping is directly downstairs as well as many good restaurants. Rooms are a decent size but not huge. Our room was very clean and the property in general seemed very well maintained. We enjoyed our stay and I have previously stayed at the doubletree down the street by honestly, there was no comparison, we enjoyed this hotel much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a convention”
Reviews.Author: LKSIMS
Reviews.Content: I attended a four day convention at the Marriott Magnificent Mile. The hotel was very clean and accommodating. Banquet facilities and assistance by the banquet staff was great. The helped during the day of decorating and provided manpower to assist with lifting and carrying boxes from one floor to another. Overall it was a great place to stay in Chicago. It is closed to shopping and many great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no wireless in rooms”
Reviews.Author: vicky_1000
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - average big American hotel with ok service and food. Downsides were wifi only in reception and not in the room. Plus while they position themselves for big meetings and congresses the breakfast room is way too small - at peak time you had to wait 15-30 min to be seated. Thank goodness for the Starbucks in the lobby! Major plus: location right next to the main shopping area and lots of restaurants in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MSUmindy
Reviews.Content: I spent a very happy 4 nights in the Marriott Downtown Magnificent Mile last week for a convention. The staff is outstanding in all aspects: front desk, concierge, housekeeping, lobby bar. The rooms were immaculately clean, although standard and a little small. The bathrooms were adequate. The beds were extremely comfortable, well equipped with excellent pillows and linens. The blackout curtains and window treatments were wonderful. Our room on the 28th floor had an excellent view of the city. The air conditioning was superior, especially since it was in the mid to high 90's throughout our stay. The elevators are adequate, although slow at some peak times. My only food experience was with the banquet facilities since several meals were part of the convention. The wait staff was excellent, the food was good portions, nicely presented and flavorful and hot. The convention facilties were clean, in excellent repair, and comfortable for a group of 2000. I will be visiting Chicago again in November, and may stay at the Marriott Downtown Magnificent Mile again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the usual Marriott service”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Shop
Reviews.Content: Here for 7 days. Check-in in middle of afternoon. Only room available is next to elevator shaft; always a mistake but no option; place is supposedly full. Connecting door does not lock. Have to wait on engineering; wonder if that had not been reported before. Complimentary room service ice cream provided but an hour wait. Water in sink and toilet gurgles all the time probably due to suction in elevator shaft; never experienced that before. Movie service disabled (not at our request); have to wait to get it turned on because computers are down. 3rd day and weekend - now there is a crying baby and hacking cougher in next room so elevator on one side and baby on other. It won't ruin our week in Chicago but certainly did not score any points for Marriott. Beautiful hotel but service for issues disappeared. Oh, and housekeeping came on the first day at 8:15 am. That has not been repeated!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience. Poor service, rooms sub-par.”
Reviews.Author: Jannie0104
Reviews.Content: I am an elite member and me and my family were treated horribly. First, they overcharged me, didn't apologize and asked to see my ID several times, perhaps thinking I was a thief since I had a credit card be declined because they were trying to charge me way too much. No apologies. We waited for over an hour for bags to be delivered. We waited 3 hours for extra pillows! Housekeeping didn't get to make up our room till 5pm -- again with no apology. Rooms were only sub-par, with stains on carpet, walls. Elevators were an awful experience. Fans in room were poor as well. Service at every turn was rude. Don't stay here, even if you get rooms for free with points!

Reviews.Title: “Not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: Rlwolf2000
Reviews.Content: Booked an overnight at the Marriott this Saturday with the thought of enjoying the location and going to the Cubs game the next day. Location was good if you want to be near the shopping on Michigan Avenue and near Navy Pier. As usual the staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a teacherâ€™s convention at the hotel so it was very busy and the elevators were running very slowly. Biggest issue I had was that the rooms were small and the bathrooms were very small. As a Marriott elite member I supposedly get upgraded to the best rooms available and if that was the best room available I would recommend going somewhere else. The pool that they show on the hotel website makes it look big...one of the reasons I picked the hotel. When we got there it ended up being a two lane lap pool at best. Also, just bought an iPad and brought it with us to use. The rooms do not offer wireless service so if you need to connect you need do it at the lobby or lower levels. Overall not happy with the value proposition at this property. Total cost of one night about $300.00 with valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: fltstandards
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much for a great stay! From the moment we walked in the front desk person Alexis G. was so helpful in finding our bearings. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and Michigan Ave. is fantastic. We loved the restaurant down the street, Bandero's (?) and the shopping for my wife great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JudyandDave
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan Avenue but the room was small and the car parking expensive (as it is, however, in this area). No one would pay the posted price for the room. Can't move without tipping and internet is only free if you are on the 1st or 2nd floors. The local motel in the suburbs never charges for this service! Here it is $14.95 per day in your room!!

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, 1960's dated room, not chic!”
Reviews.Author: peaches032
Reviews.Content: Lobby great Staff helpful Rooms old and outdated

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Viajeroojuelense
Reviews.Content: A great business oriented hotel. A very good location in downtonwn Chicago. Tip: The official address is North Michigan Avenue, but the real main entrance is in the back street. Free Internet only at the lobby. Otherwise, a $ 14.95 fee applies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: urbanrover
Reviews.Content: Traveled with three friends to see two Yankees-Cubs games. First trip to Chicago and the Marriott staff made it a real treat, from early check-in to securing tickets for a Saturday game. Great location, easy access to subway, great proximity to some fine restaurants. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: MikeB92
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel I would say is it's location. It is really downtown and close to everything you would like to see when visiting Chicago. Hotel itself has a very nice lobby but the rooms are pretty small, beds are very comforable, bathroom could be a little bigger and need some updating. Staff was very friendly and willing to assist if needed

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but rooms need upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: voyager9999
Reviews.Content: Probably cannot get a better location than this one: right on the Mile and within walking distance of a lot of great things. Problem is that the rooms are (extremely) small, and the hotel in general needs some serious renovation. The lobby may look new and "fresh", the hallways and rooms look old... Not cheap either but that's the location you pay for I assume.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location. Would recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jaimek125
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location for visiting Chicago. It's easy walking distance to restaurants, the River, the Lake, nightlife and the L Train. The rooms are a bit old, but the lobby is nice and the staff is truly exceptional. They could not have made our stay easier or more seamless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience all Around”
Reviews.Author: EDSTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 week old daughter and I stayed at the Marriott for my cousins wedding in 2010. I was extremely impressed with the hotel start to finish. I called ahead to get recommendations for travel to and from the airport as we didn't want to take the train with an 8 week old. The front desk gave several great options. They also accommodated an early check-in (with crib) for us so my daughter could nap as soon as we arrived and an adjoining room with my mother so she could babysit during the trip. Everything was ready when we arrived with no problem. I travel a lot for business and find it an unusual surprise when all the details I have tried to handle up front are actually handled when I arrive so I was THRILLED. The hotel location is ideal for folks looking to see Chicago. We had never spent any real time in the city and found we could walk or take public transport to everywhere we wanted to go. My cousin's wedding and reception also took place at the Marriott. I plan events for a living so I spend a lot to time working with hotel staff's and eating hotel food. The Marriott did a hands down amazing job. The ballroom looked great, the staff was quick and polite and the food was great!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice place to stay with a great location and to anyone planning an event.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momtraveler01
Reviews.Content: Great location. We did the "American Girl" package. Our daughter loved getting a bed for her doll. We loved the view from our room of the city skyline. Clean and neat. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: charlielonnie
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place to stay in Chicago. Every staff member I encountered was extremely friendly. The bed was comfortable. My only complaint would be the size of the bathroom. Very small space with a very small tub.

Reviews.Title: “A study in extremes.”
Reviews.Author: abronxman
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a real hot and cold experience. On the one hand, the location is outstanding. Walking distance or a very short cab ride to almost every major downtown attraction and a bevy of outstanding restaurants including GIbson's Steakhouse and La Frontera. Not to mention the shopping on Michigan Ave. Hard to find a better location. On the other hand, the service left a lot to be desired. First, the hotel cancelled our reservation by mistake. We found out about this when Marriott.com sent us an email saying I had cancelled the reservation. As I said, this was their mistake. Mistakes happen, but when they do you expect hotel staff to go above and beyond to make up for their error. Instead they first tried to pin the blame on me. After "doing me a favor" to see if there was any availability, I was told that I was lucky to get a room since "this is a very busy weekend." I ultimately found a manager who took the time to investigate the problem and to read the emails that I received from Marriott. He admitted that the cancellation was the hotel's error and apologized for his subordinates' performance. To his credit - and I do have to give him a lot of credit for this - the manager gave us a major room upgrade to make up for the problem and the poor way it had been handled by his subordinates. The manager seemed genuinely disappointed in his subordinates and equally genuine in his desire to make up for the problem. I'm grateful to him, but it should not have taken a high level hotel manager to address this problem. The facilities were very mediocre. When we got to the upgraded room, almost the best the hotel had to offer, it smelled like a gallon of sour milk. We called housekeeping, and they replaced the room's refrigerator and deodorized the room. Again, a good response, but how is it the housekeepers didn't notice the incredible stench when they cleaned the room? Aside from the smell, the upgraded room (a king suite) was nice, but it felt a little like a set from L.A. Law. I'm sure it was truly outstanding in the 1980's, but in 2011 it's dated and rundown. Indeed, all of the hotel felt like it had last been renovated in the '80s if not earlier. Finally the lobby bar was crowded, noisy and expensive. We tried to have a drink after a day of sightseeing, just to be surrounded by drunken, noisy and fairly obnoxious conventioneers. Ugh. We visited friends at the Hyatt Regency, a place with a similar bar set up as in the Marriott, and found that the Hyatt's lobby bar was quieter and more pleasant even though it was also full. All in all this was a clean, conveniently located hotel. Neither the facilities nor many (but not all) of the staff were of the caliber I would have expected from a major downtown hotel. I think that the nearby Embassy Suites or the Hyatt Regency would have been more comfortable. I hope that they do a major renovation soon, and that staff starts being held to higher standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & gym - tiny room”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend when working in the area. It is in a great location amongst all the shopping of Michigan Avenue, and is within walking distance of Navy Pier and Watertower Place. The gym is great - it is two separate rooms (a cardio room and a weight room) separated by an indoor pool. There was what looked like may have been a sundeck for use during the summer months, but it was still chilly when I was there. That said, the room and bathroom were tiny - not a big deal if you are just using it to sleep, but I needed space to work. Also, the furniture seemed a llittle out of date, and the windows were not insulated well. From the 38th floor, I could hear the street noise all night long - it was noisier than the Times Square hotel I just checked out of. Parking is $51/day and is valet only.

Reviews.Title: “No WiFi in Guest Rooms and Noisy Lobby.”
Reviews.Author: JJJ830
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Marriott. Â My original plan was to stay with friends during my vacation to the windy city, but they were out of town for the week. I was able to book at a rate of $159 a night for a Monday to Wednesday stay. Â  Before I booked, I signed up for Marriott rewards and a friend was able to get me Gold status for the trip.Â  I took theÂ El/CTA blue line from o'hare and transferred to the red line at Jackson station. Â The hotel is two blocks away from the Grand station. Â Total travel time of an hour. Â Note that as of May 2011 the northbound side does not have escalator or elevator service at Grand station, so be prepared to haul any luggage up two flights of stairs. Â If you take CTA or a taxi from O'Hare, avoid arriving during rush hour.Â  When I arrived at the hotel, the first thing I noticed was the amount of noise in the lobby. The check-in desk is also in the lobby and the amount of noise made it very difficult to hear during the check-in process. Meghen promptly greeted me and asked me if I had plans for the Bruins game that night (I was wearing a Bruins jersey). I appreciated that she recognized this along with my gold status. Â She recommended that I watch the game a Timothy O'tools, a few blocks away.Â  I made the mistake of also asking the concierge for a sports bar recommendation to watch the Bruins game. The concierge recommended a bar called Fado, a few blocks away on West Hubbard Street. The bar had a handful of patrons and had five televisions, none of which were on. Â I promptly left and did not ask the concierge for any additional recommendations during the rest of my stay.Â  My room was on the 42nd floor, one dedicated to gold and platinum members. The size of the room was adequate along with the decor. The bathroom was a little on the small side with the toilet less than a foot away from the tub; Fortunately I was not planning to take any baths. Also, the toilet seat would not stay upright, which was a mild inconvenience to me. Â It is important to note that the guest rooms do not have any wifi signal for wireless internet. Additionally, the cellular signal strength on the 42nd floor was shoddy at best for both Verizon Wireless and ATT. Â There is free wireless in the lobby, but it is extremely loud and difficult to get any work done.Â  I requested a late checkout the night before and was given a 1 PM time. I checked back the following morning at the front desk and was greeted by Meghen again. She followed up with me about hockey game, which impressed me that she remembered. I was hoping to get a 3 PM checkout, but ended up getting a 2 PM slot.Â  The lack of wireless Internet in the room, poor cellular reception in the room and extremely noisy lobby were all major shortcomings of the Marriott Downtown Â Magnificent Mile and i will stay elsewhere the next time I am in Chicago.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great views and location; a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: petersam
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, and I was given the exact room I requested along with my Marriott profile preferences (high room, away from elevator). The view was great, and the room was clean and in perfect condition. High def TV and Internet worked great, and the desk and bed were very comfortable. Maybe the only complaint was that some rooms, like mine, were smaller than others - I don't know why the hotel was built that way. The Starbuck's in the lobby was very convenient. The fitness center was also large and in good condition, and the attendant offered me some fruit on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jlsheff
Reviews.Content: Location is fabulous to see the sights and sounds of Chicago. The room had two double beds and a small bathroom. There is no room safe. While trivial for a Category 6 property, and prices to boot, one should expect more amenities in the room. The lobby is very loud and chaotic. The bar area described in other reviews provide an accurate description of its nature.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Benson1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with a whole bunch of colleagues for five days. It is surely not a new hotel, but it is okay. The rooms are big enough, only the bathroom could be slightly bigger or at last have a better layout (left side = bathtub, right side = wash table and in the center the toilett). There is no mini bar in the room, but at least the vending machine was close. The location in Chicago itself is great. There are plenty of restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance and you can also find several 7elevens. Pricewise, well we have been there for a big conference, so everything is more expensive, but usually I would say the 240 $ were too much. One more thing: The Lobby Bar is called "Rush" and during our stay there was really party every night. Nice place, but loud.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: mrshortpants
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of spending four days here during a work conference. The rooms were small, the food was pretty bad, and service was unreliable (forgot my room service order one morning). Unless it's a steal, I just don't know why you'd stay there.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: heyheyrog123
Reviews.Content: Location aside, the hotel was just okay. They had a nice lobby and very friendly help. I asked for a King, but got one of those weird double rooms with half of a window. They also had no mini-bar and a empty vending machine. I would recommend this hotel based on location and value, I believe my room experience was unique, since they probably have only 1 half window room per floor. They had flat screens that actually had an HD connection which was awesome. Also, the bathroom was weird, I had to lean over the toilet to turn on the shower. All minor complaints, nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstayner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile March 31 - April 3 for an Resident Anesthesia Convention. Although this was the Convention Hotel, the rate was $160/nt + tax. I was able to book on Priceline for $79/nt + taxes/fees. For this price, the hotel was a good value. It was a typical Marriott Hotel, though the bathroom in my standard King room on the 22nd floor seemed a bit cramped. The hotel is 3 blocks from the Grand Station on the Red "EL" train line. It was extremely convenient to use the train to get to the hotel from Midway. We used a combination of trains and walking to see many sights in Chicago including the Field Museum, Art Institute, Millennium Park, Navy Pier, China Town, Greek Town and Hancock Tower. The pool was standard, the jacuzzi was closed. The Cardio fitness center had new equipment - several elipticals and tread mills with personal TV screens - very nice. Some colleagues said the view from the upper floors (28 and higher) were quite good. My room was on the 22nd floor, we could see the Navy Pier just fine and look down Michigan Avenue. I think that using Priceline you can book a 4 star hotel in this area for less than $100/night incl. tax. There are quite a few 4 star hotels that are very nice and I was just lucky that the hotel I got on Priceline happened to be the one at which my convention was held.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: This is a large and very busy hotel. Nice lobby bar, but it was quite crowded for the two days I was there. Location on north Michigan Ave is prime. Access to great shopping, restaurants and bars within walking distance. The rooms are decent. Not four-star luxury, but not bad. Average size rooms with flat screens, desk and fridge. Pros: Floor to ceiling windows are very cool and make for a nice city view. Cons: Yes, the bathrooms are small, and the city can be loud at times given your location, even where I was on the 27th floor. I booked this through Priceline so I was satisfied with the value. If I were paying in the $200+ range I'd probably have been a little less satisfied. Overall, you will not do bad with this hotel whether you're traveling on your own or with your family.

Reviews.Title: “nice renovations but PRIMEEEEEE location”
Reviews.Author: keepsitreal
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at this hotel for two nights in mid-march. got a very competitive rate of $149/night through marriott's website. the best feature of the hotel is its prime location on the magnificent mile in downtown chicago...2 block walk to cta "l" train and close to shopping and great dining. hub 51 is three blocks away and i would definitely recommend it for dinner and drinks. we didn't work out, swim, use the biz center, or eat @ hotel because we tried to spend as much time as possible exploring the city. so i cannot comment on any amenities. room size was average for a big city. the hotel was packed when we were there and the rooms were not well soundproofed. lots of noise came from the halls. otherwise, it was a very comfortable stay typical of marriott. there was also a separate check-in desk for rewards members w/ no line, a kiosk in the lobby where you could print boarding passes for free, and check out via phone. innovative timesavers and conveniences like that were really impressive and would definitely lead me to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For a convention hotel, this one is good!”
Reviews.Author: stefmo
Reviews.Content: Arrival experience: Great! Walked from the train's Grand Station, arriving at the automobile court. Several bellhops immediately inquired if I needed assistance with my two bags (one on wheels, the other tethered to it). Lots of smiles and a warm welcome, with specific instructions on where to find the reception desk. Checkin experience: Neva was so cordial and friendly! She upgraded my room on the spot when I requested it. Room: Typical of large-city hotels, the room was rather small, but more than adequate for my needs. I had a king room on the 37th floor, with a west view. Floor-to-ceiling windows added to the breathtaking view! The bed was incredibly comfortable and loaded with extra pillows. The linens were in excellent condition and spotlessly clean. The desk was a bit worn, and the room safe took a while to locate... it's in what used to be the bottom drawer of the nightstand: the drawer has been turned into a door. :) Bathroom: Perfectly clean, but tiny. And I mean tiny. The door barely clears the front of the toilet seat. Single sink vanity with lots of counter space. The tub seemed a bit old, but it was spotless. Curved shower rod with updated shower curtain. Public areas: Clean clean clean! Elevators are "divided" into low-rise and high-rise. Conference center: Confusing! There is an extreme lack of signage and wayfinding - to the point that Marriott employees were actually always on-hand to guide people to the correct rooms/floors. Seems to be a waste of human resources, when appropriate and adequate signs could provide that service! Escalators in the conference area totally skip the 6th floor - and I never found the stairs so getting an elevator was sometimes a challenge, especially during busy times. Lobby bar: Great service, even when it was packed with conventioneers! I highly recommend the chips-n-fondue and the mini Chicago-style hotdogs. Be sure to try their site-made honey beer (there are 100,000 bees on the roof of the hotel). Harvest: Second-floor restaurant. Great food - superb service. Chef's salad was a bit of a disappointment, though - I was expecting something other than iceberg lettuce. The chicken & mushroom sandwich is very tasty. I had the house-made potato chips, but my traveling companions had the garlic cheese fries and said they were quite good as well. Checkout: I requested a late checkout of 1:00 (normal checkout is noon) and was immediately accommodated. When I realized 1:00 would really be pushing it, with my conference schedule, I called to see if I could back it off until 2:00 and was denied. I checked out with three minutes to spare, and stored my bags at the bellstand - as much as that goes against my grain. Departure: Bellhop hailed a cab the instant we walked out the door, telling the driver which airport we wanted, and double-checking that he took credit cards. All-in-all, I'd definitely stay here again. As always, the biggest downside of staying at a Marriott is the ridiculous daily charge for Internet service (here, it's $14.95 for noon-to-noon service).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: HumJer
Reviews.Content: This place has some of the most modern looking rooms I've been in recently. Last March, I spent about a week at The Magnificent Mile working and it provided an exceptionally comfortable and enjoyable stay. The fitness facilities were very nice and the lobby was a great and stunning place to hangout after work. I'd recommend the Goose Island Honkers Ale or Green Line Ale if you are having a drink downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT!”
Reviews.Author: whiterussian17
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! I joined my husband for a couple of days on his business trip there with my 22 month old son. The service was excellent, fast, and courteous. The staff made it very easy for me to get around with my toddler. The location is perfect, easy walking to water tower place and north bridge mall (right next door). The restaurants around the hotel are plentiful, any type of food you wish is practically around the corner. I can't say enough of this wonderful hotel. Clean, comfortable, trendy and a hot spot. So perfect. Checking out was the saddest part

Reviews.Title: “The service was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: calgrads
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Chicago for four freezing days at the end of January. However, the employees at the Marriott Chicago Downtown hotel made the experience truly enjoyable. The hotel was quite full, but the service was always quick and pleasant. My room was also clean and comfortable. A wonderful business hotel! Also, you can't beat the location of this hotel. It is within easy walking distance of excellent restaurants and shopping. Not to mention Starbuck's in the hotel lobby....!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience! Lost my reservation and couldn't have cared less.”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Grabow
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through a group rate a month in advance to my stay. I received a confirmation e-mail and put little more thought into it. I called a couple days in advance to book a spa package, and they seemed to have my reservation. When I arrived they said they had no reservation for me. They tried to get rid of me right away. They said I must have booked at a different hotel and they did not have any rooms available. I pulled up the reservation and gave them the confirmation number. They laughed at me and said they have no idea what website I booked through but that number didn't mean anything to them. I told them I knew I had booked at their hotel and I used their 800 reservation number to book. They suggested that I called them and find out what hotel I was booked at. I did and found out I was booked at that hotel on that date. They asked to talk to the lady at the counter. I handed her my phone and after saying hello twice she handed my phone back to me and told me it sucked. I asked if we could call their reservation line using the land line, because I wasn't getting much of a signal, which she didn't even respond to, she just told me she had to go check something and left for 20 minutes. She found someone else and they tried scanning my credit card and it came up with another guest that was checked in already. They asked me if I was with that person, whos name was very similar to my last name. I said no. They asked a few other questions and then told me that didn't mean anything. I begged to differ as my credit card should not be attached to any room other then mine. They thought it would be reassuring to me to say the card wouldn't be charged. What I really wanted to know is how or why it happened. Finally a manager came around and found a room for me. He was the only helpful person I ran into. It wasn't the room type I booked or at the rate I had booked. All night long kids were running up and down the halls screaming and they seemed to not care. At the front desk they just said they had a lot of complaints about that. They told me I would have to call back the sales department on the weekdays to find out what happened to my reservation. I called back monday morning and they didn't really ave an answer for me. They said it looked like they were right at the hotel and the reservation never made it into their system. They told me that just because you have a confirmation number for your reservation does not mean you have a reservation. They told me that most of the times their reservation system works, sometimes it doesn't. I should call before I leave and make sure the hotel actually has a reservation for me. Again they tried to put the fault on me. For the price and service you can do much, much better in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel, Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: katiey424
Reviews.Content: We arrived during a very busy morning at this hotel. We found out that 400 conference guests were checking out, while around 800 were checking in at the same time. The line even to pull through the valet area was long! We approached the elite desk, passing by a line of 30 guests waiting at check-in. Our rooms were not ready yet (it was lunchtime) but the conference was starting so we checked our bags. Our rooms were ready around 3 p.m. but a few in our group did not have a room until after 5 p.m. The staff was as accomodating and friendly as possible, so it was hard to get upset. Rooms are small, with a bathroom that would only fit one person at a time - barely! Since it was extremely cold, the heat in the room had been cranked high and I could not control it. A call to the front desk wasn't much help - who ever visited my room just turned off the system and cracked the window in my room. The only solution was to sleep without any heat running - it was stifling! However, I never got cold - there were lots of extra blankets and bedding in the closet. The staff members were very helpful during the conference. They were waiting to point you in the right direction and eager to help in any way possible. The small guest store near the front desk had exactly what I needed and the water is cheaper than in the rooms! The indoor pool area was large, and the fitness room was nice - personal tv's at each station. Within walking distance, you have plenty of restaurants, shopping, and other service (Walgreen's, Trader Joe's, Nordstrom Spa/Salon). Check out was a breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very dated”
Reviews.Author: Naptown2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Lobby is nice. Workers are great. The rooms are extremely small and tired. Carpeting, paint, bathrooms are in bad shape. Rooms need complete renovation..

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Emzaro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to a city to have a short getaway without our 3 kids. We originally planned on NYC, but are so glad we did something different. We hadn't been to Chicago and did some research online for hotels. As always, there are negative reviews and positive reviews for every hotel. We have Marriott points and decided on this Marriott hotel vs the others in downtown Chicago because of the location. We were very happy with our decision. The room was small, but that's what you get in the city. The lobby is spacious and has a big bar. We went to it on our way up to our room each night just for a little drink... just because we could! Taxis were always available. We took it to go to the Sears tower (now Willis), and to the Cadillac Palace to see a show... beautiful theatre!!! The movie theatre is also walking distance from the hotel.... I mean right around the corner, 2 minute walk. How nice it was to decide last-minute to go to the movies and be able to walk in no time. We also highly recommend The Purple Pig restaurant which we stumbled upon when walking in the city. It's about a 5-minute walk at most. We love wine and cheese so it was perfect! The hotel staff was great, bed comfortable, clean room, food was fine at the bar and the club level. In all, we enjoyed our stay. We also saw many families, but it was still a good place for a romantic getaway. Location was PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Marriott and convenient to shopping”
Reviews.Author: utfiero
Reviews.Content: Arrival experience: Very helpful and accommodating staff on arrival. Room (general): Nice flat screen TV, ok size for Chicago. Generally clean. Bathroom: cramped bathroom but nice granite counters. Bed: Good bed. Houskeeping: Good. Restaurants: We didnâ€™t eat on site but ate at the concierge lounge. Good food in the lounge. Bar: Nice bar in lobby. Grounds: n/a city hotel Pool: floor with pool was being remodeled. Staff attitude/service: Excellent staff and very helpful doorman. Perks for status: Free breakfast and evening snack in the club but no room upgrade. Parking: we didnâ€™t use the valet. Misc: On Michigan Ave., very convenient to shopping, great restaurants, Hancock Tower, etc. For some high-res photos of this hotel, check out my photos on Flicrk. My username on Flicker is utfiero.

Reviews.Title: “Great American Girl Package for kids!”
Reviews.Author: kes1983
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago as a Christmas gift for my 2 daughters, 9 and 7. We selected this hotel because of the value of the American Girl package and the location. We were very happy right from the beginning. The service was great. The girls loved the cookies and milk delivery and the doll beds. The pool area was nice and there was plenty of room to spread out there. We also enjoyed the spacious lounge area because we could spread out and have a cocktail with our kids relaxing with us before heading out on the town without the feeling of an adult bar scene. The breakfast was fabulous, great selection, omlettes and the best salsa! The only thing I wish they would have included is free internet service. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, not the best for adults”
Reviews.Author: dalangdon
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was the time of year that I stayed here (the weekend before Christmas) but this place was crazy with families: the pool (even the Jacuzzi), the lobby (even the bar), every place was packed with Children I've got nothing against kids - got three of my own, and I know what it's like to travel with children - but if I knew I was going to be booked into a kindergarden I would have looked elsewhere. I don't want to be the only adult in the hot tub, or sitting next to a kid when I want to get my drink on. I'd settle for an adult swim time and a better division between Cocktail Lounge and Ikea Ballroom. Facilities-wise, it was what you'd expect of a Marriott: clean and friendly, if a bit worn for the rates they charge. But location really is everything.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect........”
Reviews.Author: MSSCt
Reviews.Content: my husband and I went to Chicago for a wedding. We had very limited time so we wanted to stay at a hotel which would be centrally located to everything. This hotel was the best. The rooms were nice and clean. Bathroom a bit small but OK. The lobby was packed which was nice if you like that for ambiance. Location for shopping and restaurants was great. Can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, comfortable and perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: Celeste598
Reviews.Content: Not one complaint about this hotel. It's close to everything you could want to see during a short stay in Chicago. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very average for the money”
Reviews.Author: Lshields28
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this hotel for a family of four or more, I would not recommend it (unless you reserve a suite). My husband and I stayed there this week with our two kids and the standard guest room was so small we could not tolerate being in it for more than just sleeping, i.e. no lounging, watching tv, ordering room service, etc. It was shocking, actually - as soon as we stepped into the room we were all tripping over each other and the bathroom was barely big enough for an adult to turn around in. Luckily we have family that is local so that we could spend the majority of our time there. For $200 per night, however, this was disappointing - I have definitely stayed in nicer hotels for less money so location is clearly the primary factor here. I do have to say though that the restaurant and valet service were excellent; the staff was very friendly and accommodating, check in/out were speedy and the beds were VERY comfortable (although the rooms could use some updating).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff makes you forget that you're in a big convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: HalleBros
Reviews.Content: The location, in the heart of the Magnificent Mile, is excellent. The lobby is cheerfully decorated in bright colors and was a lively and vibrant space all hours of the day. The room was average, with a more "urban" decor--darker colors and more contemporary furnishings--than many Marriott properties. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was on the smallish side, probably because the building dates from the 1970s and the size was typical of the era. Even though this is a big convention hotel, every member of the staff went out of their way to be friendly and welcoming. From the woman who was helping coordinate the (not too long) check-in line, to the front desk clerk, the bellman walking past me in the lobby, and even the housekeeping staff--all offered smiles and greetings that one finds in smaller, boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett755
Reviews.Content: I arrived early on a Tuesday morning and they checked me right in. They didn't have a king room available so they just put me in a room with two double beds. I went up to 1110 and it was pretty small, the room had a weird musty smell at first but quickly passed. It was really clean, but the bathroom was a bit old and for the amount of money the room cost, I thought it would be a tiny bit nicer. The service in the lobby was great, I asked for a sewing kit and literally in 5 mins there was someone at my door with one. The only bad thing was that someone called my room at 6:30am and woke me up and when I picked up no one was there... The bed was really comfortable and I could have slept in it for another few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Price for location not for quality of hotel”
Reviews.Author: fxc3
Reviews.Content: A Marriott--you would think you would get all the amenities--internet computer stations, soft sheets and towels, more than 15 channels on TV, drawers that close, and toilets that flush... this was more like a Holiday Inn with Marriott prices. Had a king sized bed regular room for a conference this past week in Chicago. The location is great (right downtown) and walkable to shops, the park, etc. Its kind of a dump in the room. The toilet handle flusher--it fell off when I pushed it down. And the bathroom is REALLY tiny (think European bathroom). The drawers for the nightstand and dresser did not close (worse than IKEA furniture!) and the room they put me in was across the way from the freight elevator / maid area so I had a lot of noise and traffic. The gym has about 6 treadmills and 6 eliptical machines (all have TVs on them--plus). Weight room is pretty new. They gym is pretty small and kind of confining but at least they have one. Conference rooms were fine & the people who worked here were very friendly. But for a Marriott--you would expect the simple things to work and to be a luxurious stay. Nope. Think Holiday Inn. Without the coffee maker or microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jules47_123
Reviews.Content: in the heart of downtown Chicago, just where we wanted to be. Front desk personnel were very polite and willing to help us in anyway..Room was very clean and restock everyday

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good views - good value”
Reviews.Author: scottbill
Reviews.Content: When in Chicago on business, there are a number of good choices. Personally I'd prefer a place with a pool that you could actually do laps in, but everything else was as it should be. If you're looking for a convenient downtown location, courteous and efficient staff and a quite room with a decent view, look no further. Although the majority of my meals were out on the town, the few that I ate in the hotel were very good. Room service was exceptionally fast and checkout was painless.

Reviews.Title: “Annoyed”
Reviews.Author: by_my_way
Reviews.Content: On business. Typically spend little time in the room. Back from dinner tried to turn on the tube, no dice. Light in the bathroom also went out. Out early the next am, so did not have time to complain before having to run to meetings. Otherwise.... Room was average at best. Staff was fine. Lobby packed with conventioneers. Had a colleague that must have had a new room, said it was much nicer (renovated). Assume the tv and lights worked fine for him. In case you guys are tuning in, i think room was 2334. Fix the tv and lights for the next guest...

Reviews.Title: “not for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: lodovico99
Reviews.Content: Room adequate except for persistent wet spot on carpet about 2 feet in diameter near the closet. Rug was dark and I didn't notice it until walking in bare feet on last day. Definitely not from the room bath. Too far away. The free wireless internet was a joke. Could never connect and when I did the service was excruciatingly slow. Went to the business center for a wired connection and it was almost as bad. Definitely not what a business traveler wants. Pricey bar/restaurant attached. Tiny Starbucks on site without any seating. Good location one block from Michigan Ave. I asked the desk clerk to print my boarding passes the day before I was to leave and she told me to do it myself. She must have known how slow the internet was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Adequate facilities”
Reviews.Author: CARose
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for two nights while attending a conference. Arrived via ORD. No hotel shuttle. No problem. Plenty of transportation options. Cab far $35 â€“ 40. You canâ€™t beat the location as others comment the most on. Right in the heart of Rush and Michigan. No car necessary, plenty of shopping and dining facilities available by foot. Check in: Fast and efficient. Staff was courteous and professional. Room: Standard, basic King room. Well appointed but small. Large flat screen TV several channels available. It appeared that the room was remodeled within the last few years. The bathroom left a lot to be desired, and obviously had not been part of the remodel. Very small. You barely enough clearance to close the door due to its rather close proximity to the toilet. Small vanity, just enough room to put some toiletries. Old chipped tiles in the bathroom. The worst was having hair in the tub on arrival. The toilet didnâ€™t want to flush unless you held down the handle until it did. Need I say more? Very disappointing. Two of the lights had blown bulbs. I did call and complain about the hair and bulbs and this was taken care of. Conference facilities were adequate. Catering was above average. There is a large lobby bar that tends to be a gathering place in the evenings. It was difficult to find a place to sit. Forget about having a conversation. It was very noisy. Executive lounge exceeded expectations. Large, ample seating and quiet. Plenty of food and drink offerings, excellent service. Overall, an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, right in the middle of Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: Jennie35805
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location was great, smack in the middle of Mchigan Ave. The only complaint I have is that the bed wasn't that great. The top mattress keeps on sliding from the bed, making for a very uncomfortable night for my son, who tends to move around a lot. Beware if you're planning on using the internet or printing anything, because it costs plenty of money to use the computer center!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping and seeing the sights!”
Reviews.Author: collegemomIowa
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in the hotel which gave me time to walk and explore. Great place for window-shopping! When he was off, we walked to dinner at a different restaurant every night, walked to the Navy Pier, Art Institute, all over. The hotel room was OK, wished there had been a refrigerator and wished for free internet - paid $15/ day for it. Also $48/day for parking! Loved the Starbucks in the hotel - very nice staff there. We will be reimbursed for the hotel, otherwise too expensive for us! But we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Marriot excellent location”
