Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: Marriot on Magnificent mile is the best location in terms of shopping, restaurant, and subway. The lobby is beautiful, check in staff very accommodating-they allowed us in our room at 10am since we took an earlier flight. Rooms are small, nice HD TV, though the washroom is a bit tight, the toilet is in front of the door you cannot close it, very uncomfortable. Washrooms are also a bit dated, and our sink did not drain properly which we mentioned immediately, still the same when we came back. We were here for 5 days. Elevators are sufficient and efficient to cover heavy traffic we never had to wait for one. Concierge is helpful and friendly. It is a busy hotel especially at night with people hanging around the lobby and people with their laptops on all other seating areas--free wifi in the lobby. Toiletries were from bath and bodyworks, which was nice, except that some days we did not get any. I have stayed at the Hyatt and Hilton, Marriot is still the best interms of location.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott as it should be”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: A famous place for conventions directly downtown in Chicago. Within walking distance you can also reach many of the Chicago highlights. The - many! - rooms are nothing special, defenitely a bit under the usual Marriott standard. Due to the many conventions there it is often very crowded. The bar in the lobby is a great place to meet, if yoiu can find a free spot.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, lobby/bar area stylish”
Reviews.Author: waslka21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel the weekend of Lollapollaza. Good location right on Michigan Ave. Walking distance to everything...shopping, subway, restaurants, Navy Pier, Chicago River. Nice room. The lobby was really modern and stylish and had a nice bar area and a Starbucks. Only thing I didn't like was that we did not have a fridge in our room.

Reviews.Title: “BUSY DOWNTOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Jjefferson
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is perfectly located near all amenities right in downtown Chicago (restaurants, bars, shopping, etc). The large modern lobby with the bar is always very busy with families and business people. The standard rooms are what you normally expect in a chain hotel in a large city, however, we found that the bathrooms were smaller than the norm. As for all Marriott hotel, you get a no hassle stay with very clean rooms and good service. The staff, like all Marriott is courteous and willing to help, except in the Concierge Lounge reserved for Marriott Elite members. My family and I had access to the Lounge thanks to my eligibility to the Government rate, which is an excellent initiative as the price of the room includes breakfast, snacks early in the evening (soup, hors-d'oeuvres) and desserts later. We made the mistake of entering the lounge shortly before closing (09:30hrs) at breakfast and the person behind the counter literally started to put away the food, plates and utensils while we were in the process of serving ourselves. The hotel restaurant serves good food at a decent price for this type of establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with comfort food”
Reviews.Author: jtrow
Reviews.Content: Great location for Chicago visitors. Despite being right int he heart of things, my room was quiet. The rooms was a little smaller than I'd like but you're downtown so I wasn't surprised. Bathroom was small (can't exit shower with bathroom door open) but worked well and was clean. If you are looking for a hip ultra-modern sophisticated place and a restaurant/bar that serves locally grown food heavy on the fresh vegetables, this ain't it. It's a dependable American institution with restaurant services specializing in comfort food. The breaded pork loin on mashed potatoes with white gravy was delicious s was the homemade ginger ice cream. Excellent service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: goordo
Reviews.Content: I have been a marriott reward member for ten years. This was the worse hotel /motel I have ever stayed at. The toilet did not work after 4 attempts they replaced it. BTW the toilet is about one third the size of a normal bathroom. The noise from the elevator and a/c was non stop. The pool on the 9th floor was broken as was the spa. This was a terrible joke and a horrible hotel. If your used to the Holiday Inn or Motel Six you probably will like it, if your used to Marriott standards forget about it. The location is the only thing they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean. Right in the center of everything you could need if you are a tourist. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was AWESOME! (As it always is at Marriott.) It is a typical city hotel in that the bed room and bathroom are pretty small. Despite being a city hotel, the rooms were very quiet! Great view. Highly recommended. :-) Walk down the street to "Pop" it is an all champagne bar! V. cute!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but the small rooms are showing thier age”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year but seemed to liked it more then. This is a conveniently located property with an attractive lobby. Staff are nice. However, my room was very small and the wall paper in the bathroom was peeling and the tile was coming off the wall. Fitness facility was ok but didnâ€™t have any weight training equipment. Iâ€™ve stayed here before and would probably stay here again but wouldnâ€™t look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Lesley432
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much. The hotel was lovely, I had a view of the beautiful city right out my window. Customer service is top of the line! Loved it. Wanted to bring home my bed it was so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, some questionable staff”
Reviews.Author: GaerielSky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Room# 2230 from July 22-25. Room was nice, internet good. Bathroom is TINY. No room to open/close door once you step out of shower/tub. That should be remedied if they remodel. I was also missing shampoo but had double conditioner. They brought up some shampoo immediately. Work out room(s) are terrific. A full compliment of treadmills, ellipticals, steppers, etc. And a separate room for weights/yoga/machines. Plus a pool area. The onsite restaurant is delicious. The soup/sandwich $10 lunch special was a nice surprise. Everyone was very nice. But here was my problem - since my room was not ready upon check in I stored my luggage with the bellman. When I got it back, my laptop screen had been destroyed. They did send an investigator, and everything was resolved to my satisfaction and I have a new laptop. So booo to the bellman but YAY to the Loss Prevention Officer (Gabriel) and Claims adjuster (Kyle). They did a good job. Another goof, upon packing for home I could not find my MK "Very Hollywood" perfume (roll-on) that I kept in the bathroom. I later spoke with housekeeping who said it wasn't in lost & found. If anyone sniffs out a housekeeper with a lovely citrusy-floral new perfume on... mazel tov. Either that, or it got thrown out with washcloths in the bathroom and ended up in the laundry/trash. I can recommend the hotel (minus the bathroom) to others, but the staff should be more careful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiBugged
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close or have easy access to most downtown attractions, this hotel is great. The rooms were very clean, a bit small with 2 double beds. Couple blocks from trolley stop, in the middle of shopping, walking distance to good restaurants. Had breakfast buffett at the hotel, which was delicious. Staff is courteous and helpful. You do hear sirens all night long which can be annoying, but expect that when you're downtown. No microwaves or frig in room, but they did bring us a frig when we asked about it. A little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: creeped_Out_10
Reviews.Content: I went to sleep and woke up with bites ALL OVER MY LEGS IN LINES OF THREE! Although I didn't see a bug, the bottom of the box spring was ripped open - which suggests that they spray for bugs! When I called the hotel, they reacted fast and changed my room. They said they would "lock-down" the room and have an independent third-party confirm whether there were any bugs. Although they told me that this thrid-party did not find any bugs, they also refused to show me the report generated by this third-party (which would have showed the type of tests they ran, etc.)! Later that day, I asked the hotel to bring a flash light to my new room so I could thoroughly check my new bed. The first staff member that arrived was not accompanied by a member of management and I told him what had happened to me and he was VERY SYMPATHETIC and said IT WAS NOT THE FIRST TIME. He gave me the flash light, let me check out the bed myself and then left after I was finished. About 10 minutes later, I got another knock on the door - this time with a member of management with another staff member with a flash light. This time they conducted the search (which was not as extensive as mine) and kept putting doubts in my head like it could not have happened! Don't stay here unless you want to be some creepy crawler's meal! Hotel management will not admit to the problem!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking amenities”
Reviews.Author: vancouverbeecee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located but so are many others along Michigan Avenue. Most disappointing for us was the lack of microwave and refrigerator. Our room was very small, barely room for the two queens and the bathroom was miniature. For the price, it is not a value. The staff was very gracious, especially the concierge and maid service. Room was clean, wall to wall windows afforded a beautiful view at night. Siren noise frequent. This hotel is geared to conference and business travelers, not families. Good restaurants are in the neighborhood. Our stay at the Hyatt last year was much much better. Disappointed to pay $16 a day for in-room high speed internet. Felt nickel and dimed for every add on. Free wi-fi hotspot in hotel lobby hard to connect and slow and blocked my e-mail service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms average”
Reviews.Author: onefortheroad_d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for a business meeting. The event staff is exceptional. The rooms are average and halls dark. Very busy property--lobby is always bustling. Concierge lounge just OK. Breakfast consisted of eggs or oatmeal--typically they have bacon or sausage and switch it up--here it was the same everyday. Also, they didn't have sodas as they normally do--just fountain sodas that the staff had to get for you. It's a great location though--right on Michigan Avenue--walk out and you're in the middle of everything. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is average.”
Reviews.Author: oranges8
Reviews.Content: We have never seen a bathroom this small in a hotel. It is a busy hotel with lots of people in the lobby.Location is very good and there are many restaurants and shopping within walking distance. As other reviewers have mentioned, you can hear loud sirens during the night. The good thing is that you hardly hear your neighbors and also you do not hear loud door slammings as in alot of hotels. We have also stayed at the Intercontinental which is located on the opposite side of the street.We will stay at the Intercontinental next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has a lot of energy”
Reviews.Author: sevenstates
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was filled with people and it was a bit overwhelming at first. I found it difficult to find the place to check in but an employee of the hotel saw my confusion and directed me to the registration desk. I checked in a bit earlier than the normal check in time but they did find a room for me so I would not have to wait. After getting up to the 34th floor, I found that the room was in the process of being cleaned. I used the phone near the elevator to contact the front desk to let them know the situation. They apologized and sent someone up with a new set of keys to a new room. The new room had a spectacular view of Lake Michigan. It was a bit loud because of the sirens from emergency vehicles that seemed to come by every 30 minutes or so. Everyone was kind and accommodating. I was out one evening and came back to find a member of the hospitality staff turning down my bed and asking if I needed an additional towels or other supplies. The location is perfect and is close to everything. We never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. This will be my hotel whenever I stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: zanev
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Marriott Downtown. The hotel is quite good. A bit aged and in need of a facelift, but it was clean and comfortable. The hot tub was broken and pool is quite small, good for kids, not adults. We had to swtich rooms as the thermostat was not working right in our room, but the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Common areas of the hotel were nice. Perfect for a place to sleep in the heart of the action. And that is the main thing. The location is awesome. Right on the mile, Rush & Michigan. Central so you can walk to all of the shopping, to the pier/lakeshore, restos, bars, etc. Fantastic. If you are looking for a decent price, decent (but a bit aged) hotel and fantastic location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: co_native29
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this Marriott in Chicago. The greatest thing about this hotel is the location, it is exactly where you want to be for shopping, entertainment, nightlife etc. On the other hand, there are things I put up with at this hotel for the location. The lobby is always packed with people, I compared it to a homeless shelter at one point. Kids running around, luggage everyone, etc. It is a very big and busy hotel is what it amounts to. The rooms are okay, pretty small, but decent, we didn't spend much time in them anyways. The bathroom is also tiny and has no ventilation, which is a little annoying. On the morning of our departure, which happened to be the day after 4th of July, our maid was knocking on the door at 7:45am! We told her to come back, and she continued to knock on all the doors around us. We had a long drive ahead of us and unfortunantely were not able to get back to sleep after this. The service was great, the conceirge was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and a boat tour we did. I did not use the other amenities, tried to use the pool but it was always so packed with kids and families. The bar was decent, although as usual, way over priced. Self Park was $33 a night, which is somewhat normal in a big city. Overall, I would stay here again because of the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, just don't ship anything to or from...”
Reviews.Author: 2niagara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Hotel recently for a 4-day conference. It's a nice hotel, great bar/lounge area in the lobby. Food was very good. Rooms were decent sized and clean - the beds were very comfortable! The location was great, being on Michigan Ave it is close to most everything and within walking distance of shopping and many restaurants. The only downsides were 1) I had requested a king room, but one was not available when I checked in, and 2) shipping to or from the hotel is outrageously expensive. I believe that the hotel has contracted with a 3rd party for all shipping, so customers are charged when they receive a package, as well as when they ship it out. Try to avoid shipping if you are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: lt2melissa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Great bar/restaurant in lobby. Wonderful beds! Can't beat the price for the quality, location, etc! Can usually get a deal on priceline, etc. Don't miss the breakfast buffet in the morning, totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “American Girl group weekend”
Reviews.Author: juliekenben
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Service was outstanding, great location, great views. We had a group of moms, daughters and granddaughters who went to Chicago to visit the American Girl store. We had requested early check-in and were so grateful that the hotel could meet our needs. The pool was a little cold. Room Service was speedy and great pizza! The breakfast couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at this Marriott Hotel location”
Reviews.Author: global_pov
Reviews.Content: While the Marriott hotel chain is notoriously known for standard accommodations, I enjoyed my stay at this property, primarily because I was accommodated with a very quiet room (off into a discrete corner of the hotel overlooking Magnificent Mile) and was provided with concierge service - which was included in the full price of my hotel room. The hotel room cost was reasonably high compared to some other more notable hotel chains that are located on Magnificent Mile. Overall I would give this stay a strong average, but would suggest that travelers look at other properties before settling on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: luciamandm
Reviews.Content: What an awesome location! The hotel was very nice, though very crowded. Staff were very accomodating and the room was nice with the best view of the magnifacent mile and Lake Michigan!

Reviews.Title: “Big, Crowded, and Average”
Reviews.Author: dwhir
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic example of being too big. The lobby feels like Union Station in D.C. There are constantly throngs of people always running throughout. It can get very loud. The biggest advantage of the hotel is its great location, right on Michigan in the heart of the shopping districe. Another nice advantage is that there is a Starbucks right in the lobby of the hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. Some key negatives (in addition to the size/noise) include: -Elevators. They are always crowded and take a long time to get to you (clearly way too many rooms/guests for the number of elevators they have). -No wireless internet in the rooms. This is a HUGE negative for me. I can't believe that small little Marriott Courtyards all have wireless in the rooms and the big daddy downtown Marriott can't. What an embarrassment. This basically is a hotel constantly at a frenetic place. There are far better choices in the nearby area that will make your vacation more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest lobby ever, but great service.”
Reviews.Author: Gailfromhome
Reviews.Content: I usually love getting into the haven of a hotel lobby after a long flight or a busy street, but this was the least welcoming lobby I've ever seen. Waiting for check-in, the whole line agreed, was more stressful than standing on line at the airport. The entire lobby is a giant sports bar with a wall of televisions, clanging acoustics and blaring rock music. The hotel location is very good, but the streets outside are more restful and quiet. On the good side, my room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and every staff member warm, prompt and helpful. I ate there three times (room service omlette, lobby bar soup and catered dinner) and all three meals were delicious. The Marriotts seem to be serious about saving the environment but the result is dark and gloomy rooms with only a few low-watt lights (and brown walls.) Ditto the long dark hallways . The lack of a mini-bar refrigerator was inconvenient. The place is huge and naturally the tiny pool was crowded with children. Kudos to the staff whose service and friendliness made my stay pleasant one. I just wish they could find a way to brighten the rooms and halls and tone down the lobby noise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at River Hotel instead!”
Reviews.Author: Hellolyla
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed by Marriott at ALL. I got to the hotel and was greeted by a room temperature of 70 degrees. The air conditioner didn't work the entire trip, housekeeping was pretty slow and never replaced our coffee supplies, and to check out, we waited in line for 40 minutes! By then, we had missed the noon check-out time and the clerk at the counter seemed completely unbothered by this. There is NO free internet in this hotel, which, some people blame on the cost of being in a big city. Well, River Hotel, just two blocks away provides free internet service. The Marriott was grossly overpriced for what little they provided. This includes the room rates AND the cost to eat there - They were charging 22 dollars for EGGS. Come on! I really advise anyone thinking about staying here to stay at River Hotel instead - The rates were amazing, it isn't far away, there's far better service, and a much more intimate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location, great lobby”
Reviews.Author: Phil_from_NYC
Reviews.Content: There's free Wi-fi in the lobby, so even when I come to Chicago on a day trip, I often stop here if I have some time to kill. The rooms are fine, though not great, but it's the location and the vibe (very busy lobby, good for people watching) that keep me coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good. Just lacks the "wow" factor”
Reviews.Author: Twain34
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much like a Toyota Camry. A solid car that will run well. But afterwards, you leave trying to remember much about it. Which, of course, isn't such a bad thing. Checkin was painless and the porters helped make the trip inside smooth. Had a room on the 28th floor with a view of Michigan Ave. Room actually smelled clean when I arrived. Good sign. Bed was very comfortable; no noticeable "dip" in the middle or on the side by the clock radio. Desk had internet access and the room was spacious enough for a couch too. Bathroom was neat and tidy. That said, the noise off the street was still loud and the climate control was non-existent. The decor was fine, but forgettable. Overall, the location is great for shopping, touring, restaurants, etc. Had business functions there and the service was good and food was above average. And the workout rooms had new equipment and enough space that in the morning hours there was room for everyone. So, would I come here again? Sure. But I won't be dreaming about it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very convinient if you want...”
Reviews.Author: HotelGenius
Reviews.Content: Location is very convinient if you want to see the city or go shopping, specially during winter. The building is not new but the service makes up for it. I would recommend this hotel for tourists. Be ready for the strong winds around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: shahalambasharat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is above average but surely not one of the best ones in Chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.. Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: knicks02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Jan 15-18. Checked in a little early and room assigned was dirty. Went back to front desk and they took care of the problem by uprgrading me to the 41st Floor as well as giving me access to their Club Lounge. Staff was amazing, greeting everyone that walked through the doors. The weight room was also the best that I have ever seen. I loved how they had the cardio in a different room then the free weights. Many places are walking distance. Went to the ESPN Zone which is just outside the valet entrance. Theres a corner Bakery just up the street on Michigan Ave. When I return to Chicago will stay here again. A Perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: 123me
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is so close to amazing food and great shopping, and the L train runs close by. The staff here were also superb... totally top notch. They were friendly and very welcoming. I would absolutely stay here again when visiting Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FrankS7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for two nights. Staff was friendly. I got a room at the 32nd floor with a great view of the Chicago skyline. Room was little but with all the expected Marriott comfort. They had a little indoor swimming pool and a nice hot steam bath. Everything was walkable from the hotel, i.e. the Hancock Tower in about 10mins. There were a couple of breakfast places around the corner and of course also shopping, restaurants and bar. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Happy holidays with the family”
Reviews.Author: RCDC52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our kids as well as my brother and sister and their kids: 14 people and 4 rooms overall. Our visit was on the weekend before Christmas. The purpose was simply to have a family get together and get some shopping done on the magnificent mile. There is probably no location better in Chicago for access to the M.M. Nordstroms and the rest of the downtown mall is right across the street. That and the layout of the lobby, with it's large open bar and other common seating areas distinguished the downtown Marriott from most other large city hotels we've stayed at. It made socializing in large groups easier and the older kids could come and go as they pleased while the adults relaxed with a beverage. There were several large screen TV's and although this wasn't a sports bar it made it easy to watch the NFL game that captured the attention of many of the patrons. The rooms were small and non-descript. While the pool area was fairly large and accomadating, the pool itself was small. There was a good-sized workout room with lockers and showers available as well. We also received a rate of 129.00 which was a terrific value compared to their normal rates. All in all it was a great experience made better with the large, welcoming lobby, bar and access to all the best Chicago has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Single Business Traveler-Check alternatives for Couples/Families”
Reviews.Author: noplainjayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a business convention for 3 nights. The location was great (right next to Nordstrom's on Michigan Ave) for the meeting and for after hours events. The room was relatively clean and well maintained, and staff was responsive to special requests. Why would I probably not stay here again? There are so many options within the area of Michigan Ave, and most are probably more up to date. While the hotel has been cosmetically upgraded with great sheets/flat screen tv/etc, it simply isn't up to current hotel standards when you're talking about a room over $200 per night. An older hotel, our room was small, the doors were very narrow, the bathroom was extremely small (5x6) with hardly enough room to close the 24" door (and we're just average size folks), the light switch upon entering the room was located inside the closet, the beds are extremely soft (although staff quickly added a bedboard upon request). Because our room and bathroom were so small, we would probably opt for a different hotel in the area with more up to date comforts next time we visit. Not a problem if you're traveling alone or at a pure business meeting, but most families or couples out for a romantic setting would want just a little more room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--heating system not user friendly”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Nice remodeleed rooms. Fairly quiet. Had view of Michigan Avenue and Lake Michigan beyond that. A great city. Great neighborhood if you like the Magnificent Mile (ie high end shopping). Service very good and food excellent. Only complaints were heating system and health club. The "heating" system that either provided no heat or too much. Finally got it fixed after 3 days of calling. I love energy effiiciency but comfort is nice too. And you normally need heat in November in Chicago. Fitness center needs renovation. Equipment old. Also a bit pricey--especially with the tax. Hot tip: Trader Joes is 2 blocks away next to Four Points by Sheraton and there is a Jewel just down the street from that. Try "Joes" across the street for a restaurant. Salmon was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laurapye
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago with 3 other couples and stayed at this hotel. We couldn't have chosen a better location and the hotel was so nice!! Extremely good value for the price!! Steve (the door man) was a godsend! He makes that hotel what it is! He was always so helpful with getting us cabs, even got us a humer limo one night at a cheaper rate it would have ben to take a cab!!! All the staff there are very accomodating! Would definetly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Customer Service & Beautiful Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLKRAK
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this Marriott was impeccable. I could not have been more impressed with each and every employee I interacted with from check-in, concierge, bartender and even employees I encountered in the elevator and hallways. I would like to call special attention to Polly from the concierge desk, who went out of her way to assist in finding a lost Starbucks card, searching entire lobby, talking to other employees and even calling me at the end of her shift to give me an update. Most would have considered a lost Starbucks card a waste of their time, but not Polly. The management of this hotel is to be commended for their rigorous customer service policy and their management style. It was obvious that the employees enjoyed working there. Thanks to them, I again believe that there are establishments that embrace customer satisfaction as part of their culture.

Reviews.Title: “Switched from a Hyatt mid-trip and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Very lively and happening lobby area with a cool bar and restaurant. Had a great room for a great rate that looked down upon Michigan Avenue. Can't wait to go back to Chicago and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, groovy lobby”
Reviews.Author: UtahMikester
Reviews.Content: The hotels delivers what you would expect from a Marriott in a major metro area. This hotel exceeded expections by having a great location and a hip lobby. The rooms were standard fare.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location..and then some for an anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Love4BNM
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in various downtown hotels but the Marriott's location and service won us over by far! It is in the middle of everything and within walking distance of just about anything downtown. Self-parking is about ten dollars cheaper then valet and is just kiddy-corner from the back side of the hotel on Rush- easy! At first we were given a room on the 10th floor with a poor view, so we went down to the concierge and asked for a room higher up with a better view. We also mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary; not only did they happily move us to the 32nd floor (with a spectacular view of Michigan Ave, the city lights, and Lake Michigan) but when we returned to our room from lunch a couple of hours later, we had chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us! (A small, Asian lady at the concierge desk was beyond helpful and just a gem! ) Although the bathrooms are small, the bed makes up for it....heavenly! Clean rooms, great shower in a beautiful, efficient bathroom. The lobby is also a great spot to hang out and have drinks and/or people watch. We did rent Segways from Millenium Park Bike Rentals (239 E. Randolph) and had an absolute blast!! It is a must if you have time for it...this place is by far the cheapest place to rent from ($49 per person) for a 2.5 hour tour....easy to learn and a great way to see so much of the city! Highly recommended!! We requested early check-in at the Marriott and late check-out and both requests were granted. It made for a lovely weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: weglow4
Reviews.Content: The location cant be beat. First time in Chicago, and walked everywhere! Staff very helpful, and very nice. Room very, very clean. Bathrooms are small, but certainly functional. Despite what some earlier reviewers wrote, elevators were not slow at all--- and we were on the 35th floor. We had a great view of the lake. Stayed over holiday weekend, so prices were a bit higher, and parking was expensive. Fitness center had a lot of equipment, and was not crowded at all. Could hear sirens at all hours- but not enough to dirupt sleep. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: golferinsf
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this location. Great location on magnificent mile. close ot the train, in the heart of downtown. Check-in was easy, and they accomodated my request for a high floor. Room itself had a great view, but the room overall needs to be remodeled. Apparently they have renovated the lobby, bar, conference rooms, but not th rooms yet. My bathroom was tiny. Very tiny, I thtink my closet was bigger than the bathroom. They accomodated my late check-out but didn't change my room key, so i was locked out and had to wait 10-15 minutes for security to come and let me in. Overall not bad, but I'll probably try a different hotel on magnificent mile in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: doosiesa
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of the magnificent mile. Room was nice, bed was soft as can be. Hotel bar was hopping on a Wed evening and very trendy. Convenient starbucks right in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Janlshop
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right on Michigan Ave, (great for shoppers). The beds were so comfortable. Only wished I could stay longer !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: brn679
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Chicago Marriott Downtown/Mag Mile. The location was perfect for all of the sightseeing in Chicago, most in walking distance. The lobby had a great atmosphere and was a nice place to stop and check email (you pay for internet in the rooms, but free wifi in lobby). Our room was spotless! The bathroom was on the small side, but I would trade cleanliness over a larger bathroom anyday. The service was great, we asked for a fridge upon check-in and it was delivered by the time we got back in from sightseeing. Concierge staff was helpful with directions. There are PLENTY of options to eat and drink in the direct vicinity of the hotel. There were restaurants everywhere you looked. We did not get a chance to eat at the hotel restaurant so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott during the labor weekend and the Hotel was fully booked. Only in the lobby and in the elevators you could notice this hotel offers 1200 rooms. But still it wasnâ€™t overcrowded at all, speed at elevators was ok. Room was in great shape, good flat screen just a minibar was missing. Bathroom had all the essentials needed. Location is excellent, at the beginning of the Magnificent mile, navy yard is just a 15 min walk away. Overall a perfect fit for both business visitors and leisure (shoppingâ€¦) visitors. Just one remark for the management, the lobby was nice designed just the location of the front desk doesnâ€™t really make sense.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes you feel like you are staying at a Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: daisy1235
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for labor day weekend. Although the hotel itself was full of people staying there as well, the staff did not look overwhelmed, nor did they make my friend and I feel as if we were overwhelming them. They were all extremely helpful with any of our requests and even gave us a complimentary upgrade when we asked! I would absolutely stay in this hotel again. The ONLY complaint that I have is the elevators take foreverrrrrr! But I guess that will happen when you have like 70 floors!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jksflyer
Reviews.Content: I have read the majority of the reviews about the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile. The hotel does have a few flaws: the rooms are smaller, the AC did not work correctly and the bathroom is very very tiny. However, the service was amazing. Luke and Greta at the front desk were amazing. Service is priceless and they provided priceless service. I am a fan of Room Service and I have to say that the room service was very good and prompt and on time. The hotel is located right on the Magnigicent Mile and close to every major downtwon attration. I walked everywhere and enjoyed the amazing city of Chicago. I used Marriot Vitrual Concierge Service and I was impressed when I got back from my day of sighseein that extra pillows and towels were delivered to my room. A great hotel on the Magnifcent Mile, which Magnificent Staff...

Reviews.Title: “OK but what's with the breath mints”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: Five night stay to teach at software training class. Since I have "platinum" status, I had hoped for a high floor room, away from the elevator,with a lake view. I was given a room on the 40th floor, next to the elevator, looking back towards the airport. I wasn't ambitious enough to go back down to the lobby and ask for another room. Although I did hear people getting on and off the elevator, they never woke me while I was sleeping. As referenced in some other reviews, there is some noise from the street. However, the bathroom fan is always on and I left the AC fan running all the time, the background noise masked most of the street noises and I didn't have any problems sleeping. The room was little small for two people (my spouse was with me). However, it was ok. I got free internet with my negotiated rate which was a pleasant surprise. I liked the HD tv. The concierge lounge is on the second floor which takes away the normal convenience. It also didn't seem to be very exclusive and had a large number of small children running loose. Not a particularly comfortable place to wind down or network. The breakfast was ok and the evening snacks were good. There is no honor bar and I don't think the drinks were any cheaper than in the bar lobby and the selection was more limited. I would stay here again although it isn't someplace that I would look forward to. This is an older hotel, with limited sound insulation as to the windows and walls. However, it has been nicely renovated. The staff was nice and it has a good location for visiting Chicago. My only real complaint is that, on some nights, I got breath mints with the turn down service instead of chocolate. Maybe they were giving me a needed hint but I still wanted my chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott made my stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: xxxtraveltoday
Reviews.Content: Everything I requested, I got. Thank you Marriott. A high floor...37th floor- A view of Lake Michigan. Early check in requested. A roll away since we had 3 people. And Marriott didn't charge for a 3rd person or the rollaway. But the rollaway bed was very hard and we should have asked for another one. Extra towels were in the room. The maid was friendly. This hotel was packed with food, sports and sales meetings during our stay. The lobby bar was lively and fun. The Air and water show was scheduled for the weekend we were visiting. I enjoyed the location of the hotel. City Center...walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: iulia
Reviews.Content: Pleased with our four day stay at the Marriott. The service was top notch, all employees in several departments were great. The lobby/bar is a lot of fun, plenty of room for everyone. The food prepared for the 800 plus attending a conference was above average. The location of the Hotel is perfect for those visiting Chicago. I plan on returning to Chicago in October and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vaca-plannerfl
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, location is very good. Hotel is situated between Michigan Ave and Rush Street with an entance on both streets. It is a very managable walk to several area attractions, such as Millineum Park, Navy Pier, Riverwalk, and of course Magnificent Mile shopping. There is a free trolley that runs back and forth to Navy Pier. Rooms were nice, roomy and very clean, though a little bit dated. Nice bedding and linens, up to Marriott standards. Elevators roomy and quick. Nice indoor pool and fitness center. Lots of restaurants and bars within a very short walk. 2 blocks from nearest subway entry. Great Lobby Sports bar with lots of TV's, very lively. You can rent bikes at Navy Pier and tour along Lakeshore Drive, Chicago is a very bike-friendly city. We spent a very nice doing that.

Reviews.Title: “Lake view but oh the sirens!”
Reviews.Author: smileycuteness
Reviews.Content: This Marriott has a great location where we were able to walk to everything we needed. Hip lobby with two entrances but always packed full of people. Our room was located on the 44th floor with a magnificient view of Lake Michigan which thrilled us. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. However, be sure you bring your earplugs. No wait, I tried ear plugs which were not enough. Perhaps the Bose noise reducing ear phones would block out the almost constant noise of ambulance and police sirens. We found out that a hospital was a few blocks down but holy cow, the sirens were never ending. We were stunned at the noise. I hardly slept the first night even with ear plugs. I must also note that only 2 out of the 6 high rise elevators seemed to be working. There was almost always a wait in the lobby for an elevator. Once a 3rd elevator opened on the 44th floor for us to take down, the doors closed, we thought we were moving but it shuddered and vibrated several times over a minute, then the doors opened on the 44th floor. Yeah, we got out and took a different elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, super location.”
Reviews.Author: peanut9497
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Michigan Avenue. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of fast elevators so no waiting to get to and from your room. You can catch a free trolley to Navy Pier just steps from the hotel which is great with kids. Our room was a little on the small side but we also had a roll away bed and managed to fit our large family.

Reviews.Title: “Trade room quality for great location and helpful service at good price”
Reviews.Author: missgrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly where we wanted to be, and nearby plenty of great restaurant choices. It is a huge hotel, lacks charm, rooms were OK - definitely showing age and wear. However, the price was great and the staff (especially concierge desk) were very helpful. With a bigger budget I would stay elsewhere, but I would stay here again for the price/location.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Quill4hire
Reviews.Content: I drove to Chicago for a business trip extended for a couple days of sight-seeing with my family. We arrived at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile with trepidation based on some of the past reviews. The bellman immediately gave us good information for self-parking ($33, just across the street) and waited patiently for my husband to park and check in. Our room rate was $99 from Priceline, so while we requested an upgrade/lake view, we didn't expect it (and didn't receive it). The room was small, as expected by past reviews -- but having stayed in NYC, Boston and other large cities numerous times, we already expected modest space. We were very happy with the cleanliness of the room and the bathroom. The front-desk staff was always helpful and personable. The location was unbelievably convenient. My only criticism of our stay would be that the pillows weren't very substantial. Luckily, I brought mine from home, retrieved it from our car so conveniently located across the street in self-parking, and solved that issue. My husband stacked two hotel pillows and felt fine with that. Many, many thanks to whoever recommended breakfast at Mary's Cafe (about 2 blocks from the hotel) on their TripAdvisor review. It was quaint, incredibly fast and relatively inexpensive. (Our breakfast arrived within 5 minutes of ordering it the first day.) We ate there both days, taking business associates the second day who agreed it is a valuable find in downtown Chicago. For people wishing to access the free Internet in the lobby, there is plenty of seating space in the lobby and several small tables on the 2nd level overlooking the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It Is A Small Room In A Big Hotel With A Ton Of Guests In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteelBeach
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location. Right on Michigan Avenue and walkable to a ton of great sites, shopping, and restaurants. Staff was nice. Cons: Just a little room and an average price. $15 to use your computer. Look around -- there has got to be a better deal downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location but few amenities”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: The Marriott has a fabulous location and an interesting lobby. We had a room with a King bed and we thought the room was smaller than most. The bathroom was small, too. I stayed here another time and had a room with two queen beds and the room was considerably larger so next time, I would request a two-Queen room for the additional space. There is NO mini-fridge, NO microwave and NO free in-room internet. Nearby comparable hotels DO offer these things, though. You can access the internet from the hotel lobby. There is a small coffee maker with two paper cups. The coffee pouch makes two small cups of coffee. There is a Jewel grocery store (which is open until midnight) located about three blocks from the Marriott. The complimentary bath products are from Bath and Body Works (Citrus Ginger scent) and are AWESOME. We were on the 30th floor and had a great view of the city at night. All in all, I would stay here again simply for the view (if you are lucky enough to get a room with a view) and for the location and I would get a two Queen room.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are hard to find; book them if you can!”
Reviews.Author: Daedalus43
Reviews.Content: Doesn't look like a Marriot on the outside, but once you get in is a great-looking hotel in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, 2 streets away from the Grand subway station. Trendy bar in the center of the lobby. The Business Center was actually a Fedex/Kinko's and charges $0.50/min and $1.79/page in color, but the network printer was down the entire time I needed it. Had to walk 6 blocks to the nearest other Kinko's. The service score would've been a 5, except that there were no maps available at the concierge except for a single photocopied page with only street names. Didn't deliver the complimentary weekday USA Today

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, average close to above average but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Sumotartan
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and hotel was above average but nothing special. 10/10 for the location it cannot be faulted. Back or front of hotel, depending on which way you look at it, falls onto Rush Street and numerous reasonably priced restaurants and a lot of variety. Opposite entrance is on the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Avenue) and next to all the major shops. Ideally located for Millenium Park, Navy Pier (take 29 bus), Hancock Tower, major shops. If you don't have much luggage, its a 5 minute bus ride (146) to State and Lake and then a 5 min walk to the blue line for O'Hare. Total journey time = 1hr 15 mins. Cost - $4.5 incl bus. 24 hr CTA pass only $5.75 . I would definitely recommend getting the bus everyhwere - dirt cheap and frequent. 20 minutes to the Museum Campus with direct buses from Magnificent Mile Hotel itself - wireless costs $14.95 for 24hrs but surprisingly they advised me to just use the lobby area as its wireless was free! Swimming pool was a let down - quite small but still adequate and the whirlpool was out of commission. Male locker room has steam room which is fine. In fairness not a massive deal as you really are there to sight see BUT it is nice to have something to come back to after being out all day. Rooms are clean and semi spacious but bear in mind it is a downtown hotel, and the bathroom is a bit small and badly designed as the toilet feels like it is far too close to the shower - again not a big deal and I think the size is more to allow as much space to be utilised by the hotel, to squeeze more rooms in! Don;t get me wrong it isn't small but neither is it massive...suppose coming in from Vegas beforehand had spoilt me for size. Would definitely stay there if the deals are reasonable. Never used the restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott is in a terrific location; within walking distance to many attractions!”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Cindy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were able to use some of my husband's accumulated Marriott points, and we were given a room with a terrific view of Chicago looking west. The hotel lobby, although incredibly noisy, was furnished with all manner of couches and tables (decorated in sort of a 1960's theme). It was obvious that many hotel guests were attending one convention or another as we saw many people working on computers in the lobby. The breakfast was the usual Marriott buffett, with plenty of the typical breakfast choices. Waffles were made to order and brought to the table, and even boiled eggs were available on the buffett table. The waiters were fast and friendly as were all the staff we encountered at the Marriott. My conly complaint would be that the elevators took two or three minutes, but this was a minor irritation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: Overall I didnt think this location was as great as people are saying it is. Since I was there for a trade show the rooms were way over priced and I didn't think they were worth it. Checkin No problem. I did notice one night they had a long line since there were only 2 people checking guest in for their stay. Room I lucked out with a top floor room that had a great view. It was a big king room that was nicely decorated and nothing was old an worn. Bed The bed wasn't bad to sleep on. AC The AC was good in that it didn't keep going on an off all night. I hate when I'm in hotels and the AC or heat keeps truing off and on or is really loud. TV Nice flat panel TV with a good picture. It had a handful of channels to watch. Bathroom No problems here. I had hot water right away and the best thing was the shower head was high on the wall so I didnt have to bend over to wash my hair. Elevators I liked the fact that for such a big hotel the elevators never took that long. They were very quick for the many floors. Internet The internet cost 14.95 a day. I did not use it. Parking Parking is $48 a night. Bar They had a really cool bar down in the lobby. As you can guess it was expensive but very cool. Overall I don't think this is up to Marriott standards. I did stop at the front desk late one night when my key stopped working and I wasn't very happy with the attitude of the front desk clerk. Very short and surly. There are so many hotels in the area so I would suggest looking elsewhere. I didnt have any major problems but I thought it was WAY overpriced for such and average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jamaicalover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Magnificent Mile . You step out of your hotel room and you are there on Mag Mile. Kenneth Cole is right next to your door. The staff was overly accomadating to us. We requested an early check in and we got it, having arrived on a Megabus at 5 in the morning. We requested a refridgerator for the room and received that at no extra charge. The room was clean and smelled good as did the hallways. It has a 24 hr gift shop, Starbucks on site and a bar with I think over twenty taps. It has a pool and a fitness room. It has a restaurant there and we did not eat there. The breakfast buffet was too costly for me but the food was amazing , they use natural ingrediants and they do have a big selection of food even blueberry and chocolate chip pancakes. We could walk to every store from Magnificent MIle to State Avenue with his hotel and Millenium Park. The service was outstanding, workers friendly and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay.”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: No horror stories here. Although "official" check-in is 4 PM, they had my room ready at 11 AM on a busy Friday. The single-king room was small but not claustrophobic and certainly comfortable. There's an exercise room (open 24/7) and a small pool on the 10th floor. There's also a small Kinko's/FedEx on the 2nd, but they charge $.50/min. to use their computers. The North Michigan Ave. location, of course, is hard to beat. (Note: the actual main entrance is on the other side, on Rush St. The Michigan Ave. entrance can actually be hard to find!) Two glitches: my room (No. 1031) was next to the air unit for the hallway, which could be heard in the room. And the ice machine on my floor didn't work and hadn't been fixed when I left two days later, so ice had to be obtained from the bar in the lobby. I should mention that I got a really big discount for this stay. I can recommend this hotel if you can manage a similar discount.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay for the 7 year olds Birthday Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbums5837
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 2 nights with my mother and my 2 children. We were on the 37th floor and could see Lake Michigan and had a view of Michigan Avenue. The kids loved it! We had absolutely zero problems with service from check in to check out. My only complaint is the price of parking which is not unique to the Marriott it is all over Chicago at $49.00/day it was almost as much as the room given I got a super rate of $87.00/night thru the Marriott site. It has a great location very close to everything that we were interested in doing for this trip. I would definitely stay again ~ if I could get such a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's a convention hotel, that's why”
Reviews.Author: Panguin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel notwithstanding the reviews about service because I got a good rate for a conference. That would be the only reason I would recommend anyone to stay there. The best thing about the place is the location. It's in downturn Chicago and if you are high enough you get to see Lake Michigan. Yet walk out from the hotel and you are near shops and restaurants. (Having said that, my friends told me that they were awakened by the sirens that seem to go off with greater regularity in the wee hours of the morning. I had a quieter facing and slept like a log.) The hotel service is wanting at most levels. Check-in was fine. Breakfast was at the lounge which must rank as one of my poorest breakfast in a 5-star hotel. Hot food was oatmeal or scrambled eggs. There is no microwave to warm up the muffin. I had to tell them that the coffee was out. One of the most irritating annoyances was the elevator. Everyone complained. Although there are supposedly 6 going to the rooms, I never saw more than 3 at one time--that is, if the elevator is crowded, wait and you will always see one of the 3 coming and going. The most extreme case I heard was a friend of mine who took 10 mins to get from his room to the lobby. My negative experience with service was when my laundry arrived as I was waiting for the elevator. One of the guests waiting with me said--he's knocking at your door. I did not want to acknowledge that because I did not want to miss the elevator. That man refused to budge and shook his head to ask me to open the door for him. He was obviously expecting a tip. The elevator arrived, I left. That evening, there was no turning down of my bed. The fact that the complaints remained the same suggests that management is not taking the service issue seriously enough. And the reason that management does not take the service issue seriously is that the hotel is aiming for the convention crowd. So there is no need to pander; that crowd will merely follow what their leader designates as the convention hotel. So unless you have to be at this hotel, there are others nearby.

Reviews.Title: “chicago marriott downtown magnificent mile”
Reviews.Author: ncftrav
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at my experience after all of the reviews. I just returned from a conference at this hotel and almost stayed somewhere else given what I was reading about the hotel. Fortunately, the 109. conference rate kept me there, and it turned out to be the perfect site. I will qualify what I say by starting with the ability to receive a room on the 40th floor with a view of the lake. Maybe this shaped my experience. First, the check-in staff was lovely and helped me change my assigned room to a room with a view even though I arrived late. The bed has a topper that makes the bed very comfortable. The floor to ceiling windows made you feel connected to the outdoors unlike token windows in some hotels. The room was spacious, included a nice robe, and lots of pillows. The bathroom may have seemed small if more than 1 person in there or if had to close the door a lot. But the vanity was marble and had plenty of space to spread your items out. The shampoo and conditioner were aromatherapy products. And I got turn down service with chocolates (at the end of my stay, there was a sign by elevators saying this was a club floor, so perhaps I got a great upgrade). The starbucks in the lobby had many workers and was quick. They carried all the extra sandwiches and yogurts that starbucks now sells. The lobby downstairs is consumed with a huge bar section with multiple televisions. This adds a festive gathering place if you didn't come with a companion. Further, the hotel lobby has entrances off to 2 major roads in town and allows you to quickly stroll around town even if you are alone. If I was planning a conference, this would be my choice. Great layout of rooms with circles of couches and chairs everywhere for easy socializing. Escalators between conference floors in the center allowed you to look over onto another floor and locate colleagues. The entire place encouraged a highly interactive feel. Of course, the location is phenomenal. Easy to subway and paid only 5.00 getting to and from airports.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF VALET THEFT”
Reviews.Author: John09chicago
Reviews.Content: The Marriott outsources the valet parking to a company called InterPark. I gave a $5 tip both ways, and apparently it was not good enough. On returning my vehicle, my coin holder was depleted. I contacted the hotel management office and they are very polished in their response, but don't count on any help. The Marriott knows about the issue but they continue to use InterPark. Shame on them. There are other reviews with the same issue. So be advised that the Marriott will not take responsibility for valet theft or damage, and Interpark will not either because the valet stub says they are not responsible for damage or theft.

Reviews.Title: “Bride made great choice . . .”
Reviews.Author: travelingbluewolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding I attended with my sister. We were from out of state and it was our first visit to Chicago. The bride picked this hotel for out of town guests and it was the location of the wedding reception. The rooms are small, but not ridiculously small like the other reviews mention. Our rooms also had hot water. The temperature in the room was comfortable and could not be adjusted like the other reviews also mention. It was no warmer than 40 degrees outside, while the room temperature was cool on (16th floor) the down comforter kept me toasty. I didnt eat at the restaurant, but the bar area is nice, roomy(great layout and decoration), and inviting. Great place to break while shopping. The staff was helpful, nothing extra, just helpful. Our room rate was o.k., but to say their is a shopping mall next door and a plethora of restaurants and other services (drug store) a couple of doors down, Maybe we did get a good rate. This is a MUST--have breakfast at Mary's cafe (around one corner, 2 blocks down). the facilities and food for the reception was great and the staff that attended to guests were wonderful. If you are thinking about this location for weddin or other event, it would be a great choice. Overall a great stay. I travel a lot, my opinion is worthy. Unlike Disney World vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: 4Luvmy2
Reviews.Content: I travel at least 10 times a yr for work and twice a year with family, so I put in a lot of time at hotels. My room was freezing cold and the thermometer in the room didn't make a difference. I was told by engineering that the hotel had turned on AC and it would take a couple of hours for the heat to come back on. I ended up taking a long hot shower and getting in bed and using the blow dryer to warm me up. They promised to send up hot tea, but after 30 minutes and no delivery I had to call to ask. About 15 minutes later a pot of tea showed up, but it was highly caffeinated breakfast tea at 10:00 at night!!! The same night, someone attempted to enter my room. Luckily I had both locks on. I think it was housekeeping. I don't know how they couldn't hear the TV which was turned up loud so that I could hear it over the blowdryer!!! The second day, I called guest services to tell them that my TV wasn't working. After hitting 0 and waiting about 30 rings, I hung up. I tried again and had the same experience. I thought, what if it was a medical emergency and no one answered!!!! The handle on my toilet had to be held in order for it to be flushed. It reminded me of my old house! I called down for toothpaste 40 minutes ago. I'm still waiting. Given all of the choices in a downtown area like this and with the tough economy, there have to be other hotels that provide better service.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: dotnetbuyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for family vacation and not treated well from the get-go. I had a $25.00 off that I got from Marriott rewards points and the lady at the front desk promptly and incorrectly told me I couldn't use it. I already checked this out with Marriott so I knew it could be used. No guest should have to argue with the desk clerk about how to do their job. After she gave me an attitude and dirty looks she finally asked someone else for help after fooling around the keyboard and just wasted time for me and my family. They, it got worse. The room we got had no heat. It was not turned off, it was broken. It was 60 degrees and falling before they got someone to our room to fix it. Then the darkness continued. Around eleven PM, someone knocked on our door very loudly. It woke us all up and when I asked who was there, then went to the door there wasn't anyone there. An hour later it happened again. This left me unable to sleep. So when it happened a third time I was ready. I was up and near the door and looked through the peephole to see a hotel maid opening the floor exit door and rushing through it. I called the front desk described the maid and they denied anyone that looked like what I described worked at the hotel. Right! This hotel's staff was not only unable to do their jobs but they lied to me and my family. No one needs to pay for such poor and unprofessional treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay!! You might walk into someone else's room”
Reviews.Author: P0ppy007
Reviews.Content: I recently stay at the Marriott Mag Mile. Location is ok. Room is small and dark. The A/C was not working. It was kinda warm after we got back from the dinner. I called the front desk and it took almost 1 1/2 hr for an engineer to come up and fix it. After he got here and examined the A/C, he said that he could not fix it tonight. So I asked for a room change (it was almost midnight) by calling the front desk. The front desk lady took almost 40 minutes just to check the room availability. Then the bell boy came and took us to the other room. UPON ARRIVAL, THERE WAS SOMEONE ALREADY SLEEPING IN THAT ROOM!!!! I was shocked and upset with the whole poor management. I went down to the front desk (almost one o'clock in the am) and asked for a room change (without anyone sleeping in it). I was then offered a room change. As a frequent traveler around the world, I don't usually stay the Marriotts. After this experience, NERVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: cabowoo
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile is in a fantastic location, close to great shopping, restaurants, and transportation. The room was located on the 34th floor, with a great view of Michigan Avenue. Beds were extremely comfortable!! Bathroom was a tad small, but the granite vanity is a nice touch. During the morning hours, the elevators could be slow. Staff was very attentive and the concierge provided excellent transporation advise. Food at the hotel was tasty. Definitely worth checking out, right in the heart of Chicago's Magnificant Mile!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: mscoach
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this room through Priceline, and it was worth every penny. The room, although cozy, was extremely clean and well furnished. The beds were supremely comfortable and we appreciated the safe which we used to store our valuables during the day while we were out. The pool/hot tub were wonderful. Getting everywhere we needed to go was extremely easy - we easily caught the bus to museums as well as the train to Wrigley Field. Shopping and dining were in walking distance. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The only negative was that there was not free Wi-Fi in the room, as we had to go to the lobby to get internet service. Other than that our trip was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Price and Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: llamagirl420
Reviews.Content: We loved our weekend away at this wonderful hotel. We managed to secure our room for an unbelievable weekend special price and were rewarded with breathtaking views of the street below. The was plenty of room in the bathroom and loved the seperate sink and shower rooms. The only drawback was the street noise. The elevator wait was short and it was a short walk up michigan avenue to all the stores.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more from a Marriott in good location”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before a few years ago, and it was fine, but this stay was not very pleasant. I was attending a conference and didn't have much time to lodge complaints, but my hotel room was unbearably hot (as in I set the temperature down to 57 degrees, but it still felt like it was at least in the high 70s) and my TV didn't work. Also, while the front desk staff during the day and early evening hours was perfectly helpful, the late night staff was surly and confusing at best.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value with travelzoo”
Reviews.Author: trekkie7000
Reviews.Content: we got a room on travelzoo for 99.00 per night, which was a great price for downtown chicago. we did do self-park, but it still cost 37.00 per night instead of the 48.00 valet park at the hotel. the bathrooms were extremely small, but functional. the staff is excellent and very helpful. we did hear alot of street noise and we were on the 34th floor. the most confusing part about staying downtown is that there are two marriots within two blocks of each other. we of course went to the wrong one first. but atleast it was a short walk to the other marriot. i would recommend the hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the $”
Reviews.Author: Accounting Professor
Reviews.Content: Pros: outstanding location, well-trained and personable front desk staff, polite maintenance staff, well thoughtout lobby with tons of workspaces for those of us traveling with laptops, $149 rate plus Marriott points and a flat screen HD TV in the room. Cons: small rooms and bathrooms, noisy heating system and street noise even on the 32nd level. The building is what it is; a 1970s hotel. Bathrooms have been updated with granite countertop, but the space is tight. For us the tight space was a worthwhile trade-off for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Central location - Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: ubettergo
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest hotel I have stayed in, but okay. Additional fees for internet and fitness center add up. Room was small, bathroom was tiny. Unfortunately, I was under the weather during my business stay, so when I wasn't working, I was attempting to relax in the room. Bed was comfortable. TV channels were not ideal...very few of them with nothing on. I was close to the elevators, and you can hear them humming non-stop, every hour of the day...but I got used to it as white noise in the background. The lobby looked like it would be fun to hang out in...bar with plenty of seating and opportunites to mingle and people watch and flat screen tv's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...for the right rate”
Reviews.Author: shari682
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Marriott in Chicago. We usually stay at the Wyndham, but couldn't pass up a $99 rate at the Marriott--definitely worth $99 a night. Great location, but the rooms were really small. The bathroom was ridiculously small, but the room was clean and the staff was nice enough. I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over MLK weekend. Hotel is in an awesome location - right on Michigan Avenue and Rush Street, and close to everything! We've stayed at the Sheraton, Courtyard, and Swissotel on previous visits to downtown Chicago, and this was by far the best location. Check-in was smooth and the valets were helpful and friendly. Our room was on the 33rd floor and overlooked Lake Michigan and Michigan Avenue. Rooms were on the small side, but that's fairly normal for a hotel in any large city. Beds were so comfortable! The hotel is next door to Buca di Peppo. I would definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “American standard, quite nice”
Reviews.Author: CP0801
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, no window insulation, wind blows !, heating system is prehistorical but friendly staff and very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: chicago93
Reviews.Content: Chicago: The Chicago Marriott Hotel Magnificent Mile,Okay but had some serious problems. January 1st 2009 Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member I had a reservation at the Chicago Marriott Magnificent Mile checking in on January 1-3 2009. Upon check-in the young lady was wonderful. She noticed in my reservation that I'd request a complimentary upgrade IF it was available. There was availability for an upgrade and I was very happy. This was a treat to myself for New Years staying on the magnificent mile in Chicago). My sister and I checked into the room which had a wonderful view of the city. However I was a little disappointed with the room considering I had just stayed at the Marriott Atlanta Airport on New Years Eve and the room was simply beautiful and they had just been renovated as well. My sister and I decided to go to the bar for drinks. YES, it was crowded/busy. We stood at the bar for 10 MINUTES while the bartender totally ignored us. We were standing behind 3 empty bar stools and watched the bartender take orders from the guest on both sides of us. (left & right side) We watched the bartender go to the other side of the bar to wait on another guest and we were there first. Finally, 2 men who were also guest at the hotel came over to us and said We've been watching you ladies stand here asking for his attention and the bartender continued to ignore you. One of the men had to literally get the bartender attention and said to him these ladies have been standing here waiting to buy a drink for atleast 10 minutes or so. YES, that's when the bartender came over to serve us AND YES he saw us standing there trying to get his attention before the nice men came forward. I was very embarrassed because I'm also bragging about how nice Marriott treats it guest and especially their Elite Members as compared to Hilton. I tried to speak to someone about my concerns but there was only ONE person at the concierge desk and he had LONG LINE and the young lady who checked us in was only the young lady working checking people into the hotel, her line was long. There was 2 or 3 empty positions with nobody working/standing there to assist the guest. If they were working they didn't come out to help the young lady . I have stayed at several full service Marriott Hotels and I have never seen only ONE or TWO people working when it's extremely busy especially during the holiday season. If there's more than three people in line at a full service Marriott you will definitely see another representative come out of the office to help out. Therefore I just gave up. I wanted to stay there for New Years Eve and I'm glad that I didnt. The rooms are over priced for it's decor. and I am talking about the concierge floor room. The hotel was suppose to have been renovated. Perhaps they need to visit other Marriott hotels to get some ideas. I would have been very upset with myself if I had moved forward with my plans to stay at this hotel for New Years Eve only to be disappointed with my room and the AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE that my sister and I recieved. I am NOT going to discuss the service during breakfast in the resturant upstairs. The food was great the service was awful. This was very embarrassing and especially being a Platinum Member with Marriott. I've been an elite member for 4 or 5 years and this is truly a disappointment. This was my first time ever staying at this hotel and was looking forward to staying there. On the internet the rooms looked great and just being on the Magnificent Mile in Chicago I really expected everything to be on point and it wasn't. I only stayed one night and checked out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: kariMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Spent the night at the mag. mile Marriott to take my daughter to see Wicked. The hotel was absolutely perfect. Terrance at the reg desk was a darling. We had an amazing view of downtown and could walk to Volare for dinner and all the shopping we needed. The lobby of this hotel is delightful- plenty of places to sit and chat. The pool was clean and warm. Also a great view here. Most of all, the staff was wonderful. This makes a big difference. I travel a lot for work and have found myself loving the Marriotts. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Clean Beds!”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend the weekend in downtown Chicago to see all of the Christmas lights and festivities. We booked thru Priceline and received a great rate. The location of the Marriott was perfect. It is next door to the Nordstrom Shopping Center and was easily within walking distance to the Watertower Place and the Apple store. The employees were very helpful and friendly, and went out of their way for us. We were very impressed. The beds in our room were comfortable and very clean. The room was also well kept and clean. The only thing I would say that I found was the bathroom is very small. There were two of us, so it was fine, but if a family of four were to book this room, it would be very difficult. All in all we loved our stay here, and the Winter Wonderland at Navy Pier is free, unless you have children that want to go on the rides. It is beautiful and indoors, so its very warm. The Chris Kringle Market at Daley Plaza is great too. It is a German outdoor Christmas Market that goes on each Christmas. Beautiful ornaments, food, music, entertainment, etc. Not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “average business hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: John_Lewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while attending a conference. As a first timer to Chicago, the hotel's location couldn't be faulted, opening up straight on to Michigan Avenue. And location is really the selling point here, as otherwise, this was a distinctly average hotel. The internet access was expensive, the beds were a bit soft, the bathroom was small, and I just don't really think the hotel offered an awful lot to justify its cost. I should make it clear that there was nothing intrinsically bad about the hotel, or my stay. The staff were helpful, and the room was always kept cleaned. But the room was a touch dark, and the whole place was just, average, which when you're looking at $300 a night isn't really good enough. Chicago is an amazing city though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Good Food.”
Reviews.Author: mccoolfam
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights here while attending an on-site conference. Yes, there is a large bar in the middle of the lobby where there seemed to always be a crowd. But I don't go to hotels because I want a quiet lobby. However, it seemed I could never figure out which way I had to go to get to the front desk, the elevators, the Starbucks, etc. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I had a king bed in the "low rise." The room was clean but not luxurious. It was small but I have come to expect that from hotels in a downtown of a major city. The bathroom was very small, but I was alone so it was fine. I cannot imagine two people trying to use it. I was on the 18th floor so the street noise was noticeable. I could hear a sax playing on the street corner below me. But once again, this is in a busy, major urban center, so I can't expect the same as sleeping at home on my ten-acre wooded lot in the country. I struggled with the room heater a little, but finally figured out how to set it to my comfort level. No HDTV like in the Indy Marriott North (see my review) but that was OK. There was a little issue with the A/V system during the first conference session, but it was ironed out and everything worked over the next 2 1/2 days. I would rate this hotel neutral/average for its class, but there are two reasons why it is above average. The food that was served at the conference was way more than I expected. The vegetable sides were inventive and never boring, and the entrees and desserts were fabulous. The second reason this is above average is, of course, the HUGE advantage of its location smack dab in the middle of the Magnificent Mile. If you cannot find a place to eat or shop within a block or two of this hotel, you are in the wrong city. Plus you can literally walk out of the front door of the hotel and hop on a free trolley to all the museums. Highely recommended,.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mikemangino
Reviews.Content: Had a great 3 nights at this Marriot in the middle of November. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was excellent, right on Michigan Avenue and two blocks from the red line. Room was small but nice; bed was very comfortable. However, bathroom was outdated, and closet was too small. Also, elevators are the slowest I have ever experienced. Internet in the room cost $15/day and the business center charged .50/minute. Got a great deal though at $119/night.
