Breakfast was free for silver members, and was just decent. Not a huge selection, but free is ok with me. Would stay here again as long as the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy new interior”
Reviews.Author: popvoid
Reviews.Content: For the past three or four years, the Marriott Downtown was my choice of hotel to stay at in Chicago. It was conveniently located, clean and pleasant if a bit pricey. Recently, the hotel underwent a renovation, and I have to say that I will be looking for a different hotel during my next trip. In the center of the lobby now is an extremely noisy bar. Maybe the bar was there before; if it was, it wasn't nearly this noisy. The effect of this new noisy interior is one of constant chaos. Needless to say, it is not pleasant. I also noticed a definite decrease in the quality of personal attention that the Marriott hotels have always been very good about. The breakfast buffet felt like an army mess hall. Maybe it was because I arrived during a particularly busy week. I can no longer recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service, Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Julieboolie
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent business traveler and stay at Marriott almost 100% of the time. Needless to say, I have had many experiences at Marriott properties - from catagory 1 to category 7. I am very confident when I say that this Marriott has hands-down some of the best service I have encountered! Everything, from check-in to valet to concierge to room service, was perfect and flawless. They clearly strive to make the experience one that you will never forget. That being said, if I had one complaint, it would be the size of the room. They are small, especially the bathroom. However, the wonderful overall experience definitely eclipses where the actual size and decor of the room lack. In addition, the location of this property could not be more perfect. You can walk right out on Michigan Ave. and delve right into the shopping, restaurants, etc. My experience was wonderful and this will be a place to which I will return and continue to recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Murforall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from Oct. 13th through the 17th for a small vacation. You really can't beat the location, as the hotel has two entrances - one from Michigan Ave. and one from Rush st. Everything is right at your doorstep...shopping, restaurants...and most of the sights aren't very far away from you either. The only bad thing was that we couldn't get a room for love or money that had a king bed, and it became apparent from the first night that the double bed (which I was guessing would be more like a queen), was WAY too small for both of us. Aside from that, the room was nice and clean, with great beds and not-that-great pillows (we found them to be way too soft). I do agree with everyone who has written about how tiny the bathroom was, you can see it in my picture, but there was enough space to put things on the counter. The room itself wasn't too bad though...most people thought it was small, but I found it to be the same size of a hotel room that you would find in any big city in a downtown area. We found the concierge staff to be extremely helpful also. Every day we talked to them and they helped us find restaurants, tickets to different sights and attractions and even bars and clubs. Plus, we found out great info like the fact that the Institute of Art was open from 5-8 pm on Thursday and you could get in for free. This hotel is VERY busy though. Big groups of people attending conferences and the like bustle around the lobby day and night. We didn't find the elevators to be a problem at all, like some other reviewers had commented. We were on the 34th floor, so we would have noticed something like that. We did have a little misunderstanding when it came to the parking situation though...we were told that if we self-parked the car in the adjacent lot to the hotel it would be $30 a day and when we checked out we found out that it's actually $36 a day. It was extremely easy to get around Chicago (we bought a two-day pass for the El/Bus at the "Jewel Osco" store right by the hotel) and the concierge staff had maps and helped us get to where we needed to go. The only minus that we found was that you could hear sirens more or less every two hours around the clock...even being on a high floor didn't help the sound. But, this is what you get when you stay right downtown and we knew that. All in all, this is a very clean, modern hotel and we found the staff to be very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Definitely needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: ncallaha
Reviews.Content: This is a very average Marriott, by even Marriott standards. The hotel rooms are a bit small. It was definitely a squeeze with two people in a two double bed room. The rooms were a bit dated as well as the furnishings and bedspread. I even found burnt marks on the bedding. The concierge staff, is terrible. Although nice, they were completely clueless in how to answer questions about directions and places to eat and entertain. However, the hotel's location does make up for its shortcomings. It is directly located on Michigan (Magnificent Mile) Avenue. So you dont have to go far to shop. Water Place is a few blocks away and you are in the Heart of everything. House of Blues, The Playhouses are really close. You dont need to go rent a car or anything, Public transportation is at the door and a subway stop is a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: malee47
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Marriott Downtown on the Mag Mile and were very satisfied. we got what we expected for a centrally located buisness type hotel. Room was a good size, lacking a little on storage space although the bathroom was on the small side but, hey, how long do you spend in the bath (or room). It was clean and functional. Odd though....no fridge/mini-bar in room. Not a great view as we were only on 15th floor however we do agree the lifts (& there were 6 in our tower) were slow in coming. The bellhop did mention they are being upgraded. Most important to us was where we were situated and the hotel scored 10/10 for this. Being able to walk everywhere we wanted to go to was a huge plus. If I was to be crictal it was a bit "souless" and rather noisey in the lobby with all the conventions in the hotel. Other than that I would recommended it

Reviews.Title: “Two nights, two different rooms, two different experiences”
Reviews.Author: BiniTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on a Thursday and a Saturday night. The first room was awful. It seemed to have been recently renovated, but they forgot to do the bathroom. The second night we had a much better room (lake-view) which had been renovated as well. It did smell like bleach, which seemed to have been spilled outside of our room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but Issues!”
Reviews.Author: Sandyj83
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 other friends stayed at the Mariott for Labor Day weekend. This was our 2nd time staying here, and the location of the hotel is perfect...it's close to everything on Michigan Ave and the North Ave beach down the street. The issues, however, began with check-in. We were a party of 5 and we got a room with one bed! After calling and getting attitude from the operator, we got a different room w/ 2 full beds and rollaway. 2 Full beds are barely enough for 2 people to sleep on, but we dealt with it anyways figuring we're only sleeping there. Aside from check-in, everytime I would call guest svc's for something, it took them at least an hour and half to bring it up. I'd have to call twice for everything, like extra towels. Aside from these minor difficulties, the hotel's location is the best thing about it. The rooms are way small and are barely enough for 2 people, let alone 5.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WVMountaineerinIL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for a business trip. My room needed a little work. The door frames were worn and everything wooden was chipped. The carpeting appeared new, though. They are doing some remodeling, so hopefully they weren't through with my room yet. Also, I kept sneezing in the room. On the plus side the staff was excellent. However, for the price, I'm not sure it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: mark2773
Reviews.Content: When in Chicago we decided to stay the price was $298 per night which i thought was a bit steep but we got a corner room on the 44 th floor (ok size) which gave brilliant views of the city lit up at night- very comfy bed brilliant. As it was the weekend the hotel itself was very busy hey thats big cities, staff were friendly only gripe would be paying $12 for two bottles of water and a sandwich. ps at the parking enterence across the street is the restaurant joes- fab fillet minon and king crab.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Big City Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Samee-Judge
Reviews.Content: Overall this is an average Marriott property typical of what you find in any big city. I was their five nights in July. It appears they just renovated the lobby. It has a very large bar, with a lot of seating, an more flat screen TVs than I could count. It was a very busy, but you could always find a place to sit. A limited, but very good bar menu is served. Check-in was efficient, but the elevators are not. On more than one occassion it took about five minutes for one to arrive on my floor. I was up high on the 35th floor. Not sure why it took so long. The club lounge on the 2nd floor is very good. It's for Marriott Gold and Platinum members. Good bfast, happy hour and deserts. The hotel restaurant is also on the 2nd floor. Again very good food. The 9th floor is where the pool and fitness center is located. They have a large cardio room with lots of equipment, and a large weight room. I was always able to get on the equipment without waiting during the busy after work rush from 5:30-7:00pm. The pool is small but works, the hot tub was hot. NOTE: When I was their the pool would fill up with kids and parents after about 8:00pm when they all came back in from sightseeing and dinner. The rooms are small, and the bathroom was smaller. This is an oolder Marriott that they did renovate with all the new Marriott bedding and fixtures. A family of four would be a tight fit. But the room is functional if you are by yourself on business. Location, location, location. This hotel could not be in a better location for vacations or business. You can walk to all the attractions on Mich Ave and side streets. It's two blocks from the river and you could walk to the loop if you wanted. Cab ride to the board of trade is $8.00. The staff is efficient and friendly. Overall I rated this hotel a "3" because of the size of the rooms and the fact the elevators were so slow. Everything else was above average to excellent. HINT: When I tried to book this hotel back in April 2008 throught the Marriott.com web site room rates were 250+/night. Two weeks prior to my stay I checked again and was able to book a room for under $175/night. Also watch the Wi-Fi and in-room internet charges, they are high. And Chicago's sales tax rate on purchases is now 11.50%.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Lottie001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business. The hotel is large, services many conferences, and as in many larger cities (i.e. the Marriott Marquis in NYC) the wait for an elevator is long. The room was good, clean, and had a great view (large picture window in the room) of the city toward the river on the 32nd floor. The only complaint I could make about the room: the bathroom sink was cracked. You will hear some city noise during the evening, so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the highest floor available. The lobby is very nice, and has a decent bar on the lobby floor. There is a restaurant (called "The Restaurant," formally known as Vensoto) on the 2nd floor which is good - not great. The menu offers 5 dinner items: steak, another steak, a rotisserie chicken, pasta and a fish dish. The lowest priced glass of wine is $9 for a Californian, and most Italians run $11-13. There is also a Starbucks in the lobby open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. Check out is standard â€“ on the television or by a phone call from the room; however, you can also check out at kiosks in the lobby as well as check in to your flight out of Oâ€™Hare. If you are staying at a Marriott because you know the quality and value you get with a Marriott, this is the hotel. However, for dinner I would try Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: graff
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificent and is in an excellent location for doing anything in Chicago. I was there for a conference and the facilities were excellent. Free Wi-Fi, which is always good! The room was clean and the view from the 37th floor was fantastic. Friendly and helpful staff. Great lobby for having a drink and meeting people.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnasTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for a conference. Working in the travel industry myself, I find myself pretty critical of hotels. This Marriott was a pleasant surprise - they have been recently renovated. The lobby was beautiful, the conference rooms were well maintained and the sleeping room had modern decor and was very clean. The best thing about my stay was the staff. Everyone from the bellmen to the front desk staff to the room service staff was outgoing and seemed genuinely happy to have me as their guest. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our Fifth Anniversary Celebration”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Due to rising costs of flying, not wanting to be too out of range of our little one, and a smaller budget this year, our fifth anniversary turned out to be just a weekend and not a whole vacation. As a result, we looked for something fun and undone by us. We have shopped and explored downtown Chicago, but never stayed at any of the fabulous hotels. Every brand you can think of (and some you don't know), exist in at least one of the two downtowns Chicago offers. Having experience with Marriott and their excellent location on Michigan Avenue, we decided to try this hotel for location and views. Physically the hotel did not dissapoint, but the service could be improved. When reservations are made on Marriott's website, Marriott sends you and email a few days before called the "Virtual Concierge" which is a way for you to alert the hotel of any special needs you may have (allergic to feather pillows, need a roll-in shower, etc.) and you have a space in which to type up a question or request of your own. I wrote that it was our anniversary and I wanted to surprise my wife with something along the lines of chocolate covered strawberries and wine, etc., and I wanted to know their pricing and what they offered. I never heard back and just assumed that my message did not go through, or that they wouldn't read it until the day I arrived. I figured I could let the concierge know later during my stay. We arrived at the hotel early and since they only published they had valet service for 39 bucks a day, I did not plan on using my car to go anywhere, so I just had valet park it and paid for it. However, there was a sign that said that there was self parking for $26 a day. Again, we were on a budget and it would have been nice to know about that in advance. The carport can only fit about four cars at a time, in a single line, under it, so if you valet parked, you may wait a while for your car. If you self park, you may be able to get to the garage and get out quicker. We were not expecting to be able to check in so early (1pm) to the hotel. The had a long line of people waiting to check out, even though they had brand new check-out kiosks waiting. While waiting, it gave me time to check out their newly completed renovations. The lobby is fabulous! There a lot of tables and chairs around the lobby that surround their brand new 360-degree bar. The bar, from talking to other people, used to be against the far wall, but now is smack dab in the middle. It is gorgeous with a granite bar all the way around it and very fanciful decor. Next the the desk is a little convenience shop with very upscale drinks and snacks, and, on the other side, a small Starbucks Coffee shop. The lobby was always full of people hanging out, getting drinks and generally socializing. The Concierge desk, near the entrance, was busy making reservations, handing out directions and giving out information about the hotel and area. They had convenient mapcards that they handed you with turn by turn directions for both walking and driving. The elevators were fast, contrary to what I've read on other reviews, and there were always six elevators available. I think I rode on everyone. The elevators are very clean and shiny and have ads and a LCD info TV in them (no sound.) Much to our surprise, management must have read our info because they gave us a corner room on the second to top floor with a breathtaking view of the northern downtown skyline, incuding the Hancock Building. The hallways and room are small showing that this is an older hotel with a facelift, but the real telling factor is the water closet. I call it that because it hardly qualifies as a room to be called a bathroom. You have to close the door to get in the tub! However, they did decorate the space very nicely. There is adequate counter space on the granite vanity and nice amenities as well. The room came with a mini-fridge (always gets the room extra points from me) and we requested and received a microwave. There was an adequate desk with internet connection, lamp and stationary on the far wall. The TV was in a TV cabinet with drawers underneath for storage. There was a sliding glass door, a railing but no balcony, which meant that you could only crack the door due to the safety feature installed on the door. There was a wonderful sitting bench in front of the sliding doors so you could enjoy the views. (Pics to be attached.) We went out and my wife surprised the chocalate lover in me by taking me to the Hershey's store and the Ghiradelli CafÃ© (both across the street from each other). We enjoyed many treats! After getting a few souveniers, we headed back to the room for some rest and to get ready for dinner. Much to both of our surprise, room service had stopped by and dropped off an amenity of chocolate covered strawberries, white wine, and various cheeses and crackers. It worked out for me because I could play it off like I had had it planned, however, since I never knew if I was paying for it or not, or what the price even was, I was a little irked. However, it did make my wife's day, even if it was a day earlier than our actual anniversary! I went to get a safety deposit box and stood in line for a very long time to get it, and subsequently to get in and out of it due to the long lines. After a while though (and especially on Sunday) I started to wonder why they had two or three agents for a sold out hotel, but eight stations available. Deborah at the front desk was fabulous, though. She was attentive, caring and very bright - one of those employees you wish everyone was modeled like. There was another older lady who was clueless. I remember a guest asked her to check into a king room and she had to ask a supervisor (Deborah) which room to check him into. (Huh?) Either she never had any training, or she just wasn't qualified to do this job. Also, many people were taken out of turn at the front desk so it made some people a little upset. Their gift shop patrons also waited a while to pay when the desk was busy. Sometimes they just left their money and left. Others just put their selections back and would opt for the cheaper Walgreens locations along Michigan Avenue. There is an entrance to the hotel on Michigan, but only a walk-up entrance. The drive up entrance is on the opposite street. The Marriott building itself has several stores in it, but no access to them from inside the hotel, only from the outside sidewalks. Across the street is a fabulous restaurant called Bandera, that the concierge was able to get us squeezed into on Saturday. Atmosphere was unbeatable. I scarfed down the BBQ Salmon with Cilantro Rice - Divine!!!! Live music from some old jazz buddies, and attentive service! Just what we were looking for Valet service was super duper slow! We waited about 30 minutes for our car, and even since it was raining and the carport was so small taxi's, and other vehicles that were not allowed in the carport were coming in anyway because of the rain so their customers did not get wet. Before anyone could leave, you were waiting on the car in front to move. And since traffic was backed up on the street, it was gridlock on Sunday midday! In conclusion, I don't think the staff hate their jobs, I think they are a little jaded from all the complaints they received before and during the renovations. I also think that they are frustrated in trying to work three people's worth of work in one shift, so why should they work hard every single day when obviously ownership of this property is only concerned with his bottom line and not the guest's experience. I can see why there are some negative reviews, but some of them I think are grossly exaggerated. I think that if you stay here you shouldn't expect great service, but just know that you are in prime location and can get a great view! Don't let the staff's downfalls ruin your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Marriott”
Reviews.Author: revenueguru
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in downtown Chicago. The room is really nothing special. The bathroom is extremely tiny. The beds are very comfortable and four pillows per bed. Cleanliness is good. The front desk staff was very friendly and efficient. They don't have a traditional front desk but "pods" and the agent will step out in front of the pod and ask if they can help you and then escort you to their pod. Quite friendly service. The breakfast buffet was quite good and the Executive Chef took my order for an omelette. Breakfast food was very good. The biggest complaint I have is the room doesn't have a mini-bar and the AC seems to be strained to keep the room cool. The shower was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: drwendy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Marriot, booked by husband's work for a conference. The location is excellent, just on the south end of the shopping Mile, an easy 4 blocks from Navy Pier and a brisk 30 minute walk from the Museum Campus (Field, Shedd Aquarium, Planetarium). Our overall experience was good and we would stay there again. For details, read on. I am afraid of heights, so I called the hotel directly about 3 weeks prior to our stay to request a room on a lower floor, 14 or lower. I was told that there was no problem with this request and was relieved. However, when we arrived at the hotel they had no record of this request and were handing us a key to our room on the 33rd floor. I had a minor fit and told them that I would just sleep in the lobby if they couldn't do better. The poor young man at the desk then offered 21st floor. I felt like I was bargaining for a trinket in Puerto Rico. Still not low enough. I kept repeating the mantra "but I called ahead..." but nobody seemed impressed. The manager came and fussed with computers a bit, told me that lots of people call with REQUESTS, but they're just REQUESTS and not guarantees. Because we were booked into this hotel and paid for by the convention, I was stuck and scared. The manager finally found us a room on the 10th floor (which, incidentally, is the lowest floor on which guest rooms exist, as everything lower is public areas). He told me they were giving that room to us instead of to the wheelchair-bound woman who had asked for it, something to do with adjoining rooms. So I got the room but also got to feel guilty about inconveniencing the handicapped (didn't occur to me until later, but why does a wheelchair lady need that floor? It's not like someone has to carry her chair up stairs, they have elevators....). Since I am handicapped by my stupid fear of high elevators, I thanked them for the room and wondered why they felt the guilt trip was necessary. So if you're reading this review, wheelchair lady, sorry to have put you out, honestly I am. The room was fine, typical hotel. King size bed, iron, board, hairdryer, shower/tub, toiletries. We overlooked the little sun deck. It was quiet and clean, which is all I really care about. The workout rooms were great, pool is small but indoors and warm, hot tub was nice. Meeting rooms were fine for the convention, though elevators were slow at peak times and shut down for a brief time one afternoon (that helps my elevator fear immensely). Overall the hotel was quite nice and if we find ourselves in Chicago again and can get a decent deal on this place, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated-review”
Reviews.Author: cwcharacters
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite spots in Chicago is the recently renovated Marriott Chicago on Michigan Avenue. However, I hadn't stayed since the renovation began and was eagerly anticipating this trip to see how it all turned out. The location is still in the heart of it all and the exterior is unchanged, but upon entering the lobby, it was apparent that this was not the same, outdated lobby of old, but a "futuristic" interpretation of what a lobby should look like. Gone are the 2nd floor shops, replaced by a grand staircase leading to "The Restaurant." The bar area is draped in neon and the seating is now more than ample. I will say that it all seems a bit much for me. Not as "hotel-like" as before, with a certain air of pretention. However, I'm still at ease in this hotel and I am glad that I can still fell like this after such a big change. The rooms are unchanged. Small and cosy, with upscale bedding. The bathrooms are also small, but clean. I found the public areas overly air conditioned, but my room was nice and toasty. I love the Marriott's total nonsmoking policy. My room and everywhere else in the hotel was pleasantly without that stale smoky smell. "The Restaurant" was better than average. They only lacked in the bread department, with rolls that were obviously packaged. The lake trout was wonderful, as was the homemade mango sorbet. The staff at this hotel makes you feel welcome and I can honestly say that, even with the neon, I'm still at home in the Marriott Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good! Friendly Staff. Nicely Renovated. Location great!”
Reviews.Author: KZ_Trixie
Reviews.Content: I stayed June 13-15 2008, and had booked a Priceline rate which (after taxes & fees) wound up being about $105 a night. (Not bad!) I wanted to write this review because I had a really good experience. I booked this hotel, and then saw a mixed bag of reviews, several negative. It made me a little concerned, but I got there and had a very good time! The Quick Version for the Attention-Span Impaired: Very clean. Tastefully renovated. Slightly above basic comforts. Friendly staff. Awesome location. The Long Version: Location: Excellent! At the south end of the Mag Mile, about a block & a half north of the Wrigley Building. Great for shopping & dining. Cab from Union Station around $7, or the 151 bus for $2. Lobby: The bar takes up a good portion of the lobby. It's kind of cool-looking, with lots of seating. I did not patronize the bar, so can't review it. There is also a Starbucks, which I did frequent and it was good. Check In: They had a lot of people working the front desk, so the wait was short. Although I had used Priceline, (and gotten a killer rate) I was not treated like a second rate or cheapo customer. I got a guy named Terrell or Terrence (can't remember) who seems to enjoy his job. He had a great smile and hooked me up with a nice lake-view room at my request. And, I was able to get right into my room - at noon, on a Friday, in the middle of tourist season, no less! My friend was coming in on another train and they added her name to the reservation, in case she got there while I was out shopping. Again, no hassle and happy to help. My front desk experience made me happy right off the bat, and from that moment, I expected the rest of my stay to be great. (And it was.) Elevators: There are separate ones for lower & upper floors. Most of the time, the wait isn't anything significant. The only time I felt the wait was long-ish was Sunday morning, when you could see a lot of people were checking out. Even then, it wasn't ridiculous. The Room, #3522: Was clean and pleasantly decorated. Air conditioning worked good. We had a lake-view and could see the sailboats on the water, as well as a view of the Tribune Tower. My friend and I both raved about the beds & pillows - so snuggly! We both slept like rocks. TV didn't have a lot of exciting options, but we didn't watch much other than the Weather Channel. (Who comes to Chicago to watch TV? Or hang out in their room for that matter...?) Was the room large? No. But it was not tiny, either. It was just fine for two people. It could probably could be a little tight for 4 people. Bathroom: Again, clean, tasteful, simple. Fine for two people, four would be tight. Nice hot water, water pressure a touch on the weak side, but not enough that I would complain. Bath & Body Works goodies - nice! Only complaint - wish it had a vent fan, in case anyone leaves the restroom smelling not so great. However, I think there is a fan when the shower runs, because it never fogged up in there, and there's a grate above the shower head. Hallway / Walls: Never heard much noise. Staff: Bellhop Michael "from Baltimore" was a hoot. Concierges pretty nice, had good info. Front desk were all nice. Housekeeping efficient and quiet. Cannot comment on: Bar, Restaurant, Gym, Pool, Internet. Didn't use 'em. So what's with all the complaints? People complaining about valet parking, small hotel rooms / small bathrooms, slow elevators? Maybe they don't have a lot of experience traveling in big cities like Chicago or New York, where square footage costs money. Also, if you've ever been to a big Vegas hotel or a large convention, you understand how elevators work. This ain't NASA, and it does take a couple of minutes to make its way down from the 44th floor. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: Cambrian79
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks Great on the outside but.... I was at a 3 day conference booked by my company. Since I had never been to Chicago, I decided to stay the weekend with my husband joining me. Unfortunately my arrival started out unpleasant and continued throughout my stay. I was informed that i could not have a King Size Bed which I had requested when my company gave us the option. The clerk was not willing to accomodate even knowing that I was staying the weekend. I later found out that other colleagues had a king size bed without even requesting, so I was very dissapointed that my request was not met. I was mislead to believe that the rooms had 2 queens, instead they were double/doubles. Who still uses those type of beds, in a 4* hotel? Without going into too much detail, the rooms were not of a very good quality, small, cramped bathroom and you had to leave the door open if you took a shower, (no vents). After 2 nights, and my husband arrived, I called the desk and insisted on a king size room, and what do you know.. they found availability funny enough? When we changed rooms at 12:30pm, the staff was very friendly by the way throughout my stay, except for the 1st guy. The carpeting in the king room was wet, but I wasn't about to change the room again or hotels either at this point. Bottom line, the hotel was not what I believe a Marriott normally represents, and i was highly dissappointed. I would not stay in this particular hotel again, even at the lowest rate they had available, which they say they "granted" me to compensate my mishaps throughout my stay. The rate is a whole other story.. thanks for your reading time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at The Marriott”
Reviews.Author: taylor805
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than what other reviewers have written. I am a single guy in my 30s. I stayed 2 nights at the hotel with a guest. We had a King Room on the top floor that I booked via Priceline and payed little over 1/2 of what the regular rate was each night. I valet my car, and $39 is a little pricey for that,but not so much when you are in a large city, and the time frame didnt take any longer than it does for any other hotel. The elevators too aren't the fastest, but it never got so bad that I decided I would walk up 46 flight like the one reviewer claimed he did ! (Seriously, does anyone believe that?) Upon check in I asked for a room away from the elevators since a lot of people complained that those rooms were noisy. The front desk was very accomdating and gave me a nice quite room. Yes, I could hear traffic noises, like a siren hear or there, but it wasnt like I didnt know that I was in an urban enviornment! You come to a big city you are going to have certain things just like if you went to the country! The room iteself was a little small, but that is what you get in larger cities. I am ok with. I enjoyed the city and its attractions, and didnt spend every hour in my room. Chicago has a lot to do and see - take advantage of it. Although, I did stay in that hotel a few years ago and the rooms were larger! I found it odd that the TV was not flat screen, but was ok with it. The bed was nice and the pillow choices were good too. The bathroom isnt the biggest and one reviewer mentioned that they had to shut the door to use the toliet and shower. Well, I would hope so that you would shut the door to use the bathroom. The indoor pool and hot tub is nice, I wish it stayed open a little longer since I was out all day long and didnt get back until 10 at night, and it closes at 11. It seemed to be less crowded early in the mornings. Lots of cardio equipment and the locker rooms have a steam room. The best part is the location. Close to everything. Almost dead center to everything you want to do on North Michigan Avenue and South Michigan Ave. All of the staff that I encountered was very nice, and the hotel uses Bath and Body Works products.

Reviews.Title: “Does not belong on the Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: marla5575
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel for the price and location. The rooms are cramped, the bathroom was so small I couldn't access the shower or toilet without closing the door. I really expect so much more for a Magnificent Mile hotel. I was traveling on business for 4 days with a colleague and we both checked out after one night and went to the Drake Hotel for the same price. In addition to being small, it was SO loud! All night i could hear the horns honking & taxis being whistled for (from 12 floors up!), and there was a vent fan right outside my room that I could hear all night. Additionally, my room was freezing! I called the front desk and was told the whole hotel was on AC, not heat, so my thermostat was not going to blow hot air, and there was nothing they could do for 50 degree night time weather. I will never stay here again and have told the company I'm doing business with in Chicago not to recommend it to their other colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: jlucas1016
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this Marriott for a conference and after reading some of the negative reviews, I confess I was apprehensive. But the hotel pleasantly surprised me. From the moment I checked in, the staff could not have been friendlier nor more helpful. And my room was spacious, at least according to some of the rooms in NYC that I've stayed. It looks freshly redecorated and the linens were great. The location is perfect - you're in the heart of the Chicago downtown, next to Nordstroms, Saks and others shopping icons. And if you're into fitness, they have a great gym and pool. I managed to get in a workout and then go shop after my conference. I would highly recommend the hotel. Julie in Denver

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: funtravelfamily
Reviews.Content: I can not find anything bad to say about this hotel. We stayed here last week-end and loved it. This hotel is nice and right in the middle of EVERYTHING. We were able to walk to Millenium Park , Navy Pier, Sears Tower and too many restaurants to list. This is the hotel to stay in. We used the pool and hot tub. This entire area was very clean and the pool water was nice and warm. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We saw no construction going on during our visit. We had a room facing the Chicago River which was behind the elevators and it was quite a bit larger than the regular rooms, you could hear the elevators, but it did not bother us at all. We enjoyed our stay so much, we are planning to return to Chicago again soon for a longer visit. Thanks Marriott!! Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “NOt worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alias605
Reviews.Content: First the good, it is beautifully redesigned a big improvement over what it was in the past. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean. Banquet services were nice - food good, rooms clean, etc. The Hotel Restaurant was a mess - very expensive, horribly slow service, and the staff rude. The prices at the hotel bar were outrageous. It always irritates me in a $200/night hotel that I am expected to pay $15/night for internet - ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Babytravel15
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to Chicago for a 2 day conference, so my 2yr old son and I decided to tag along. The best feature about hotel is location. It is close to Millenium Park, Navy Pier, and of course all the shopping on the Magnificent mile. Hotel is still under construction and we saw workers in the lobby. Our Room was on the small side but I think that is standard in those downtown hotels. It had nice new flat screen TV, but no mini bar or coffee mashine. Bathroom was clean, but showerhead screamed for replacement. My main complaint was that it was soooooo cold. We even called the staff to help adjust heating, but nothing helped. My husband also complained that it was very cold where all the lectures were. Hotel has a nice pool on 9th floor, water was luke warm, whirlpool a little better, but air temperature again was too cold. Outside was cold too so we would go to nearby Nordstrom to warm up. Restaurant at the hotel was small. We only tried breakfast buffet since we did not like lunch and dinner menues. Fortunately there are fabolous restaurants just few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: jenluvstravelin
Reviews.Content: My fiance and myself visited this hotel through a work function. It was very easy to find although beware, if you are driving, the entrance is actually on Rush St. We used valet parking and it went fine, as check in did as well. I don't think I have ever checked into a hotel quite so quickly! The service was wonderful. My only problem...the rooms are SO small. We only stayed one night, I couldn't fathom staying another as I was getting claustrophobic. My fiance and I couldn't even pass between the dresser and bed at the same time! The room was very clean, as was the bathroom, we found no problems in that area, we just couldn't move around! We finally started climbing over the bed to get to the other side of the room! I didn't take any pics of the room, I couldn't find a good view. My meeting was at the hotel and it was fine, check out was easy. The only problem we encountered with that was getting our car back from valet, the lady was extremely rude!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Room, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Beta7
Reviews.Content: This location is on the Magnificent Mile and is close to everything. There are subway stations close, too, so you can get to and from the airport easily. The room was clean, looked modern, and was comfortable. They only had one towel in the room, so we had to call for more, but they were brought up promptly. The room was expensive, so I'm not sure I'd stay there again because of that, but it was a great place to stay. They do not provide free internet. I can't believe there are still hotels charging for internet use. This is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay, Never stay there”
Reviews.Author: Carolinagirl51
Reviews.Content: It was our daughters birthday celebration we wanted something special. The renovations were terrible because the service was sooo bad! The elevators were so slow we waited 30 minutes to come down to the lobby then just took the steps all the way from the 40 th floor. Then the lounge was closed, okay maybe for the inconvience to their customers they could have a coffee station, NO, they still had you sit in a hallway to have your coffee or wine while the jack hammer was going! The work out room, the tv didn''t match the headsets, so you couldn't listen to the tv, then once again they charged us for bottled water instead of giving us one for the inconvences of the whole hotel. Bottom line the service, the hotel was TERRIBLE. We normally stay at the Drake, we know why now!

Reviews.Title: “terrible...stay away!”
Reviews.Author: vinhpac33
Reviews.Content: service: we initially found a great deal and reserved through marriott.com. however, after a long day of travel with 2 kids, we checked in at about 10pm they decided to DOUBLE the rate on us, after we had already checked in! the front desk called to our room after the kids had fallen asleep and said the supervisor told them the rate was no longer effective, yet it was on their website! i asked them to compromise b/c it was their mistake but they wouldn't budge. i told them we would find another hotel and they told us "go ahead." so by the a.m. we were in a better hotel with better service and view! the hotel itself: the front desk had 2 people staffing it and just two parties checking in (including us). however, the other lady at the front desk decided to walk away and not check us in, she told us to wait until the other staffer was done with the first party. hotel entrance was off of machigan ave. and hard to get to b/c of the one way streets. the lobby was a mess with construction going on. we stayed on the 35th floor for one night and could hear the work they were doing! the rooms are very small for 2 adults and 2 small kids. restuarants were meager, weak on selection, bland on food and ridiculous on price ($15 for pastry and piece of fruit)! would not recommend this hotel. you can find better elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until construction complete”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times without problems but it is currently undergoing a major renovation and that presents many challenges. The entire lobby and a number of meeting rooms are under construction. During the day it can be noisy. Unless you can't find a better deal, I would recommend avoiding this hotel until the renovations are complete. After construction I am sure it will be back to its high standards and you can't beat the location in downtown Chicago. One item that doesn't have anything to do with the construction is the overly long delays in answering the phone by hotel staff. It was a noticable problem my last visit. Also, the elevator delays were a big challenge. Plan on ten minutes at least to catch an elevator to and from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment - "Under Renovation"”
Reviews.Author: Sara981
Reviews.Content: I echo the two previous postings. I stayed here for a full week on business and was so excited...until I got there. Consistently a 10-15 minute wait in line just to speak to someone at front desk or to check-in/check-out. Slooooow elevators cannot support the traffic in the hotel at all. Room was very small and had no microwave or mini-fridge. On top of high price, they charged nightly for internet access (free at most $69/night motels) and $39 a night to valet my car - with possibly the WORST valet service I've ever seen. It takes 10 to 15 minutes AT LEAST to get the car out, which can take much longer because their drop-off/pick-up point is on this awful little street FULL of traffic. I waited 15 minutes to complain to the front desk about the valet issue, and I was told "they are run by a separate company that we contract in. If you want to complain blah blah blah." In-house dining was a joke- there was either a basic boring bar or a snotty restaurant. In-room dining was even worse! An omelette and toast was $24!!! I did have a beautiful view, but that was definitely the best part of the stay. I would never go back, even after renovations, because I can't even IMAGINE what they will charge then!

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware”
Reviews.Author: janeCharleston_WV
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a conference that was held at the Marriott. The advertisement states "under renovation" - THAT IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT. The accommodations are worse than an outdated "Motel 6". I cannot believe Marriott International would allow one of their properties to host a convention with the condition and service as I experienced. The convention host had me upgraded and requested that I do not contact headquarters. In all of my travels, this is the first time that I have complained to the extent that I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Below my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott properties around the world 120+ nights a year for work, and consider myself well-versed on what to expect from their hotels. I have stayed at just about every other Marriott property in Downtown Chicago over the past few years, and have always looked forward to the chance to stay at this hotel because it is the flagship Marriott in Chicago. I was delighted by several aspects of my stay, but really disappointed by others. First, the good points: The room, which I booked on the hotel website, was only $159 a night. It had recently had a "soft" renovation, meaning new carpets, furniture, wallcoverings and bedding. The hotel's lower levels were under renovation, and the areas which had been redone (all the meeting rooms, the restaurant, and the concierge lounge) were really nice. The lobby, which was still torn up, looked like it will eventually be great based on the renderings. Now, the bad: The rooms really needed a more thorough renovation. The bathroom was very tired, and had been redone on the cheap like one of those home improvement shows where they have only $1000 to spend. The tub, tile, and ceilings were old and shabby. The room was really, really small for a Marriott. The hallways are dark and shabby, and according to an employee I know who works at the hotel, are not due to be renovated. They need it badly. The concierge lounge, even with the hotel at full capacity due to a large trade show, is closed on weekends, and due to the renovations, there are few other options on-site for gathering places with colleagues. The elevators were really slow. I think the basic problem here, like a lot of large city hotels, is that the building is about 30 years old, has gotten a lot of traffic over the years, and needs a major renovation moreso than cosmetic improvements.. Overall, I think Marriott really has failed with this property. Considering that Chicago is one of the nation's great hotel cities, they have come up short here in an area where there are many terrific competitors. I'm back to the newer and fresher Courtyard or more luxurious Renaissance for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: anynomous
Reviews.Content: Yes, $400 dollars a night is alot, but we got a much better deal, for our stay. If you are willing to pay that much, go for it. However, if you see a deal less than $200, and really want to stay in downtown, it is hard to pass it. I expect Marriots (Hiltons, Hyatts, Wyndhams, etc.) to be 3-star or 3-1/2 star hotels, with a nice, but rather small room, not too small that I would feel claustrophobic, but not like I feel "wow this room is huge". However, the room was definately much bigger than expected, especially for being in downtown chicago. I remember staying at the Regal Knickerbocker Hotel (now the Millineum Knickerbocker) and rembered a luxurious looking room that looked way smaller than the average Marriott. Basically the room is just what they say it is on the website, I noticed a large flat screen tv, not alot of channels for the chicago area, but they at least had the basic ones. Comfortable beds, and still area to sit and lounge. Our bellman Jorge, was great, and went out of our way to help us. The check-in was quick, and thats all for service, granted, I do not remember a problem. I did not eat at the hotel or go to the pool, or remember using any other amenities. The location is better than I ever imagined, with a mall next door, and plenty of shopping, and a ton of great restaurants, in less than walking distance. I am from St. Louis, and it was hard to imagine such a great downtown area, with so much to do and so many great places to eat. Many attractions are at Navy Pier and Grant Park which is a bit far, but if you spend the day there, it is best, because you can eat at some of the world's best restaraunts just a few blocks or less away. The other side of the Chicago River, where Grant Park and the Sears Tower is, does not have all the great restaurants, so it may be cheaper. Overall, the Location was the best part, but the hotel was excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch! Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: vaznayak
Reviews.Content: After spending a few weeks at different Marriott properties in Chicago, I'm getting convinced that Marriott's standards in Chicago are quite substandard. One would assume that this Marriott would be a "Magnificant" one. I could look past the lobby being under renovation, however, the corridors are dirty and smell stale - and that's all the floors I've stayed on. The rooms are OK< though the TVs need updating. The bathrooms are small - as are the rooms. The workout center is the one saving grace. This property is in serious need of the whole place being upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Bascially on par with a Ramada Inn”
Reviews.Author: ericl
Reviews.Content: I travel weekly and find Marriott continues to good down a grade to a level of a Holiday Inn or Ramada Inn. The lobby at this hotel was being remodeled which did not bother me as I do not use those services. The room was very worn. Grout missing in the shower, tiles looking like they were going to fall off, wall papers peeling off the wall. The hallway was missing covers to a couple of light fixtures and ceiling tiles. The room looked like it had not been changed since the 70's. The furniture was fine just the popcorn ceiling etc. I have begun to stay at Hyatt and Westin's more as there standards are much, much higher. I even looked at my bill and was given the bill under my door for a room down the hall. Elevators in the am a nightmare. Too many people wanting to use at once an not enough capacity. No honor bar in room which surprised me. Great location just not a 4 star hotel more 3 or even 2. Got a good deal and now I now why. I guess I would have liked to known why I got the value so maybe I could have decided to pay more for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiSwimMom
Reviews.Content: Skip this location until the construction is complete. Not only was the lobby under construction, the restuarant has been moved and downsized. The lobby lounge/bar area was worn out and hardly welcoming. The pool area, also under construction, was dirty and the steam room smelled like mildew. With only one restaurant to serve a large hotel, the wait for breakfast was over half an hour! The windows in our room were so poorly insulated that ICE formed and covered them from top to bottom, leaving our room very cold, unless the thermostat was set on 80 at all times. My daughter actually melted the ice with a hairdryer, so we could enjoy our "view". I would try the Courtyard, one block down, instead - great restaurant and a real Starbuck's onsite. At present, this hotel is not up to Marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Disappointing for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: OphirBY
Reviews.Content: We spent one night on the weekend before Christmas 2007, just to enjoy the beauty of Chicago, with all the lights and shops of the magnificent mile. The Marriott was a bit overwhelming, to say the least. Maybe it was the pre-Christmas rush, but when we walked into the lobby the first thing we wanted to do was head back out the door. Hundreds and hundreds of people! It was impossible to get to the front desk without having to walk around people, again and again. I would say it was very reminiscent of Penn Station. Still, check-in was very efficient and even though we were way back in line, we were in the elevator in less than 3 minutes. The rooms are tiny (at least the standard room we had), with barely enough space to move around. The beds were extremely comfortable and the view from the window...well, it's Chicago... Gotta love it! We also spent some time in the swimming pool which was very cold and shallow. I wouldn't really call it a pool, but rather a kid's wading pool. Still, it's a pool and the kids had fun. My daughter had always wanted to try breakfast in bed "Suite Life of Zack and Cody" style, so we ordered it and it was right on time. Very expensive but adequate amount of food and hot coffee. The location - right on Michigan Avenue - can't beat that! All in all - a bit disappointing because I always thought of Marriott as an icon of excellence, but I guess my review might be subjective due to the pre-Christmas rush and the fact that I opted for a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishing!”
Reviews.Author: Basil192
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October for a business trip with my partner, who was there for work. I was there on holidays, so I got to spend lots of time downtown and in the hotel. From the moment we arrived there were problems, firstly them telling us that the agent (through work) had not made the reservation properly, but we could still check in (thanks, it was midnight!)and the next day when we rang the agent, she said it was all booked properly and the Mariott had already taken the money out for the whole two weeks we were there. When we told them this they realised it was their mistake, and the booking had gone through. This just annoyed me because it is a huge thing to mess up, especially for guests who are paying for a premium room and staying for two weeks. Anyway, the room was pretty tiny, small bathroom, old looking..the toilet started flooding the room after the first flush! so instead of moving us to a new room, they actually replaced the toilet! i'm not kidding, the next morning the service people knock on the door and i open it to find two workmen and a new toilet standing in the doorway!! hilarious. The service was good, but not what you expect for a hotel where you are paying $500US to stay a night, it really was not worth that, in Sydney you'd get a top notch hotel for that..and this was pretty bad. The breakfast was good, we had access to the Club Lounge where we could go for breakfast and drinks etc.. not bad.. but still old and tired very 80's ..needs refurbishing. The best thing about the hotel was its location, downtown, close to everything, you walk out the door and you're in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, so you can't ask for better. But no, I would not stay there again, especially if I had to pay for it out of my own money, it is just a waste...you can do better. Try the Four Seasons or the Sheraton in Chicago, I heard they're good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: marcom_pro
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business, and with my family. Although this is a nice facility - beware if you have a problem. The staff is courteous, but just don't respond. My case is that we were moved to another room, and my son left a Nintendo game console behind because it was a quick move. I accept responsibility for leaving it in the original room, but did contact the management the same day to inform them; I was told to wait for them to handle it until the next day. Over the next 5 days until checkout, I repeatedly asked the hotel managers and security for help. Beyond taking reports, they did nothing to retrieve the device. And during the next few weeks, Marriott management refused to accept any responsibility, sending me form letters. I was so frustrated I asked for the name of the people who had my original room so I could pursue it. That was ignored, as were letters to the property manager. Bottom line - it ruined my stay. This Marriott has poor customer service and is unresponsive. If you have a problem fix it right then and there and don't take their word that they are "working on it" - because they don't. Obviously they do not value a guest's business.

Reviews.Title: “all good at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: dlj5
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this property if you are looking for shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The free trolley can shuttle you around town as well. The rooms were small but clean and updated. During our visit the hotel was very busy so the elevators were a bit slow. Do not take a room by the elevator- they are loud! Pool and fitness center were good. This is an older hotel but book it if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference for three days. Room - small, everything worked as it was supposed to, bed was fair and the bathroom was certainly clean. No wireless internet. Lobby - rather underwhelming for a major hotel in downtown Chicago. Lobby bar - absolutely horrific service. Waited for service for over half an hour, and the waitress could not get the order right after a few tries. Manager on duty was marginally effective. Check in - no way to leave the car at the entrance or around it for check in, either valet park for an arm and a leg or use a parking garage next door. Location - certainly central being right in the middle of Michigan ave outside the loop Overall - adequate but rather disappointing considering that this is one of the major downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on business. Loved the very comfortable king-size bed and crisp sheets. The room was well set up and kept clean. Bathroom was very decent and I had sufficient space. My room was on the 17th floor and on the quiet part of hotel, so I actually slept really well, which is unusual on the first night for me. The restaurant served very good food. (Ate breakfast and lunch only). Nice, large lobby with Starbucks on-site. Great location on the mag mile with short walk to great shopping. All staff were very friendly and responsive to requests. On the negative side thermostat in the room could not be set properly, was a little cool. Rooms are not wireless. Although I was told I had late check out, the maid checked me out anyways and my bags were still in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Marriott”
Reviews.Author: chazzOH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference, and it was very disappointing. The room was very hot and dry, and adjusting the in-room thermostat didn't seem to make much difference. Many other conference attendees reported the same problem. The hotel does not have wireless internet, and the cable for the internet was so short that it barely reached the desk. Overall, the rooms just seemed outdated. This hotel is in dire need of an update. Based on information in the hotel guidebook, it does appear that they are updating the property, starting with the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very likely to return”
Reviews.Author: fewtravels4me
Reviews.Content: Annual shopping/birthday trip to the Windy City. Thought we'd try this Marriott and glad we did. Location cannot be much better if you are here for shopping on Mag Mile. Room small, yes, but if only in for the weekend who cares. Get out of your room and enjoy Chicago. Beds/pillows were quite comfy. Shower pressure only fair, but what to expect on 22nd floor. Enjoyed the view from the 22nd floor. Service at the door was excellent. They instantly hailed us a cab and loaded our luggage upon checkout. Got us to Second City via a towncar for cheaper than a cab. Staff was friendly all around. EATS - Go across the street to Joe's - it was not a cheap birthday dinner, but boy was it good! Good eats and all the shopping you need within a few blocks of a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: I was at the Marriott for a meeting of my professional society. Overall, I liked it. The room was clean and well-equipped but a bit small. There are plenty of grocery stores and restaurants within easy walkting distance so you're not stuck with paying hotel food and restaurant prices. Business services were decent with one â€œmissâ€�. I was moderating 2 panels, so I really appreciated the fact that they had A/V people walking in before sessions and asking if everything was OK- technical issues with the equipment could be resolved quickly and easily. They also had a single in-house number to call for support if you needed them at other times. The â€œmissâ€�- one of my panelists was stuck in traffic and called the hotel trying to reach me. They told him I wasnâ€™t registered there. Iâ€™d been there for 4 days at that point. We also found the elevators very slow when sessions finished up; sometimes we waited forever and then 3 showed up on the same floor at once. The high-speed Internet was consistently reliable, which I canâ€™t always say for many hotels Iâ€™ve used. You have to sign on daily unless you get the â€œwired for businessâ€� package ($9.95/day) when you check in. Oddly, every time I signed in it gave me a choice of a $14.95 rate or a $9.95 rate and I always chose the $9.95 one even though I hadnâ€™t bought â€œwired for businessâ€� and $9.95 is what I was charged. Note thereâ€™s a 15% â€œInternet taxâ€� on top of that. Nasty. The hotel offers shuttle services to and from Midway and Oâ€™Hare every 15 minutes. Itâ€™s cheaper than a cab- for the 2 of us it was $38 one way. An alternative is the subway/train system (Grand is the nearest stop) from the airport for $2 but it involves a change of train, which is even worse if you have bags. Two warnings about the shuttle bus: first, we were waiting in the lobby and one came and went without anyone announcing it. So keep an eye out the door. Fortunately, we werenâ€™t in a hurry and got the next one. Itâ€™s also â€œfirst-come, first-serveâ€� and they donâ€™t take reservations. Ours stopped at a second hotel and couldnâ€™t pick up all the people who were waiting for it due to lack of space. We were skeptical about the one-hour estimate for transit time to the airport when we got into a traffic jam (this was a noon departure from the hotel) but it was almost exactly an hour door to door. You can get tickets for the shuttle at the Concierge desk and they can add it to your room charges. The pool was decent- a nice length but narrow enough that when there were 3 of us swimming laps we had to duck out of each othersâ€™ ways as we passed. The Fitness Center had enough equipment that I noted treadmills available at 7 AM. Overall, I liked this hotel and would return if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but get room away from elevators”
Reviews.Author: GetUp&GoGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here attending a convention. The hotel has a great location, right on Magnificent Mile and lots of shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance. We were on the 24th floor and even at this level heard road noise and sirens day and night. Guess there's not much soundproofing in the window area. Also, if you go, request a room away from the elevator. We were near a bank of 6 elevators and it was so noisy we had to wear earplugs every night. Housekeeping left something to be desired. Behind the coffeemaker, on a shelf below the desk, I found a previous guest's pill bottle that it looked like she'd stored some kind of brown powdery stuff in (coffee? cocoa? tea? hmmm...). I left it there a couple of days and finally threw it out myself. The one coffee mug I used the first day was never replaced during our 6 night stay, nor were the teabags. This part of the room was basically untouched and invisible to the housekeeper. The lobby bar is very nice and open, and a great meeting place. Conveniently, they serve a light menu which was great for us folks arriving late. I'd stay here again if someone else was paying, just because it's a great location, and I'd definitely get a room w-a-y down the hall from the elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: cindyrella25
Reviews.Content: Three girlfriends and I stayed here for a girls weekend. Three chief complaints: a) I would agree the room itself and the bathroom are a bit on the small side b) We did not have wireless internet c) One of us ordered breakfast from room service, the French Toast did not say it came with bacon so she ordered a side of bacon for $5, which was fine, but the French Toast came with bacon. Room service could have said that and saved us $5. Having said that this is a very nice hotel, accommodating staff, great location, and very comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference facility, room and location”
Reviews.Author: orangestar22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights to attend a conference, also held at the hotel. The food served at the conference was surprisingly good. The room was nice, I had a great view of downtown. No complaintes on the room equipments, cleanliness, and atomosphere. I can't believe they charge for wireless internet in the room though. They need to add more elevetors. I had to wait for such a long time every time I wanted to go to my room or conference floor. Overall, the hotel met most of my expectations of what this hotel would be. I would have given them 5 points instead of 4 for not charging extra for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SammyRaeHall
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is perfectly located on Michigan Avenue. It is next to a mall, and within walking distance to all of the shops, the Chicago River, Millenium Park, etc. The hotel itself is very nice, though the rooms are not as updated as some of the other Marriott's we have been to. However, our room was clean and quiet. Also, the Concierge Level was above average and offered an extensive breakfast. Chicago is a beautiful city, and if you are there to tour the area and see all of the sights, then I highly recommend the Marriott. Recommended Sights: Hancock Observatory (within walking distance), Millenium Park (nice walk if the weather is cooperating), and a boat ride of the Charles River & Lake Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Much to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Innov8ive
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile for a medical conference. Upon entering the lobby, I was very impressed with the upscale decor and ambiance. The staff was friendly, prompt and courteous. Thatâ€™s where it ended. The rooms left much to be desired especially at a rate of $300/night (which was a â€œdiscountedâ€� conference rate). The dÃ©cor was very dated. The bathroom had marble countertops, but nothing else. The bathtub had rust and mold was growing within the caulking. The carpeting, dÃ©cor and lighting in the hallways was so dark, dim and gloomy that I thought I was in an Alfred Hitchcock movie classic. The ice machines did not function properly, so I had to travel up several flights of stairs, to find one that actually worked. Granted, these were small problems, but I had higher expectations for the brand name and price. However, on a brighter note, the location was superb!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION- NICE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: shvtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a Friday night. Location is a 10 out 10. I felt like I had an apartment on Michigan Ave. Elevators were easy to get to. Hotel staff extremely friendly. Train stop (Grand Sr Station) one block or so away. I bid the hotel on Priceline and paid $140 compared to $289 at Marriott.com. Would I stay her again. you bet I would.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: marleney
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I love Marriott hotels. I have never stayed at one that I didn't enjoy. That being said, they are sometimes above my price range. For this trip, I needed to go as cheaply as I could without lowering my standards. While searching, the Marriott website was the first one I looked at. Then I looked at different hotel sites as well as travel sites offering deals. Everything was above my budget. So I tried Priceline. This was my first time using it, and I was so very happy when my third bid was accepted to see that I'd won the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile! Being a Pricline reservation, there were restrictions. However, it doesn't hurt to try, so the week before our arrival, I emailed the hotel directly to request that the 2 rooms I had reserved be adjoining and that we have 2 beds in each room. Within one day, I had a reply from them saying they would forward my request to the front desk and do everything possible to accomodate us. When we arrived, I mentioned emailing, and the front desk person assured me that they were going to accomodate that request! I was very happy, as we had 5 in our party, and wanted to stay together, if possible. The rooms were beautifully decorated. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever had in a hotel room. Lots of soft, fluffy pillows, down comforters, quality bed linens. Modern, flat screen tv's in each room. Two phones in each room. A desk with chair, and an upholstered chair as well. We also had a full length mirror in each room, which was very nice. The only down side, and this was very minor, was the size of the bathrooms. The toilet and tub were in one very small room, and the sink and closet were outside of that room. Only one person could stand in front of the sink, as there was no room for anyone else. Having 3 women in one room and 2 in the other, this made it a little hard, but we made do just fine. Water pressure in the shower was good, not a fine spray like most hotels. Never had a problem with water temperature either. The staff at this hotel were wonderful. Every time we had a question or request, it was dealt with very courteously and quickly. Check in and out was quick and easy. The only time we ate in one of the hotel restaurants was the morning we left. We grabbed a muffin and coffee on our way out, where the service was quick and the prices were decent. We tried out the pool and the hot tub the last evening, and that was a big hit, as we were all pretty tired from all the walking we did while shopping. The exercise room looked very nice, although we didn't have an opportunity to use it. Location of this hotel was great for our needs. Close enough to walk to the Loop for the theater, and right on the Mag Mile, close to shopping and restaurants. We caught the bus right across the street for the northern end of Michigan Ave, and for going to the zoo. All in all, a wonderful stay, and this hotel may just become the only place I want to stay while visiting Chicago! If only I could afford to stay there more often!

Reviews.Title: “Just Loved it”
Reviews.Author: princess_sparkles
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend 10/11 -10/14. Everything about the stay was perfect. The room was great, the view was great, the location was perfect. The front desk was knowledgeable and helpful as was the concierge. Great restaurant recommendations, helpful with directions. This hotel's location is ideal for seeing multiple parts of the city. As other reviewers stated the bathroom was on the smaller side, but it wasn't a problem for us. We didn't spend our trip in there and it was clean and everything was in good order. I honestly have not one complaint about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: liborman
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler to Chicago, I always welcome the opportunity to come back to a city that has some of the best hotels in the US. Usually I stay at the Park Hyatt or the Peninsula, but our conference was at the Marriott so I stayed there out of convenience- what a mistake! For over $300, you get a room smaller than some closets, with virtually no amenities. The Michigan ave location is good, but for another $150, the Park Hyatt is sure to delight you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: cgriffith_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night in a hotel just down the block but were not happy with the premises. Walked into the Marriott on Sept. 8 and they were very helpful - showed us a room and we promptly booked 5 nights on the spot, government rate for 3 nights and AAA rate the other two, so overall less expensive than the hotel down the block. Everything about this hotel made our stay a pleasant experience - the hotel staff, housekeeping, breakfast at their 4th floor dining room, view from our room on the 41st floor, and the fact that the entire hotel is a nonsmoking facility. Rooms were tastefully decorated and very clean. Beds were comfortable and room was quiet, too - no noise from rooms on either side. Ask for a lakeside view - you get a little of the city and a little of the lake. We had a city-only view with sunsets, and that was nice, too. One added bonus: Trader Joes is in the next block, which is convenient for snacks and wines. Location is good - one block off the Magnificent Mile and within walking distance of Millenium Park, the Art Institute, and the Chicago Architecture Foundation (the latter for great tours & info). We didn't care about the shopping on The Mile, but it's where to get buses to go places elsewhere in the city. Overall, the Marriott made our first-time stay in Chicago a wonderful experience. I'd recommend it to my relatives....

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Chicago Marriott”
Reviews.Author: stadick123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Chicago with my new FIANCE. We booked a room at the Chicago Marriott. It was a little pricy, but included a lot. I recommend the "Romance Package" to anyone looking for a "wow" weekend. It included champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, breakfast in bed for 2 and a later checkout. Not only was the hotel nicer than anything I've stayed in, but the service was also great. They gave us info on where to go (dinner, nightlife, etc.) We got to check in early. The room was great. Not the biggest, but very nice. We were on the 33rd floor which meant just a magnificent view of the city. I proposed at Navy Pier, and everything worked out great. Needless to say, this was the greatest weekend of our lives. A great hotel, great location and an all around great city. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: coveman53
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and was able to check my bags and pre-register. The front desk was helpful and friendly. Room was a little small but nice. Room was on the 43rd floor. Fast elevator ride. Great view of the Saturday night fireworks at the Navy Pier. Comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and Marriott-like”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: I was there this past weekend, and honestly, have no clue what the prior poster is talking about. What construction? We checked in with ease and a smile, even though it was only 10 a.m. Got a room on the 23rd floor. Elevators were never a problem (not even the problem earlier posters had pointed out about crowds, let alone what the prior poster said about only one elevator being in service). Most of the time there was nobody or one other person/couple in the elevator with us on the way up or the way down. We never waited more than a minute for the elevator. The lobby is nice - as I said in the title, very Marriott-like. We were only there for a short stay, so never even sat in the lobby. Did get a cup of tea at the Starbucks in the lobby, again, nice, pleasant service. The room itself was average-size. I'd estimate the main part of the room measures 16 x 13. Unbelieveably comfortable king-size bed and linens. As Marriott rewards customers, we have stayed in many many Marriotts, as well as many many other hotels over the years, and I'd venture to say this was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on, including my own at home. Small dresser and desk, loveseat, two nightstands. The room's biggest "issue" is the size of the bathroom. I've only ever seen one smaller hotel bathroom in my life. This one was shockingly small. It was functional for one person -- it had a nice-size vanity, and it did have a good shower -- but the size made it impossible for two people to get ready at the same time. Even the one person had to wait for the mirror to de-fog. The best things about the hotel - the bed, and knowing that the room would be non-smoking, because all Marriotts are. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction, used to be here, you just missed it, etc. etc.”
Reviews.Author: Kinikia1
Reviews.Content: Great location; service was not so great. Like other reviewers I felt it lacked character. My opinion is probably colored by the fact that the "gentleman" at the front desk was rude to me on check-in. There was a snafu with my reservations and I almost ended up with no place to stay and two teenagers in tow. I had spoken with Marriott directly and asked if this were the hotel next to Nordstrom on MI Ave, to avoid any confusion. They said yes, but apparently I had reserved with an outlying hotel. This one is IMMEDIATELY next to Nordstrom. The man at the front desk let me stay but told me "only this time" and then continued to lecture me. It was demeaning, but I was in a big city with no other decent reservations and felt stuck. I've stayed in Chicago many times and this is the only time I have almost cried at the front desk. The basketball court on the roof, which is advertised on the website, is no longer available - a disappointment to my children. They generally have only ONE elevator in service. The internet costs too much and works only sporadically. I paid for parking but the parking folks were not aware of it. The gift shop is not where it is supposed to be, never found it. The salon has moved. Nothing is where it is advertised in the hotel guide and half of the services are "out of service at this time". Almost nothing is as advertised or where/when it's supposed to be. Small rooms, but it is fine for a place to sleep in a good location. If you are accustomed to good service you will be disappointed and should take your business elsewhere. Perhaps it will be better once their renovations are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
