Reviews.Author: Bixby_Grant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference, which was also held in the hotel. The rooms were quite nice and clean -- VERY comfortable king-sized bed, good desk and chair, and two nice armchairs. Looks like the rooms have recently been redesigned. A nice feature was the full length mirror, which I don't see in a lot of hotels. Bathroom has nice tile floors and marble countertops. The room was larger than I was expecting for a single -- maybe I'm used to the hotel rooms in New York and London, but this felt like a ballroom compared to most hotel rooms I've been staying in recently. All of the staff were fantastic; very polite, very responsive, and very knowledgeable (with the exception of one Concierge, who didn't really seem to care about helping me, despite the fact that I was the only person at his desk -- the other 4 Concierges I spoke to, though, were great). This is a real nit-pick, but the lobby and the conference rooms' decor were a little dated, but based on a display in the conference area, it looks like those are about to be redesigned, too. This may only matter to people who like to stay in very modern and design-chic places, but I doubt those type of people will be staying at the Marriott anyway. The only qualm I have with this hotel is that the conference room I was in for two days had a LOT of noise above us -- I have no idea what was going on elsewhere in the hotel, but you could hear very large thuds above us. On two occasions, the chandeliers above us actually shook due to the large commotion. The location of this hotel is key: only a few blocks from Lake Michigan; a few blocks from the river; it's right on the Magnificent Mile, which has a ton of shopping and good restaurants; and it's one block from the subway, which can get you to Wrigley Field or US Cellular Field very quickly, for only 2 dollars! One note on the hotel: I stayed there in August, and the AC was on full blast. I'm not one that gets chilled easily, but it was FREEZING in all public spaces of the hotel, including the conference rooms. My room had a thermostat, which did a good job warming/chilling my personal space. Overall, I recommend staying here if you're traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Chicago stay!”
Reviews.Author: HI_50
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a magnificent stay in Chicago. I wish we could have stayed longer. The hotel was excellent in just about everything--but the absolute best is the service of their staff! The location is fabulous, it is on the main vein of downtown and within walking distance of many attractions. Being that it is at the Magnificent Mile is a treat in itself. Their facilities are great, and even though there was construction going on during our stay, I wasn't even aware of it. I think another great aspect is their concierge lounge--one of the very best I've seen. I could easily go on and on about how great it is. We know that we'll definitely stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in March 2007. This hotel is in a great location, perfect for shopping or if you are in the city for business or a convention. I was in town for a conference at the Hyatt Regency, which was less than a 10 minute walk from the Marriott. We had access to the concierge lounge, which offered a huge buffet breakfast with lots of choices. (The hotel restaurant was also attached to the concierge lounge, so anyone with out concierge access could pay for breakfast, although I think it $20 or $30 a piece for the breakfast buffet.) The staff was very friendly in the lounge/restaurant the cooks were even singing while they were making made-to-order omelets. We happened to be in town while there pre-March Madness basketball games going on in Chicago. The team and fans from Michigan State University (MSU) were also staying in the hotel while we were there. The location of this hotel was the best part, all of the shopping and restaurant choices you could want were right outside the door on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: metoooo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Location is perfect. Employees are so nice. Rooms are very very clean. I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel. Lawrence was so helpful and made every effort to make our stay special. As a travel agent, I would recommend this hotel to all my clients first when preparing a trip to Chicago. Teresa Duke

Reviews.Title: “Good, but large and busy, hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Magnificent Mile is a solid hotel, with a great location (right next to Nordstrom, a couple of blocks from the river, about 4 blocks from the Water Tower). I stayed in this hotel again in July for a work function over 1 week, and it remains good. The one drawback comes with its size - basically there are a lot of events happening in this hotel, and as a result the lobby will always be busy, the elevators can sometimes be overcrowded and slow, etc. All in all there's nothing patently bad with the hotel, I just can't think of anything to recommend it over say the Fairmont or other hotels in the area which I like better. I would like to see free wireless or high speed Internet make it as a service (right now it stands at over $10 a day, for something that comes for free at the lower-end Courtyard). Also the rooms (especially the bathrooms, which are institutional-beige and have horrible lighting) could use some sprucing up, and so could the amenities. Beds were very comfortable, and my room was spacious. The door personnel were great, especially upon departure on Friday when the area gets congested and they were able to put me on a towncar going to O'Hare rather quickly. Room cleanup can take a few hours as it's common in a hotel of this size. All in all, a middle-of-the-pack hotel. It may pay off to look around considering you will find some nicer offerings in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: itravel123
Reviews.Content: we got a fantastic deal on travelzoo, and really enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic. I loved the lobby bar. The rooms were nice, and we had a lake view. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandi312
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect. It's right on Michigan Ave and close to all the crazyness of MI Ave. -:) The only thing that annoyed me about the hotel is the noise. I could hear my neighbors loud and clear, and for some reason when we had the air conditioner on, there was this really loud rumbling noise which kept my friends up at night, but I slept okay. The beds are really comfy and the rooms are nice and clean. But what was funny was when we checked in the guy at the front desk told me the rooms are really small and since I asked for a "nice view" he gave me a room that was a little bigger. It was just an average room- nice and nothing special. For the area, the Grand Lux Cafe, Cheesecake Factory are great places for dinner. The North Ave beach is incredible! You won't even feel like you're in a city. Overall Chicago is just a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly magnificent”
Reviews.Author: pmcojm
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend visit to Chicago, having stayed at the Marriott Magnificent Mile with my fourteen year old daugther and eleven year old son. Most of the reviews here were so positive that I was expecting a really nice experience. I found, however, that this hotel is a very typical, convention-center type hotel, hosting large groups and tons of tourists. The lobby is large, teeming with people, and super noisy. Our room, with two full-size beds, was small, although the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice enough. The three of us felt quite cramped. Also, the street noise in our room on the 20th floor kept us up most of the night. On the good side, everyone working at the Marriott was very friendly and helpful and, although room service food was very expensive, they do offer a decent delivery pizza, and have a Starbuck's type coffee car in the lobby, where you can pick up a muffin and coffee in the morning. Also, the location on Michigan Avenue is great for shopping. All-in-all, our stay was ok, but next time we go to Chicago, we'll look for a larger room and someplace with a little more character.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be beat...”
Reviews.Author: danaleste
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Mag Mile on 6/22-6/24 with my cousin for a â€œgirls-weekendâ€�. I booked it the day before through Priceline at a rate of $137 (+ tax) through â€œName Your Own Priceâ€�. The hotel and staff were great. We were on the 14th floor but we didnâ€™t have a great view. I had requested a lake-view but they could not accommodate me for whatever reasons (but it wasnâ€™t a big deal). Rooms were clean and decently sized. The Marriott is in an excellent location! We basically walked everywhere we wanted to go. The pool area seemed to be nice although we didnâ€™t take a swim. There were ambulance sirens and car alarms which could be heard even on the 14th floor but it didnâ€™t keep us from sleeping. This hotel is normally priced for over $380 a night so for the price we paid, it was an excellent deal!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not the luxury I expected”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent business meeting. Pros: the location is perfect, right in the heart of the poshest part of downtown Chicago and close to everything. the beds were very comfortable and clean. the decor was fairly modern (although not the prettiest I've seen). the place has a nice buzz and full service lobby. cool news ticker TV screens in the elevators. Neighbor/street noise wasn't too bad. Cons: the room I had was definitely on the small side, especially for the $300-500 price it is usually charged for. there was no fridge or microwave. The high floor elevators were either partially broken one day or just overused because they took forever and were packed during certain hours of the day. Overall the place is nice, but I just feel like I've seen better and hipper hotels in this price range (check out the Park Hyatt lobby for one.) Unless I got a bargain rate, I think I would stay elsewhere for a luxury hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “(Mostly) Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Happyskies
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in April for a conference. The hotel was beautiful and the location was awesome. My room was very clean with nice linens and a great bathroom. I also had an unexpected view of the lake. Restaurant food was tasty but expensive. Try the breakfast buffet - it was wonderful. There are plenty of other restaurants within walking distance that offer a much better value for lunch and dinner. The basketball court on the roof was very cool. The gym was okay but the hot tub was out of order during my entire stay. The elevators were another problem. There were simply too few of them to handle such a large hotel, especially during a conference. I also noticed the housekeeping staff frequently used the guest elevators and would not allow guests to ride with them! That was especially annoying after waiting several minutes for an elevator. The only thing you could do was push the button and wait for another elevator, praying that it when it arrived there would be room in it for you. The staff (with the exception of the housekeeping staff in the elevators) was extremely helpful. When I was leaving the hotel the bellman arranged for me to take a Lincoln towncar to the airport that cost less than taxi fare, an unexpected bonus. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Chicago downtown area. I would try to avoid staying at this hotel if they are hosting particularly large conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Countcost
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the best locations if you want to stay in the shopping area. ESPN Zone is nearby to boot. Hotel was very clean and had good service. Met my high expectations for a Marriott level hotel. The only problem was the elevators were really slow. There was a large convention (always a problem on any hotel facilities) so beware for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: docmama1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. I traveled over Memorial day weekend to attend a medical conference. I traveled with my parents and my two children. We were on the 25th floor and had connecting rooms. One room seemed a little larger. Both had a lovely view of Michigan avenue, and a partial lake view. We even had a view of the fireworks shot off from navy pier two nights! Our rooms were immaculate, and seemed to have been recently redone with new carpet, drapes and furniture. Our windows opened. The beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was prompt every day with an attention to detail. My children swam at least twice a day! The pool wasn't huge but it was adequate for them and it was clean. It was open until 11pm. We ate dinner at Ventoso. The food and service was very good, though the room lacked ambience (no windows or view), The concierge was very helpful with practical tourist advice. We loved the hotel's location, an easy walk to the river or to the water tower. There are nice restaurants and shopping nearby. My son loved the lego store. We celebrated my daughter's birthday at the American Girl place. I highly recommend the show and restaurant if you have a preteen! We used the free shuttle and the city buses. I would gladly stay here again. It was reasonably priced, in my price range in an area of high end luxury hotels!

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay here”
Reviews.Author: tbgb12345
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! We got a fantastic rate thanks to DVD chicago hotel guy from tripadvisor ($109 a night). Just got back from a 4 night stay. What can I say? Location, location, location! It's in a really good location, has a fantastic lobby, lots of elevators, no waiting. The concierges were extremely helpful and knowledgeable and there were usually 2 or 3 on staff at any time. We (myself and two other women) had absolutely no complaints about this hotel, particularly at the price we got. A little, liveable-with complaint-beds were too soft. VERY GOOD DEAL FOR THE PRICE WE PAID!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cato16
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Marriott over Memorial Weekend. Rooms were decent size for Chicago (much bigger than when we stayed at the Palmer House). We had a lake view. We enjoyed the lobby bar. You can have a drink and still be a part of all the action. The location is perfect for shopping, dining, and going out, all of which are in walking distance. We ate 1 meal at Ventosu (the restaurant on the 4th floor), and the food was very good. We got a great rate on Travelzoo, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: magoorx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in May for a convention, booked at the "convention rate". Don't get me wrong, the hotel is exquisitely clean & staff overly nice. However, the room was tiny (we had 2DB). No fridge (to put in our leftover pizza or Thai food). Diffifult for wife & I to be in the bathroom at same time. Loved the desk chair & work area. Did not use the internet (did not want to pay $15/day). Instead went to Kinkos (located inside hotel lobby). Location was hotel's only saving grace, as it is right on Michigan avenue, & 2 blocks from Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JQuatt21
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a weekend trip to Chicago with a few buddies of mine. We stayed at the Marriott Chicago/Magnificent Mile. It was a 3 day, 2 night trip: Rooms: I have done a bunch of travel in the last couple of years and have stayed at many different types of hotels/resorts and different chains. At this Marriott, I thought that the beds in the rooms were some of the most comfortable that I have ever slept on. The pillows were extremely comfortable as well as the bed itself and the light featherbed that was on it. I have been told my other people that all Marriott beds are like this, but all I know is that the beds at this Marriott were extremely comfortable. The rooms contained an ironing board, Iron, Bath and Body Works Shampoo and Conditioner, plenty of towels, with a flat screen TV, small table and chairs, and high speed internet (available for a small fee). The room itself was not extremely big but had a decent view of the city. (I heard some rooms, the view is not so good!) The carpets and bathroom was clean which is always nice. The hallways were also quiet at night which was a plus. Lobby: We stayed at this Marriott over the weekend and the lobby and lobby bar were extremely busy. The lobby is an open space with lots of tables and couches for you to sit on, relax, and have a cocktail before heading out to the city for the night. The prices were reasonable for service at the bar. It was a very nice lobby experience. Also in the lobby was the bell desk, front desk, and the concierge which was very helpful in finding nearby restaurants and bars. Location: This hotel I believe is in a great location. It is right on Michigan Avenue in the heart of the â€œloop.â€� (I hope that is what the immediate downtown is called.) It is very close to â€œ Rush St. â€� and all of the hotspots of downtown. There is great shopping close as well as many great restaurants within walking distance. At the hotel, we valet parked our car with the hotel and never once removed it from the garage as we could walk anywhere we wanted to go or just take a short cab ride. Service: Check in was extremely quick. All we needed to do was give our last name and our reservation was pulled up. The staff was quick to have our bags brought upstairs and tell us where all of the amenities of the hotel were such as gift/sundry shop, pool, coffee bar, lobby bar etc.. The concierge located in the lobby was very helpful with making reservations and providing lists of nearby restaurants broken down by type of food and location. Finally, the valet and bellmen at the front entrance were very quick to hail us a cab, or to help us go in any direction that we needed. Pool: There is a pool located on the 9th floor (I think) but we did see or go in it. Overall, Our stay at the Marriott was great and provided a great â€œhome baseâ€� to go and do whatever we wanted to do that night in Chicago . I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and would stay there again if I was to once again, visit the Windy City .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: beetle33
Reviews.Content: I received an excellent price on priceline for this 3 star hotel. We were on the 42nd floor and had an excellent view of the city and the lake. Our room was located next to the elevators but we never were bothered by their sound (I don't recall hearing them at all)! The room was very clean. The concierge was also very friendly and helpful with directions. Please ignore all the other negative reviews, these people are whining and don't really know what they are talking about. A room on a low level will not have a great view (common sense)! Yes, many events are held at this hotel so the elevators may become filled at certain times (like early morning or around dinner/cocktail hour) but this is to be expected. If you are looking for a more affordable option (for chicago, mind you) stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: takeahike2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful room, lovely pool, good coffee, friendly and helpful staff. They even brought in a complimentary fridge for medicine. The only irritation was the Internet charge. Check travelzoo.com for special rates. Note: A car is unnecessary! Sights within 12 blocks are delightfully walkable, taxis are everywhere, shuttle vans go to/from airports, and it *is* possible to ride the train with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Should be Better value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: psu0904
Reviews.Content: Pros The property, as the name suggests, is in an awesome location with so many sights, shops, beautiful buildings, etc. If you arrive by car, use the valet parking because it is easier â€“ though it is $36/night. Even though I was there for one night, I did not need (or miss) having the car. The staff, as expected, was top notched; quick check in and out; helpful; pleasant; etc. Cons The room itself, in terms of its size, was below average for a four-star hotel. It was dark and, apart from the bed (Marriott beds are among the best), was just not up to snuff; it felt like a cave in there. Also, the room I had (2403) had no view to speak of, was at the end of the hallway â€“ almost right off the elevator, and I felt like it was among the worst on the floor. (Off course, I cannot confirm that it was the worst â€“ the location and other things lead me to feel this way.) As always, there was no wireless internet â€“ not even in the public areas. Whatâ€™s worse, members of my contingent who stayed at the Fairmont, commented that they had a much nicer room at a lower price *and* they said that had wireless access in the public areas. Isnâ€™t the Fairmont brand a member of the Marriott chain? If so, what gives? Finally, all but one of the elevators did not work for a part of the day (4/11). This hotel was one of the major hosts of the largest annual education conference â€“ tens of thousands of participants â€“ and the elevators were not working! What else can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but expected more because of the name”
Reviews.Author: GMan5431
Reviews.Content: Well, i usually dont stay at hotels this nice, so that being said this was a great hotel. Also, since i got a very discounted rate of $100 then i should not have much room to complain. Truth be told, this place for $100 in downtown Chicago is a steal. However, i had never been in a Marriott before and expected more. The place was clean and the staff was nice. The beds were awesome, very comfortable. Now time for the bad: they wouldnt let us play basketball, even though it was nice outside, they said the courts were not open until May. The pool was closed for a whole day because some kid, well you get the rest. The hote tub was closed most of the day as well. The game room is gone, a staff member told us it was taken out. The AC did not work, it was nice weather and they still had the building heat on so it was pretty warm in the room at night. Bottom line, this hotel is very nice and for $100 in this location is is great, but it wasnt as luxerious as i thought Marriott's usually are. G Man

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Magnificent Mile Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: u2bayooper
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from a weekend at the Marriott on the Magnificient Mile in Chicago. I got an awesome rate of $99 through Travelzoo! I believe it is usually over $200 a night. When we walked in my husband said "are you sure you got this for $99 a night?" It was beautiful! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The concierge gave wonderful advise and directions. No question was too small. The location was perfect--right on Michigan Ave. near all the shopping. The rooms are nice, although not big, but we weren't there much anyway. The beds were very comfortable. I'd stay at the Marriott for this great rate again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: jbasman
Reviews.Content: Quite unfriendly staff at this hotel. They must figure they don't get paid enough to smile... First night I was stuck in a room right next to the elevator shaft. Two hours of sleep was all I was able to get. Thankfully they found a different room for me for the remaining two nights, but out of the three people I dealt with to arrange this, not a single one had anything remotely apologetic to say about the discomfort and inconvenience. Another thing that was a minus for me, but may well be a plus for others is that the beds are extremely soft. You kind of get swallowed up by these things.

Reviews.Title: “Sloooooow elevators”
Reviews.Author: MVagusta
Reviews.Content: Great location and room was decent. Elevators were the slowest that I have ever experienced, other than the ones at the Marriott Time Square (must be a Marriott issue). Average wait time was at least 5 minutes here (if I am lucky). We had to resort to planning our trips up and down the hotel to minimize the use of the elevators. Got a great price for the weekend, but would think twice before staying here again...the elevators were just too annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lobby. Room below expectations”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Disappointing room by Marriott standards but being just a five minute walk from the Sears tower and a few minutes walk from subway this is perfect for the tourist and would have have been a 5 but for the room. The smart lobby is huge and includes a large bar, Starbucks and at the weekend I was there the place had quite a buzz. My room on the 40? something floor was perfectly adequate but below expectations for both decor and linen but being such a big hotel one could assume this varies throughout and I maybe I got unlucky or maybe it was the small window that gave the room a gloomy feel, however, the aircon was quiet and efficient. I stayed here maybe 3 years previous and did not recollect having same impression about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and overall had a good experience. Was on the 42nd floor facing west (away from the lake) with a good city view. The room was clean but felt rather cramped with a king bed. The concierge lounge, interestingly, is on the 4th floor, in what used to be one of the restaurants. It is large, quiet, and well-staffed. The breakfast is simply the complete buffet served at the adjoining restaurant (Ventuso); quite a deal considering it costs $17.95 if you had to pay. The evening snack is always cheese/crackers/fruit, salad, and one hot pasta--good, not great. Dessert was simply cookies, brownies, and mini-cheesecakes. The lounge was not open on Sat or Sun morning and coupons were not offered to MR elite (Gold) members. The fitness center included a cardio room and a weight room, separated by a small indoor pool. The cardio machines worked well and ventilation in the room was superior to the usual claustrophobic atmosphere of hotel fitness rooms. Next door to the Hotel was the Westfield Shopping Center, which housed Nordstrom's, and had a decent foodcourt. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. For those interested in the big 3 museum attractions (Field's, Shedd's, and Adler) there is a CTA bus that runs on Michigan Ave, on the same side of the Hotel, that will drop you off at the front entrance, much closer than the train will get you. In summary, a great location for an above-average convention hotel. Would stay again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Magnificent Mile ~ Stay Here While in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: thetripchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile while in Chicago on a business trip. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful, and the hotel is centrally located ~ step outside the doors and you're right on Chicago's Magnificent Mile. Our room was tastefully done and comfortable and had all the business amenities one might need. The staff was helpful and quick to respond. I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler84
Reviews.Content: I just spent a wonderfuI weekend at this hotel. The location was perdect for experiencing downtown Chicago and the room was very well appointed and comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Noisy Room Near Elevator Shaft”
Reviews.Author: hawkmanva
Reviews.Content: I love Marriottâ€™s so when I travel I try to get a Marriott. The problem with my room here had to do with being able to hear the Elevator car going up and down from the 34th floor. I moved the second night away from the elevator and I was fine. Nice rooms, clean comfortable bed. Nothing out of the ordinary. The restaurant was nice for dinner and for breakfast I had the free buffet that comes with the Concierge level. They have a hair salon in there for the last minute clip. The food is great and again the staff was very nice. If you aren't a marriott reward's member, do sign up.. I think Marriott has the best point program out there with the best chance of being able to actually redeem your points.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Turtle
Reviews.Content: This review is written by a business traveller that frequents Hilton and Marriott hotels throughout the US. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY Excellent choice for those staying downtown, wanting to be on Magnificent Mile. Service is top-notch, facilities and rooms are excellent. Views from high-floor rooms are excellent. Recommended to friends and family. FEATURES / PROS - contemporary / relative-new decor in all in-room and common areas. - all-new bedding and linens. - 32" Phillips flat-screen TVs. - Great views from rooms on the higher levels. - Curved shower bars. - Massaging showerheads. - 24-hour fitness facility. - One of the best conceirge lounges I have seen - it is tied into the adjacent restaurant, and features a full bar, two buffet areas, LCD/plasma TVs, and more. - Large lobby (sitting) area with bar. - Great service everywhere. CONS - Elevators can be some distance from your room, so ask for a room near the elevators. I did not notice any long elevator wait times, and so either the problem has been fixed since a previous reviewer mentioned it, or I happened to stay for five days without as many guests. Recommended to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to nab a great airfare from FLL to Chicago for the MLK Weekend. We were even luckier to nab a Travel Zoo special at the Marriott, $99/night. The hotel is huge and busy. But we were able to check-in to our room at 10 AM. Room 4129 is on the 41st Floor and faces west, giving a nice view of the Sears Tower and other beautiful down town buildings from the wall-to-wall, floor to ceiling windows. The room is average size, very clean and offers plenty of closet and drawer space. The lighting is good and there are plenty easy-to-reach electric outlets. The bed is like a piece of heaven, with good pillow top mattress, high thread count sheets, down comforter, and 3 standard size down pillows and 3 euro stuffed pillows...great spot to rest and watch the snow fall outside the window. The bath is a small (tub) but trendy with good towels and Bath Body Works amenities. The location of this hotel is ideal for site-seeing. It's front is on Michigan Av (Mag Mile) and back is on Rush Street. All the shopping and dining you could possibly want are steps from the doors. The closest subway stop is the red-line Grand Station, 3 blocks west of the Marriott on Grand Avenue. It's super easy to use the public transportation from the airport (we flew in/out of O'Hare). From O'Hare take the blue-line to Jackson and transfer via an underground tunnel (free transfer) to the red-line; then it's a couple stops to Grand. You could also get off the blue-line at the blue-line Grand Station and take the 65 bus toward navy pier. It stops at Rush and Illinois. So, it's a short one block walk. Best thing is it costs less than $2, what a deal! Chicago is a great town to visit and the Marriott is a fine hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hate the elavators!”
Reviews.Author: mrpapa93
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate from Travelzoo.com. The room was updated and clean. Heaters worked quietly and efficiently. The bathroom was clean and the water hot. The staff was friendly and courteous. The only complain and its a big one....it took forever for the elevators! Average wait was 5 minutes! And these are express elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Christmas ”
Reviews.Author: KCMOM-6
Reviews.Content: My family (three teenage boys) stayed at this property for 2 nights including Christmas Eve. We loved it! We had two rooms (adjoined) on the 34th floor and the view waking up Christmas morning was unforgettable. We also liked ESPN ZONe (watched the Chiefs game Saturday night), Big Bowl and Buca de Beppo for restaurants. The location was great, we walked to the Cathedral for midnight mass and never had a problem getting around the whole time we were there thanks to the Red Train and free Christmas shuttles to everywhere. Polly at the desk was great and Jorge the bellman. Thank you for a time we'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlutzky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mariott over a long weekend. The staff was very friendly. When we checked in my wife needed band aids and we asked where the gift shop was and the front desk person had them sent up. Within two minutes of arriving at our room, they knocked ont he door with the band aids. The room was nice, but very samll. It was basically big enough for one king bed and a chair. The TV reception was cloudy on a lot of the channels, and there were even blank channels when you were scrolling through. We got both breakfast and dinner once from room service, and both times the food arrived promptly and was very good. The location is great, right next to a mall and right in the middle of all the shopping on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: balsmb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for years [and in fact lived across the street from it when I lived in Chicago]. The hotel has gone downhill over those years. Service is an issue. For example, housekeeping in an effort to get their work done tried to get into my room to clean at 7:30 am when i was in the shower. Coffee requested for the next morning could not be delivered 1/2 hour earlier when called. Bar food order for a basic burger took almost 40 minutes. And clock was unplugged in my room when i got there, and the outlets were poorly grounded. So I don't give the hotel the benefit of the doubt anymore after this stay. Overall, there is much that needs to be focused upon to get this place back up to snuff. If you have a choice, stay at the Intercontinental across the street. Much more customer focused, up to date, and reliable. If the Marriott infuses some cash and training into this place, it might go back up to four stars.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Time”
Reviews.Author: a410traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property located in the heart of chicago. Our room, a double on the 35th floor was clean and well appointed including what seemed to be brand new carpeting. The only negative, as noted in earlier reviews, the bathrooom was unvented. A small but irritating fact that of course leads to steamy mirrors etc. The view from the large window was very nice and the office style chair was a real plus wwhile the easy chair was only marginally comfortable. The beds were upgraded and very comfortable. The Beanery in the lobby served tasty Starbucks coffee and some passable pastries. Points off for no microwave to warm the pastries. We chose the Ventoso restaurant for breakfast on Monday and as usual found nearly every item to be overpriced including a $14 buffet. We chose the $6 oatmeal which is a Marriott speciality. It comes with strawberries and blueberries as well as brown sugar and raisens. Actually well worth the price. The coffee on the other hand was terrible. I told the waiter as politely as I could that it was undrinkable and it was removed from the bill with an apology. Overall an A+

Reviews.Title: “Great location--All else as expected”
Reviews.Author: biztrvlr
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Rewards member, I know what to expect of Marriott Properties. This hotel was exactly as expected. Formal enough without being stuffy, decent service and value. The location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tagent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Aug 12-14. Absolutely loved this hotel. My girlfriend and I went for a girl's weekend away and thought the location was just perfect for what we needed. Shopping right there & close to everything. We walked all over even to Navy Pier. At night it was so nice to crawl into the big comfy bed and we slept like babies. For us it worked. Only thing to complain about is not knowing where everything was, our room at least, did not have any info on what the hotel offered. When we go back we will once again stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT MILE OVERLOOK”
Reviews.Author: loneagle113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Hotel in Chicago the 2nd week of July(06) and had a pleasant stay.The room was standard but the view on the 35th floor looking east to the lake was great. The bathroom was small by any standard and unvented. The pool was good and the fitness room excellent. The location was prime for our needs as we ate at a lot of different locations.Never did we eat in the hotel.We did have drinks at the bar in the main area on the 1st floor. Overall it worked out good for my wife and myself. :)

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel if you're staying downtown”
Reviews.Author: ehm1217
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here in early July -- and have stayed at this hotel about a half dozen times over the years. Service is excellent, rooms are OK, restaurant not great. But, if you want to stay in downtown this is a very good choice. Restaurants abound nearby and many attractions are easy to reach. You'll be in the middle of much of what Chicago has to offer. The hotel is older but has been maintained well. Big minus the lack of Internet service -- it's wired and costs $15 A DAY in the room. A big minus if you want to be online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KansasJayhawkers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Downtown Marriott in late June. If your business takes you to the downtown area of Chicago, this place is a must. This hotel sits on Michigan Ave and within walking distance to all of the great shopping located on the Magnificient 5/8 mile. The hotel is average on appearance. The lobby offers a nice sit down area, bar, and coffee shop. The rooms are SMALL in comparison to other Marriott's we have stayed. The rooms did not have coffee makers or hair dryers. The pool was a lap pool only 12'x38'. There is a nice work out room that offers cycles and free weights. Valet parking is offered for $35 a day or self parking for $22 a day. We opted for self parking and found it to be a bargain as we walked or bussed to all of tourist locations. Overall, I would rate this hotel as average due to the small rooms, lack of a swimming pool, no coffee pots or hair dryers.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: propete
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Marriott while on business in Chicago. It's hard to find a better location if you want to stay north of the river and on a busy street. The hotel kept pretty busy the whole time but I never saw long lines at the front desk. Pros: Well-sized rooms, awesome bed, ok workspace. I had a nice view from the 11th floor, facing west. Fitness area and gym are top notch; good equipment, size and fanastic basketball courts on the roof with a view to all the other high rises (try it, just to see the view). Room service was delivered within 5 mins of the specified time. Food quality was fairly good. Cons: Pricy internet access which was slow at times ($15 per day). No fridge or mini bar in the room. Trouble getting a comfortable room temperature; even had an engineer come by but he couldn't do anything about it. If you are in need for shoe shine, there is a lady by the elevators who does a fantastic job. I had breakfast from the coffee shop twice; service was poor and the food was so-so. Overall, I would be pleased if travel took me to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: KWLover23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott from June 4-7 while attending a conference at the hotel. It's a large hotel located right in the middle of great restaurants and shopping and near the river and Navy Pier. The rooms are clean and nicely appointed but a bit on the small side. The bed was very comfortable. As others have pointed out, the lobby is like Grand Central Station--a hub of activity throughout most of the day. I found the front desk staff to be professional and friendly. When I asked for a late check out, the clerk on duty promptly agreed. A $5 bottle of Evian water was accidentally added to my bill, and it was removed without a hassle when I pointed it out. They have a nice cardio room and a separate free weight room. While I prefer smaller hotels, the Marriott turned out to be better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, it was good”
Reviews.Author: Kimbmd
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit noisy...even from the 30th floor I could hear all of the traffic in the streets below and it goes on well into the night. On Friday night I could hear car alarms, horns, sirens etc until long after midnight. I had a king room on the end of the hall which was nice but not as spacious as some others I have seen. The bed was very comfortable and the lighting good as well. There are numerous restaurants within less than a block whichfor what one gets have a wider selection and better prices than the hotel's restaurant. There is a coffee shop in the lobby a bonus when you need your morning or afternoon caffiene fix. The gym is first rate and free to hotel guests. There are 5 or 6 elliptical machines, as many treadmills and a couple of bikes and stairsteppers in one room with several televisions. There is also a weight room with a full selection of dumbells/barbells and around 20 machines. The only negative thing that I can say is that they charge for high speed internet! It is almost $15 per day (noon to noon). You can use an 800 number for dial up service (if your ISP has one) and that call is free. I find it hard to believe that a hotel that charged almost $200 per night (and that was a discounted/meeting rate!) didn't provide high speed access for free. Many of the other places that I have stayed (Holiday Inn Express, Hampton Inn to name two in the last month) provide high speed or even wireless high speed service at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Skip It”
Reviews.Author: zwischen
Reviews.Content: Here's the good- helpful staff. nice linens super soft bed. now - the bad - loud and crowded. The SWAG or SNAG or something like that conference was there and certainly did not add to the atmosphere. The bathroom had mildew and the parking fee quoted of $22 turned into $35 because we didn't park the car in the garage ourselves. The pool (if thats what you want to call this tiny thing was filthy and the jacuzzi was tepid. Likewise they charged us an extra $20/night for an upgrade. ELite members are offered a gratis upgrade if available. Not so here! ANd our bill was incorrect - they charged us for breakfast when it was to be included. I'll stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Light Sleepers”
Reviews.Author: coyotesareus
Reviews.Content: This was the host hotel for an association meeting I attended. Overall, the hotel is good; quality food, staff, room, bed and upkeep. For the price, the room seemed small, but I think that is a Chicago thing. The killer is the outside noise. In a 27th floor room, the sirens and taxi horns sound like they are right outside. I hung up the do not disturb sign so the service staff would not remove the pile of pillows and sofa cushions I put up against the window to damp a little bit of the noise. My wife could hear sirens when I talked to her on the phone- no lie. Seriously, this place ties for the worst soundproofing ever. I've stayed in truckstop Super 8s that had the same decibal level. Overall, it is an OK place to spend an employer's money, but I would not spend my money or points here. I have this odd desire to sleep when I go to bed at night. When earplugs and a pillow over the head won't do it; that is a facilty problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: pinaykat
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Marriot. It was soo fun. The best part was the location. The hotel is in the center of the Magnificent Mile (Michigan and Ohio) and walking distance from all the cool shops. The people at the front desk were really cool and they gave us rooms that were on the 40th floor... all we had to do is ask. We took cabs everywhere and nothing was more than $10. The rooms were AWESOME! And the staff (especially the Conceirge) was so helpful and REALLY really nice. The beds were top notch and everything about the place was very classy. The lobby was always full of people because it was so inviting and really comfortable. The $35 valet fee was worth it because everyone was so nice and you were able to do ins and outs anytime you wanted (even though we left the car in the garage the whole time). It was a great experience at the Marriot. We were very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “" Great Staff " very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: deearihep
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff, anything that we needed from Front Desk, Bell Hop, Valet, Housekeeping, Conceirge, to persons behind the coffee shop counter(The Bean) all were very helpful and/in a timely manner. This hotel was in a great location, within walking distance to great shopping, if some places not in walking distance try public transportation(CTA)work just as well we had a car, it was cheaper and convenient to walk or use public transportation then it was to park downtown, we were already paying for valet parking at the hotel at $35.00 per day. The only complaint that I have is that the bathroom were small. Great place to Stay and Wonderful place for Conventions and Conferences.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott as good as or better than the rest ...”
Reviews.Author: clearlylovesfood
Reviews.Content: Spent our anniversary weekend (3/24 - 26,2006) at Marriott, Mag Mile. Pros: new bed w/ fabulous pillows, duvet .... Room was smallish but still worked. Location is just terrific ... everything (shopping, restaurants, entertainment within walking distance). Minor cons: requested early check-in wasn't ready for us. Desk billed incorrectly. They had our platinum certificate and then misplaced it. Problem was quickly resolved. Coffee bar (The Bean) is very understaffed (one person!). The hotel was totally full ... and I think they were all in the lobby area at one time! Very, very crowded and very, very loud. (You could escape to the 4th floor lounge). Major con: elite desk service at check-in could not have been colder. Definitely a departure from most Marriott properties. Overall, the pros win. This is probably the 20th time one of us has stayed at this property and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago over the weekend of March 10th and stayed in the Marriott and couldn't have been more pleased. Like most of the hotels in this area, the Marriott is convenient to just about everything. The weather was perfect and we walked about in a mile in every direction with the hotel being the center point. The concierge was friendly and knowledgeable (as most would expect), the room was somewhat small, but nicely appointed. We had a great view of the city from the 39th floor and the king bed was absolutely phenomenal. Sorry others did not have the wonderful stay that we had. I'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “This place is just AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: I decided to give the place one more try. I understood they had renovated the place, so in the spirit of objectivity, I decided to try it again. I find that I must report that this place is just as awful as it has been every time I've stayed there in the past 10 years. Check in is too time-consuming as the "elite" check-in area does not have a room map and take forever finding one. The room renovation is just awful--the furnishings are not business user-friendly, the beds and other furniture are strangely placed providing a very cramped room. The room coffee pot is hidden on a low shelf that was so remote that I had to call the front desk for assistance in finding it. The bedside phone didn't work, the desk phone cord was so stapled down that it wouldn't move more than 12 inches. Room services is just as inept as ever--bringing a $4 bottle of water when I specifically ordered "tap water with ice." As a Platinum member trying to use a one night free coupon (that I discussed at length ad nauseum at check in) was not applied to my final bill. The correct accounting of the final bill at the front desk at check out took forever. The management at this hotel just simply doesn't care. A warning from a multi-year Marriott Platinum Member: Stay ANYWHERE else in Chicago but this awful place.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshed from Remodeling, Meeting Staff was Great”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: Our group was attending a medical conference this past January and most of us stayed at the Marriott. While the rooms were considered small by many -- comparable to a NYC/Manhattan size room -- they were impressed by the recent renovations. One employee couldn't stop talking about how great the bedding and sheets were. We hosted a 15-person buffet lunch in the Old Towne room on the second floor. While the room was a little stuff -- no windows -- the chairs and boardroom table were up to date. Several people commented on them. The food was excellent and the catering manager was great to work with. The only problem was that the lunch was set a little too early and the staff was a bit too aggressive in cleaning up. Other than that, we will definitely consider this hotel for our next Chicago-based meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded Dance Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trudy3649
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my husband and two daughters for the Company Dance Convention. Overall, the hotel was fine. The room was nice - 40th floor - great view and comfortable beds. The convention space was clean and well staffed. There were problems with the elevators. It took at least 10 minutes to get an elevator. We were told that three of the six were broken which could have been the problem. Ended up taking the freight elevator to avoid the wait. Another problem is there is no cafe/restaurant on site. Now there are many restaurants easily within walking distance but when one is at a convention with children and there is only one hour to eat and waiting for an elevator eats up at least 10 minutes, it would be nice to be able to buy something quick and light. The staff was very friendly, especially our bellman - George. Housekeeping was a bit stingy with towels. I called to request extras and they brought up 4 wash cloths! I guess I had to specify bath towels. Valet Parking not recommended. Long lines at check out time and the turn around in front of the hotel is congested. Use the self park just down the street but be sure to get your ticket validated or you will pay $32 a day instead of $22. Have a great time in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “far too noisy”
Reviews.Author: eoetourhost
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt like the big impersonal convention hotel it is. Noise from the hallways and the almost constant sirens from Michigan Avenue ruined my sleep. The rooms were very good with nice comfortable beds, but some soundproofing is in order. Service was good if cold. You can do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, That's about it”
Reviews.Author: trainerstone
Reviews.Content: Perfect for shopping or touring around Chicago. The lobby is far too busy, even for the Marriott Platinum line. Service was dreadfully slow in the restaurants and room service. The elite lounge was closed on the weekends. It took them an hour to find my car. At one point, they told me they lost it. Then they charged me over $100 for the couple of days it was parked. The rooms are small and the hallways very noisy. This location is NOT worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: KirkHarrod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel has one entrance on Michigan Ave and one entrance on Rush St. It is in a perfect location on the Magnificent Mile. You are in walking distance to the Navy Pier, Water Tower, Hancock Center, etc. If you are a walker, you can walk easily to the Loop, Rush Street restaurant and bars, Chicago Theater, Millenium Park, etc. Public transportation is easy. There is a Red Line train station very close on Grand Ave, there are free trolleys to the Navy Pier, and taxis are plentiful. The hotel lobby was always packed with people hanging out in the lobby bar, which spills out into the entire lobby. Families were hanging in the lobby on couches, having cocktails, reading papers, and chatting at all hours! Check in was easy. We got there at 10:00 AM and they had a room ready for us! The elevators were fast. The hallways smeeled of new carpet. The room was very nice with a new furniture smell. We had a King bed and fold out couch. No balcony, but the large window gave us a view of Michigan Ave and Lake Michigan. The bed was very comfortable. Overall we were very pleased. The negatives: The elevators are VERY loud. It sounds like a subway train running under the hotel. In fact, that's what we thought the sound was at first. Then we realized... the trains don't run under the hotel that frequently! The bathroom is very small. We had a room service charge on our bill. We did not order room service! The front desk said someone must have signed the wrong room number! That's a trick I'll have to remember! Just sign the wrong room number?!? Hmmm.... How can the hotel let someone get away with this? Someone tried to slide a key in our door repeatedly at 1:30 am trying to get in the room. It woke me up and I looked out the peephole. When I did the guy quickly slipped off down the hall. Our rate for the holiday weekend was $229 per night and we used a $100 Marriott bonus bucks coupon. Overall it was a nice stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A Quick Shopping Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mopsa
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an excellent stay at this Marriott. I was very satisfied with this hotel, as were my traveling companions. The hotel was packed to the gills with people and yet our room was very quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was courteous and responsive -- providing extra amenities soon after they were requested. The view was fabulous. The room was clean. We had great luck with the valet parking as well. It was ideal for a weekend jaunt to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great- except cannot control room temperature”
Reviews.Author: 78traveler
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a better rating, had the HV/AC in my room been better. I was at the hotel for a conference. I would leave the room temp set at 60 every morning and when I would come back it would be HOT. 72 degrees with heat coming out the vent. I called down to the front desk and they told me that all the room are climate controlled at 72 degrees that means that even if you set the temp higher or lower, it won't work.....72 degrees! Why sets at room at 72?!?!?!...72 degrees is HOT and stuffy. The room was stuffy and although the bed was great it was very hot when I was sleeping. I couldn't even set the thermostat for the air or vent to circulate because only hot air came out. I met many other people staying at the hotel who had the same problem.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile
HotelInfo.Address: 540 N Michigan Ave., Chicago, IL 60611
